史上最不“刺客信条”的刺客信条，就如预告片所说的一样，这就是你的“奥德赛”。在风景优美，民风淳朴的古希腊爽玩吧！
主线完结评价：
  剧情密度比起源高到不知道哪里去了，所有的金色叹号都有自己的独特剧情，有些还有那么一点crpg的感觉，但是有的选择肢虽然对分支剧情有所影响，但是更多的还是一本道剧情，当然更不用说对主线剧情的影响了。主线剧情呢，只能说有点尴尬，但是最后大团圆还是看着很舒服的。当然，现代剧情虽然我觉得可有可无但是最后还是有惊喜的。希望阿育的下一作在继承本作成功的同时，开创出属于AC这个系列自己的RPG风格。
  音乐还是十分悦耳动听让人满意的，汉子和妹子唱船歌有不同的风味，值得都试一试。
  游戏性方面白金时间很爽，招架很爽，狂袭很爽，英雄一击更爽，我只能说这是清问号最好玩的一作AC了。

游戏性：9/10

总体： 8/10

일단 어렵습니다. 어려운게임이니까요. 맵은있으나 어디로 가야하는지 모르고, 모르는길 가봤더니 막혀있고(지금 능력으로 갈수없다.), 무턱대고 들어갔다가 띠용 보스네? 죽고, 지도상점 못찾았는데 의자 2개열고 보스만나고(?).
대충 여러모로 불친절한 게임입니다. 그래도 재밌어요. 불친절한걸 재미로 느낄수있는 진성M에게 추천합니다.

Oh boy. 
I eagerly anticipated this games launch, as I am sure many of you did. On the day this game was released I plunged into the Witcher world for one final time. I apologise for the late review, as I have been squeezing every superb side quest out of this materpiece. 
The story is beautiful, each quest providing thrilling and deep moments. Every character is gently tailored with top-notch voice acting and all have intricate story lines. The Witcher 3, brings back old characters that were adored within the first two games, and provides new dynamic characters. 
Each scene has been carefully thought about; every piece of diologue is intriguing. The combat is explosive, combining magic, alchemy and strength, one can play in the style they wish. The game is huge, the map expands across different vibrant terrians, each hosting different enemies and quests. The game possesses an abundance of georgius views, which is only enhanced by some of the greatest graphics to date.
The story will tamper with your emotions, as you grow to love the characters. The ending will leave you wanting more.

This game is a true masterpiece and one of the greatest if no the greates Open World RPG. of all time.

10/10

I purchased this after watching an early let's-play. I don't usually buy Early Access games, but this one seemed to be polished enough that I was willing to take a shot. As it turned out, the game I saw in that video was vastly different from its current state, which is tedious and unfun. I shelved it in hopes it would be improved as time went on.

Now I find that the game's developers have been actively censoring criticism on their forums; ignoring user feedback about balance issues and bugs in favor of adding new features. Darkest Dungeon looked promising in its early stages, but without the ability to roll back to that earlier state, I've effectively had a good game removed from my Steam library and replaced with one I don't enjoy.

There is two Mount & Blade games. There's the first game that's named only Mount & Blade but you'll want to pick up Mount & Blade: Warbands because Warbands have all the features the original game had including new animations and new items. Also note that the video below is Warbands footage.

Mount & Blade was developed by the Turkish TaleWorlds and published by Paradox Interactive who are also known for publishing titles such as Magicka, Galactic Civilizations II and Lead and Gold: Gangs of the Wild West. Mount & Blade is primarily a medieval sandbox game / RPG.
You start the game as a foreigner in Calderia and when you arrive you get attacked by a single thug in the middle of the street. A lonely merchant hears the commotion and suggests that you take care of it. This is meant only as an tutorial and you can refuse him in order to set your sights on bigger fish. You might be thinking why I'm calling this game a sandbox for then? Well, firstly you can more or less fill any role you might desire. Do you want to be a peaceful trader and create an economic empire? Yes, you can do that. Do you want to be a raging warlord in the service of a king, you can do that too. You can even become King yourself and hand out fiefs to your vassals which will attempt to protect them for you and gather armies in your name. Or you could just run a mercenary company in order to keep your freedom.

Lords, ladies, kings and death
In Calderia you got strict classes in society. Firstly you have the Nobles of Calderia, they will mostly wage war with each other but will work together and against the player depending on whenever they trust the player or not. In the case of war the King will elect a Marshal that will lead the nobles during a war campaign. When they manage to capture cities and castles the Nobles will start to vouch for people who should be awarded these prizes. Since fiefs gives a weekly income to the lords they will not back down from receiving one if they can help it. The player can really try the game of politics and persuade the nobles to "vote" for him so that the king will decide to award the fiefs to the player. The player can get the respect from other lords by doing favors for them or participating in battle with them. The marshal will be especially grateful for the people that answers to the call of battle and will most likely be one of the key contacts the player will have.

And here is where Mount & Blade shines: It's the politics system! You will be challenged throughout the entire game because the Calderians are very stubborn and old fashioned. The game will try to gather the lord (which are often spread out over the land) by hosting feasts in various places. There you can "court" ladies of the realm and possibly get a bride one beautiful day. The lords will also be good associates that will gladly help the player in the player's pursuits. The NPCs are somewhat flexible in this regard but

The game does have it's faults though. The AI of the opponents are somewhat weak and the controls feels a bit clunky. The characters in this game are very stiff and it will very few times be worth the effort of jumping (unless you're on a horse) and you will often curse the sluggish movement speed the characters have. The animations for attacking are uncomfortable and it's somewhat hard to aim thrusts. The bots doesn't seem to have that problem though and will pretty easily pull off quick and well aimed thrusts and chops at the player.

Multiplayer
The multiplayer in Mount & Blade: Warbands isn't perfect but it's very solid. You pick a gameplay mode: Conquest, Capture the Flag, Duels, Sieges, Deathmatches, you name it. And when you're in the game you pick a faction, a general class (Footman, Archer, Cavalry) and then you customize your gear. You don't have access to the entire arsenal of weapons but you have to earn it by killing opponents. The system rewards skilled players by making them harder to beat next time they spawn. Multiplayer in Mount & Blade is really difficult though and expect to fork out just as much time as learning how to play Team Fortress 2 at least. Some servers disables automatic parrying and enables friendly fire which beginners really suffers from but on the other hand, it does counter spamming 2 handed swings and blocking monsters pretty well. It will also make fights look more like a medieval fight would look like and could encourage teamwork (but it doesn't like all other multiplayer games).

The power of mods
But the best part is coming now: Mount & Blade uses python code and is pretty easy to script (not as easy as it could have been though) and right now many dozens of different mods have been released for the game. Some are historical simulations, others are just enhancements to the gameplay, others still change the game so it takes place in different settings like Star Wars and the Stone Ages. Sadly, some of the mods are somewhat amateurish. The Stone Age mod for example could use some work. But other mods like the Blood and Steel are very well made and additively entertaining to play.

Final Verdict
If I were to rate the game solely on it's vanilla game and single-player only I would rate it 4/6 as a good game but thanks to the vast majority of mods and the inclusion of multiplayer this game deserves as much as 5/6, if the animations were a lot smoother and the controls wasn't that clunky the game would have been entitled a perfect score of 6/6 but sadly, there's some thing not even the mighty force of modders can solve. Also, if it could have incorporated some sort of co-op it would also have deserved the highest score...

打到赤鬼后面的武士大将，外加三年前拿到火手和斧头的时候。我对这个游戏甚至是非常失望的。潜行系统糟烂，无限多P，想打个精英怪要清半个地图的仇恨小怪。我真的问自己这游戏真的够格和老贼自己的前作们相比吗？

事情在我打完鬼形部之后一转攻势，打火牛，那种感觉又回来了。正门武士，手里剑杀了之后真正的好好的拼了一次刀。

我 服 了。

没错，只狼有一万个缺点，什么加点和升级手太冗长，导致后面能用厉害的绝技和手的时候已经练出打铁了。什么潜行系统狗屎，什么剧情比以前单薄。

可是只狼有一个优点，就是对刚是真的爽。真的爽。就这一点，值了。

所以你说只狼能到什么层次，肯定比不过血源诅咒，大概黑魂3的水平可能还弱一筹。但是现在你要我在魂3和只狼中间选一个，我绝对会选只狼。

good

Kann man ein Spiel 1.0 nennen, dass sich eigentlich wie eine Beta anfühlt?
1.0 ist das Spiel sicher nicht. Noch lange nicht. Ich beschreibe mal kurz, warum.

[h1]Das Spiel wurde released, 1.0! Yay. Ist das Spiel nun besser als vorher?[/h1]

Ja, ist es. Aber 1.0 ist es noch lange nicht. Das Spiel läuft flüssiger als voher, aber Luft ist da auf jedenfall noch drin.
von 50-144 FPS ist alles drin, kommt darauf an wo man sich gerade befindet. Nur halt das ständige auf und ab führt sich nervigen rucklern. Außerdem befinden sich noch viele Bugs in diesem Spiel. Von "one-way" Zäunen bis hin zu Problemen mit dem neuen Vaulting System.
Aber am nervigsten sind die Lags. Das Spiel ist in den ersten 5 Minuten kaum spielbar.
Fürchterliches Rubberbanding führt dazu, dass man immer ein wenig zurück gesetzt wird. Gerade am Anfang, bei dem es darum geht, schnell die Feinde zu erlegen, nervt es besonders. Frust macht sich da schnell breit.

Für mich persönlich ist die neue Map auch etwas zu groß. Ja, sie ist schön gestaltet und macht auch Spaß, aber dadurch, dass es mehr Landmasse gibt, entwickelt sich das Spiel zu einem Lootsimulator, wenn man nicht gerade zu den Hotspots springt.
Ein weiterer Punkt ist, dass das Spiel mit einer Takrate von ungefähr 20hz läuft. das führt dazu, dass man ab und an geroffen wird, obwohl man schon hinter einer Wand steht oder Treffer, die man erzielt hat, nicht gewertet werden.
Nun... da schon die Server selbst bei ~20hz ruckeln, kann man wohl lange auf einen 60hz Server warten... leider.

[h1]Du spielst es dennoch, obwohl du es nicht empfehlen kannst?[/h1]

Ja, mir macht das Spiel dennoch Spaß. Gerade mit Freunden.
Aber das Spiel "1.0" zu nennen ist eine Frechheit. Das ist leider nur Geldmacherei. Es muss noch vieles passieren, damit das Spiel wirklich rund läuft. Versteht mich nicht falsch, mit dem letzten "Patch" ist vieles besser geworden, aber es läuft immer noch nicht so, als wäre das Spiel fertig.
Ich werde es also weiterhin auch noch spielen, nur zu 100% empfehlen kann ich es halt nicht.

So I haven't cleared an excessive amount of hours in this game yet, but I really like what I've played so far. There appears to be a lot of mystery to the game with a rich lore. I've been a fan of Conan since I was a little kid, and I'm happy to play a game that does the world justice. 

It plays a lot like Ark, but it doesn't suck when it comes to spawning in because in this game you don't have to worry about not being able to escape the starting area like in that game. The graphics are some of the best I've seen, and the crafting system works really well.

WARNING: There is a hack that some have been using.... Some folks think its funny to teleport into others peoples bases which sucks so I hope it will be addressed soon.

非常标准的生存游戏，有收集、有制作、有建造、有生理需求等内容，这样的搭配是一款生存游戏最典型的方向。不同于其他游戏的是它将玩家行动的范围封锁在了一个小小的木筏上，要如何驾驶这艘木筏来维持生存是游戏中唯一的目标。本作整体氛围和音乐给人的感觉都非常不错，但在游戏节奏掌控上有所欠缺，在游戏前期玩家需要抓紧时间来收集物资，制作净水机等物品，否则极有可能在第二天就会饿死。而当玩家衣食无忧过后，游戏节奏就变得非常缓慢，搞搞研究钓钓鱼，日子突然变得万分惬意，及时周围一直徘徊着一头鲨鱼，也不会是令人苦恼的事情。这让它非常适合一些休闲玩家和时间充裕的玩家。

I remember when in the 4th grade I saw the alpha for this game on Youtube and was hooked from the start. The game had such a unique charm to it that I truly wanted to play it but never could so I watched everything I could on it. Over the years I slowly forgot about it seeing it pop up time to time always made me happy seeing that the game was still progressing. Eventually around 8th Grade I hopped on steam one day to my suprise see Rimworld there on the Top Sellers and after a lot of pleading got the game for myself and what can I say. Rimworld is as sci-fi western colony buileder but for me it was mainly about the storytelling. The graphics are minimalistic abut serve amazingly for the gameplay and never bothered me one bit. But the storytelling aspect is why I keep coming back to this game nothing quite beats when your first colony dies to your utter incompetence at planning or reacting to an attack and my god does that happen a lot but slowly you start to learn to see your mistakes and what you need to do to improve whether it be chossing more hardy and stable colonists to not making your workshop with batteries inside out of wood (2 people died in the fire RIP) but it's always memorable an I always find myself sharing the moments of when my brave colonist got their eye shot out but kept fighting svaing the whole colony or the Noble who for the entirety of winter never did anything except sleep and eat frozen carcasses because he refused to cook. Man the moments I had before Self-Tend was added making Rich Explorer literally almost impossible cause of dying by infection by a squirrel bite. These stories though utterly dumb are just some reasons why I keep playing and I must say this game is 100% worth all the money you spend it's provided with hours of fun that i have no regrets with.

So, ich habe eine erste Session durch: Ein kompakte, grottenhäßliche Stadt mit in der Spitze 110 Tsd. Einwohnern. Es fehlt die Möglichkeit, die Bombe zu schmeißen. Die Meteoriten sind da doch zu schlapp.
 
Cities Skylines ist eine Fortführung / Neuauflage von Sim City mit z.T. den gleichen Macken. Z.B. die, daß die Bevölkerung ab einen gewissen Punkt bis auf unter einem Drittel absinkt, ohne daß es dafür einen hinreichenden Grund gäbe. Hat man die meisten Monumente, sitzt man das aus. Anderenfalls spült man mal mit einem Tsunami kräftig durch und läßt hernach die Abrißbirne durch die Ruinen kreisen. Danach geht es - vielleicht - wieder bergauf. Oder aber man ist pleite. Die Positionierung von Objekten ist eine Qual. Damit läßt sich kaum eine gescheite Raum-Planung umsetzen. Die Simulation ist z.T. mangelhaft. Da helfen nur Mods, Mods und Mods. Als eine Platform für einen virtuellen Modell-Bau reicht das Spiel wohl nicht. Es kommt aber nahe dran. 
 
Wesentlich ist das Folgende: Die gegebenen System-Anforderungen sind - höflich gesagt - irreführend. Das Spiel bricht auf meinem etwas älteren System mit 8 GB RAM und Quad-Core CPU ( Intel i5 ) immer wieder wg. mangelndem Arbeitsspeicher zussammen. Ursache dafür ist wohl die unzureichende GraKa ( AMD 6570, 1 GB ). Das äußert sich aber nicht in schlechter Grafik-Qualität sondern darin, daß die abertausenden Objekte wg. mangelnder Rechenkraft und mangelndem Arbeitsspeicher seitens der GraKa nicht gerechnet werden können, s.d. das System zwischen GraKa-Speicher und System-Speicher hin- und her-swappt ( Serialisierung der notwendigen Berechnungen ). Somit: Wer eine unterbemittelte GraKa hat, brauch erheblich mehr RAM! Und einen möglichst schnellen System-Bus. Und klar ist ebenso, daß man auch mit einer modernen GraKa schnell an Grenzen stoßen dürfte, denn der RAM- und Rechenbedarf steigt sehr grob nach oben hin abgeschätzt mit der Fakultät der Anzahl der Objekte. 
 
Ich schreibe das deswegen, weil in den Medien nie auf solche Details eingegangen wird. Die reproduzieren nur die Angaben des Publishers. Z.B. Chip. Denn die Frage ist: Bei wieviel Bewohnern ist auch auf einem aktuellen System Schluß? Darüber erfährt man nichts. 
 
Bescheuerter Weise werde ich bei der Veröffentlichung dieses Reviews zu eine Bewertung genötigt, die ich so gar nicht abgeben möchte. Das aber führt mich zu: In dubio contra reum!

Thumbs down because Doom Eternal threw away the greatness of Doom 2016 and decided to become a "Super Mario Tomb Raider" cartoon.

Doom Eternal is ok. It's not awful... a 6/10 lukewarm effort.  Maybe a thumbs down is too harsh, but it's such a step down in comparison to Doom 2016.  I played through the previous game several times, and probably will again.  But Doom Eternal... I was tired of it by the third mission.  I pushed through and completed it, but I doubt I'll ever replay it.

[b]The Pros[/b]:
* Gun play was slightly improved.  Exploiting enemy weak points to strip off weapons and armor was surprisingly fun, and a good way to encourage the use of weapons and mods other than just the super shotgun.  It did become repetitive by the end.  I wish it allowed for some variety instead of having a single checklist for how to beat each demon type you encounter.

[b]The Cons[/b]:
* The plot bored me.  They put a lot of effort into world building, creating a history of Sentinels and Maykrs, but there was no life to it.  It felt like a monotone history lecture recited by someone who doesn't care.  The villain was detached and forgettable, lacking the desperation and fear of Olivia Pierce.

* Characters were flat and under-utilized.  Samuel Hayden and Vega, instead of providing depth, urgency and atmosphere like in the previous game, are reduced to tour guides.  "Next go here... then go here... now go here... next go here..."  The new characters were pointless, especially the Deags.

* The parkour platforming infuriated me.  Double jump, double air dash, aerial flip off the uneven bars... how is this Doom?  Every time I saw a floating sarcophagus rise up from the depths to provide a jump point, it ruined the immersion.  The Doom Hunter Base... argh!  Are these demons trying to destroy humanity, or trying to help my cardio by building me a nifty obstacle course?

* The world felt empty and sterile.  We're saving the last remnants of humanity, but despite a dozen missions on earth, we never encounter a single human being beyond a radio broadcast and a 10 second cut scene on Mars Core.  They couldn't include a single mission near a human resistance base, or a cut scene of human resistance fighters struggling to protect civilians from the demonic hordes?  There is no attachment to the people you are supposedly saving.

Skip this game unless you really loved Doom 2016 and feel it's essential to play the sequel.  Then I suggest you wait to buy this game until the price is $15 or less.

- As a Scout, are you tired of being a loner marksman taking potshots from afar? Slap a Cryo Minelet overclock onto your SMG, dance toe-to-toe with them bugs in IFG field (AoE slow grenade) and become your team's favourite [strike] ammo wasting [/strike] crowd control dwarf.
- As an Engineer, are you tired of being that support guy whose turrets and platform gun shoot louder than his actual weapons? Stuff your grenade launcher with Fat Boi overclock and let [strike] that driller who 'accidentally' kills you with C4 [/strike] those bugs tremble in the radiation fallout of your nukes.
- As a Gunner, are you tired of feeling insecure every time you swap to your minuscule secondary weapon? Put Elephant Rounds in your revolver and start one-shotting every single [strike] lootbug [/strike] acid spitter from miles away.
- As a Driller, are you tired of holding your massive cryo cannon but feeling powerless against any bugs more than 20 meters away? Install Ice Spear on your canon and witness the icy doom of [strike] your teammates who are counting on your freezing for CC [/strike] that sneaky web spitter crawling on the ceiling.

Last but not least, any seasoned dwarves who feel like your day-to-day missions are no longer challenging are encouraged to enter the drop pod under effects of the various drinks offered at the Abyss Bar. Um ótimo jogo. Não existe uma linearidade entre os mapas, o que promove uma sensação de liberdade por parte do jogador, porém agrega maior possibilidade de falha pelo mesmo, o que não se caracteriza como problema. A história é interessante e presente, mas não é apresentada de forma direta e sucinta, permitindo ao jogador liberdade para interpretar os fatos e especular determinadas situações. 
    Referente a jogabilidade, está se mostrou lapidada e muito bem desenvolvida para um jogo 2D. Os movesets das armas são um ponto importante a se destacar positivamente. A dificuldade que gira em torno da carga máxima de equipamento torna o jogo extremamente interessante, uma vez que menos equipamentos promovem menos defesa, todavia mais agilidade.
    A dificuldade é alta, porém recompensadora. Senti falta de um maior leque de milagres para clérigos, mas os que existem são funcionais e suficientes. Ainda não finalizei usando um mago. A jogabilidade deve ser melhor usando controle, mas a do teclado não deixa a desejar.
No geral é realmente um excelente jogo, não sendo atoa a comparação à Dark Souls.

Simplesmente... Sensacional!
Um jogo que te prende até o final, uma história muito boa, rica em detalhes, gráficos lindos, personagens únicos e várias outras coisas fazem The Witcher 3 ser um jogo perfeito! Parabéns a CD PROJEKT RED por produzir essa obra de arte, que acabou se tornando o meu jogo favorito.

Em pouco tempo se tornou um dos meus jogos favoritos, de longe a história e a variedade de coisas é o que mais chama atenção, a ambientação é perfeita, os gráficos são satisfatórios, a jogabilidade é aceitável (e nada mais que isso), o jogo tem uma diversidade em tudo, armas, inimigos, aliados, finais, missões, locais, itens e afins. Contando com algumas mecânicas que deixam o gameplay extremamente agradável, como a modificação de armas ou do seu assentamento. Possui um fator replay que na minha opinião é gigante, contendo horas e mais horas de conteúdo, sem ficar repetitivo. Para complementar a trilha sonora é algo que me agradou muito, e deixou a atmosfera extremamente imersiva. Finalizando falando um pouco sobre os bugs, não foram muitos, mas durante a gameplay, nos lockpicks principalmente, o jogo ficava acelerado, tendo algumas situações com contador baseado em fps, era praticamente impossível fazer lockpick a mais de 100 fps, eu virava a presilha e ela já quebrava, tirando isso nada foi muito significante a ponto de me frustrar. Enfim, é um jogo que impressiona mesmo depois de 5 anos, com certeza vai render muitas horas de diversão...

I like ARK in general. Has dinosaurs, fantastic and prehistoric creatures. You better check system requirements as ARK doesn’t have good optimisation. You will lag like crazy or even worse won’t be able to play the game. 



Things I should point and talk about:


•In PvP mode, you must always be prepared to lose your progress in any moment. No matter if you just have started your thatch/wooden base, it will get raided just for the sake of ‘raiding’. 
The community has no mercy, I guess this is what makes the game very challenging other than too many carnivore spawns trying to eat you. 
Alpha, Beta and Mega tribes are what killed the fun of this game sadly, so
I recommend staying away from Officials, Russian and Turkish servers if you really want to enjoy. 
In PvP in my opinion, you need at least two tribe members those willingly play and help you out. If you start your tribe just after the reset, and you and members work enough, you can become a/an alpha/beta/omega tribe quickly. 
There are also 20x/50x/100x servers where you develop very fast and dont lose much of your work when raided. 
Check them out!


•PvE can be played solo. Instead of raiding and defending your base, you can tame and go on adventures around the map. Gather resources and weapons much easily and go to boss battles. 
But sadly you will get bored of it as quicker. 


•Theres breeding mechanic that I am in love with. You can breed several generations of your dinosaurs and can get pretty color/stat mutations as reward. 
Bred creatures are mostly much better than their parents and if you manage to do your selective breeding right, you can create potential creatures to take down enemies and bosses. 


•Theres no such thing as balanced gameplay in ARK and ARK is never meant to be a realistic game in any way. 
So don’t worry about stupid mechanics and not being accurate. 
Join modded servers and possibly ones with rules. Trust me you will not regret it if you find the right one but it may be very hard for you to find them as ARK with admins can be extremely overpowered and abusive. 


•Community is aged between 11-30 years old. But 11-17 are more common, so get prefered to see little kids complaining and using new cuss words they have just learned lol.
Yes

Вот вроде бы новый Tomb Raider делали те же люди, что и Deus Ex: Human Revolution... Но получилось то, что получилось. Нет, Лариска, конечно, няшка - вот честное слово, мне даже поначалу совестно было ронять ее со скал и заставлять бегать с дырой в боку, но потом девка стремительно превращается в терминатора и смотрится весьма картонным героем боевика - всякое сопереживание исчезает. И - да, по ходу игры одежда у героини изнашивается и рвется, но как-то уж очень целомудренно. 

Ролевая система присутствует разве что для галочки: действительно стоящих навыков всего пара штук, а экспа валит в немалых количествах, так что полная прокачка не представляет никакой проблемы.
С крафтом история та же. Нет, прикольно, конечно, прикрутить к винтовке гранатомет, но подобные существенные апдейты будут осуществляться строго сюжетно. А так: вы повышаете огневую мощь - враги одевают броню, и ничего, по большому счету, не меняется.

В общем и целом, все это дело воспринимается, как сингловая кампания очередной Call of Duty, сюжет настолько же бестолков и больше походит на оправдание всей беготне. Лара носится по острову, стреляет, поминутно падает в пропасти и "радует" десятками QTE, что, видимо, должно держать игрока в напряжении. Но напряжения нет, загадки просты, как пять копеек - даже так называемые "гробницы" представляют собой малюсенькие локации с, зачастую, одной единственной головоломкой. Лично я, не особо напрягаясь, пробежал игру за 17 часов с прогрессом 95%. Как развлечение на пару-тройку вечеров - самое оно, но реальных вызовов игра бросить не может.

Tomb Raider - одноразовое приключение. На случай, если просто нужно убить время.

If you would enjoy replicating the experience of building a criminal enterprise, localised entirely on an island, facing all the riguours one might expect from this endeavour, then this is your game.

This includes being blown up continuously by rivals (uncannily reminiscent of your own company), being stitched back together, generally living through the daily grind.

This would be an interesting game for either staticians or economists, had they nothing to do at the time.

The story mode is excellent and well worth experiencing, but the online mode (as with most things) leaves some things to be desired.

Right off the bat, I'm going to lay everything out. I have a fairly decent, new computer, and have yet to experience any bugs beyond occasionaly clipping through a bush. That being said, I understand that some users have had optimization issues (framerates, loading screens, etc) and serious bugs (unable to finish main quests, objectives not completing, etc).

However, I haven't experienced those, so I don't know if it's a good idea to review an experience I never had. Instead, I will focus on what I have experienced. And what I have experienced is a very fun game.

There are a lot of systems in KC:D that seem like they shouldn't work. The combat is slow, you can be attacked while fast travelling, and spend more than a little time trying not to starve to death. If you want to have a decent suit of armor, expect that to take up around three fourths of your inventory limit. Yet despite all this, the game is fun. Once you get a hang of the combat, pulling off good combos with blocks and ripostes mixed in is far more rewarding than the simple button mashing of many RPGs. Getting robbed while you travel and struggling to eat were real parts of survival in 15th century Bohemia. A full suit of armor is really heavy. As I play more, many things I found irritating at first seem to fit perfectly upon later reflection.

Of course, the game does have a few problems. The story, at least as far as I've gotten, is not exceptional. It's certainly coherent and somewhat compelling, but it's hardly the soul of the game. The save system is defintely janky (once you get your own bed it is easier). And the minigames (lockpicking, dice, etc) leave much to be desired.

That being said, I defintely would still recommend this game. If you meet the requirements (both in terms of PC and being willing to stick with it through a nearly 3 hour tutorial), this is a game that has a lot to offer.

I downloaded the game during the Free Weekend and was not disappointed. Mount And Blade: Warband looks as if it was built for Windows computers in the XP era, but it runs nicely in Windows 8. The attack system is unique, utilizing the mouse to determine the direction of your sword swing. If you run out of money early on in the game, like I did on the first time I played, there is an Arena in which you can fight computer players for money. Then you can use the money to buy things to sell other places to get more money. I think. I never really did understand the purpose of the sausages I bought.

One problem I had is the how the horse controls. The direction the horse faces is different from the direction the camera faces, and this can be a bit disorienting when trying to attack. Also, the horse doesn't stop when you let go of your forward button (For me, W). You have to slow it down manually using your back button (For me, S).

~PheonixSK13's sister

Engaging enough to immerse yourself for hours, but tough enough to keep you from playing for too long. It's a rare combination. This game is at the sweet spot where difficulty is high enough to be a challenge but not so challenging that it's unfair. In 185 hours I can count the truly unfair moments on one hand. Usually, there is a way I could have prepared better or been more cautious to avoid the problem. I think this game punishes mistakes harshly, and I think it's a good thing especially since the difficulty is adjustable for new players. Love the game. It's easily in my top 5 all time.

"You can do it, Madeline."

That's the little pep talk that the main character gives herself as the game starts. Celeste tells the story of Madeline's inner struggle as she tries to ascend to the peak of a mountain, and of all the doubts and fears she faces along the way. And what a gem of an experience it is!

This is not an easy game. While it "feels" hard from the very beginning and might make you want to quit every once in a while, it is never unfair. Celeste will test your patience by pushing the boundary of your skills ever so slightly with each new level you encounter. And just like Madeline, as you slowly progress in each chapter, dying over and over again, you too will struggle. But eventually you will master Madeline's moveset, and suddenly something that seemed impossible just a while ago becomes achievable.

So, much like the main character, you just have to keep repeating the mantra: "You can do it." Eventually, you really will! Celeste is a great example of a game that is about the journey, and not the destination.

I would definitely recommend Celeste to anyone who likes platformers.
If you like challenges, the gameplay will enrapture you. If not, then play it on easy mode just for the story and the amazing soundtrack.

To preface, I must have at least 3000 hours or so on this game outside of Steam. It's easily one of the best MMOs you can play at the time of writing this, despite what people say about the newest expansion. It has a unique vibe from everything to the menus to the fights. 

If you were ever a fan of Final Fantasy in the past, and enjoyed an MMO in your lifetime, you'll probably love this game after you get past the hurdle of catching up on the story. The only complaint I have of the game is that it is progressively more-and-more annoying to get into as a new player. The 'real' experience of the game, in my opinion, doesn't start until you've neared the end of the story quests, and are into a routine of things, logging in and executing that routine with great friends you've made, consistently leveling your 'classes' and upgrading gear.

I will say that it's primarily PvE-based, but it's clear the game was very much designed in this fashion. I love that hardcore end-game requires a lot of forethought and critical thinking, but rewards you with looking like a god amongst men to even seasoned players that just don't have the motivation to do such activities.

I rate a computer game based on a custom-built formula to discern its real-world value. It's quite simple, but an effective way to record my enjoyment of said game. It is:

2 Beers = 1 Hour of Fun.  In my town, a beer costs £4, so you tend to take your time with it...

Anyway... 2 beers = 1 hour of fun. And 2 beers = £8. Therefore, a game that costs say, £20, is equal to 5 beers (or 2 1/2 hours of fun). Still with me?

I picked up HOI4 for £24 after using a voucher I got for free. £24 = 6 beers = 3 hours of fun.

I've played, at time of writing, 467 hours of HOI4 since purchase. 467 hours of fun.

467 hours = 934 beers (467*2) = £3,736 (934*4)

Nearly 4 grand worth of enjoyment for less than 25 quid, and no hangover or liver failure to show for it.

10/10 - Best value game ever.

Jogo sensacional. Possui algumas mudanças em relação à versão antiga, mas como fã de carteirinha do original adorei a forma com que reviveram a franquia. Os gráficos são belíssimos (certifique-se de ter uma boa placa de vídeo), e todos os mapas explorados são muito bem construídos. Algumas mudanças na história original foram feitas, o que pode desagradar os puristas, mas não há nada exagerado. A adição do Mr. X em perseguição constante adiciona muito ao fator tensão transmitido pelo game. Confesso que sinto um pouco de falta da câmera fixa, marcada na série antiga e no remake do primeiro game, mas ainda assim achei válida a mudança para a câmera sobre o ombro, permite uma exploração melhor dos cenários. É um bom game para quem não conhece a série, vai agradar como jogo de suspense/terror, mas vai ser melhor aproveitado pelos que já jogaram a versão de 1998 e conhecem a série como um todo.

Ich halte Skyrim für ein gutes Spiel, dass viele Dinge im Vergleich zu seinen Vorgängern besser macht, manche aber auch schlechter. Ich muss als langjähriger Genießer der Reihe sagen, dass der Rollenspielaspekt, essenziell für TES  ebenso wie uninteressante Hauptstorys und große erkundbare Gebiete, nicht wirklich gut rübergebracht wurde. Es ist viel zu einfach gestrickt, und all Jene, die sich bereits darauf freuen, sich durch die ganzen Attribute, Fähigkeiten, Nebenfähigkeiten, Sternzeichen und Rassenbedingten Stärken zu wühlen, die werden vielleicht von diesem Aspekt des Spiels enttäuscht. Ich war geschockt wie lächerlich einfach es ist, hier Stufen aufzusteigen. Es hat zwar im Vergleich mit Morrowind viele Ecken und Kanten verloren, und die Atmosphäre hat mich in noch keinem Rollenspiel so lange gefesselt, aber das gesamte Werk wirkt irgendwie flacher als die Vorgänger, hat an Charakter verloren. Wenn man auf die Details achtet, wenn man sich einspielt, dann ist Himmelsrand mit einem Mal sehr klein und überschaubar. Man hat schon mit fast jedem Charakter gesprochen, ist sowohl Erzmagier, als auch Anführer der Diebesgilde, der Zuhörer der dunklen Bruderschaft und nebenbei der Oberaufsmaulhauer der Gefährten. Der Endgegner wurde ordentlich zusammengeschrien, vielleicht hat mach auch die DlCs, und während man als Vampirlord durch die Gegend gurkt und das erste Drachenblut auf abgelegenen Ascheinseln niedergestreckt hat, fragt man sich, was man noch tun kann. Dann kann man nur noch in einem der selbstgebauten und eingerichteten Häusern rumhängen und die adoptierten Kinder herumkommandieren. Tage deines Lebens sind auf immer verloren. Nun ja, worauf ich hinauswollte ist, dass dieses Spiel viel zu bieten hat, und eigentlich weiß ich nicht genau, warum ich Morrowind besser finde. Es ist einfach zu einfach, man kann alles problemlos erreichen. Morrowind hingegen ist immer schwer, man muss sich richtig skillen, um Ziele zu erreichen, muss sich spezialisieren, und wenn man dann nach Tagen der Arbeit der Anführer eines Hauses verrückter Hexenmeister ist, seine eigene kleine Festung erschafft und sich dann zu erinnern versucht, warum man noch mal auf dieser Insel ist, dann hat man das Gefühl, wirklich etwas erreicht zu haben. Dort fliegt einem Nichts zu. Es dauert, bis man nur eine einzige Stufe erreicht, und wird danach nicht leichter. Später fühlt man sich aber umso Mächtiger. Whiskey trinkt man wegen seines markanten, holzigen und starken Geschmacks, und Elder Scrolls spielt man (ich!) wegen komplexer Charakterindividualisierung und Taktik. Um bei meiner Metapher zu bleiben, Skyrim ist wie Whiskey mit Cola, einfacher zu Trinken, aber der Genießer und Kenner wird sich über die Kohlensäure beschweren. Außerdem kann man in Morrowind fliegen. Kannst du fliegen, du Drachenblut? Nein, du kannst nur durch die Gegend latschen und Leute anbrüllen. Scoll!
An illusion! What are you hiding?!

I'd been waiting an age for this game to come out, getting more excited the closer release got. If I'm honest, it's not quite what I expected. This is a survival game, collect resources, upgrade things, like your ship or multi tool and move on.

Discovering new species is fun to start with, but after only 20 hours game play, i'm bored with the game and feel as though i've paid too much for it.

Yes, its fun for a while, but it gets repetitive very quickly.

There were bugs on launch, with performance and with the pre-order starter ship, however these were fixed for the most part. Quite how a graphically simple game like this is so taxing on my computer is a surprise, but it is.

At is current price, I can't really recommend you buy it, at £40 it's not worth it, there is little to do and the different planets are much the same. Grinding resources out to make hyperspace jumps and so on is a pain too. The stations are basic, there is hardly anything to do.

The flight model pretty much controls your ship in the atmosphere, and low level flying is very tricky, especially when landing.

I like the game, but am simply bored with it.... why, well, its the missing content we were promised.

planetary physics
ship classes with meaningful differentiation
faction reputation with meaningful gameplay impact
homogenous resource availability
asteroid landings
space station and fleet destruction
large fleets
traveling freighters
large scale battles the player can join
in-atmosphere battles
NPCs outside trading posts and other docks
ringed planets
sand planets
flying between stars (as opposed to warping via the Galactic interface)
complex creature behaviour including environmental interaction
rivers
points of interest such as large structures and crashed freighters
hacking locked doors
radio chatter
interaction with other players

All the above were missing, and check out the review here to 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uTTPlqK8AnY

Contrast that to Elite Dangerous, I've spent 600 hours plus in the game, and have played it al least once a week since it was released on Beta almost 2 years ago.

My thumbs down review will change to thumbs up when the price drops to £15 for the game.
Great game. I love it. Nothing more to say.

Od gry Half-Life może niektórych odpychać grafika z lat 90, aczkolwiek uważam, że trzeba do tego podchodzić z dystansem i starać się nie zwracać większej uwagi na starą grafikę, niecodzienny movement, czy dziwne, czasami śmieszne błędy. Tak, w grze znajduję się dużo błędów, lecz są one praktycznie niezauważalne na pierwszy rzut oka, bywa, że np. utkniemy w ścianie, ale wystarczy na chwilę włączyć [i]noclip[/i] i wszystko wraca do normy.
To co zasługuję na szczególną uwagę to [b]fenomenalna FABUŁA[/b]! Jest ona ciekawa, wciągająca, a nawet trochę mroczna.
Nie będę ani trochę zdradzać fabuły, aby nikomu nie zepsuć frajdy z gry. Wysoce zalecam, aby przed zagraniem w [i]Half-Life 2[/i] zagrać w część pierwszą.

[b][i]Uważam, że Half-Life (1998r.) to gra, w którą każdy szanujący się gracz powinien zagrać![/i][/b]

GTA V oferuje przyjemny tryb dla jednego gracza który oczywiście ma swoje minusy np.
parę nudnych misji. Fabuła jest ok, nie jest super ciekawa, chociaż nie jest też super nudna. Zakończenie jest dość słabe w moim odczuciu (niektóre z nich niestety blokują też przejście gry na 100%). Misję z paroma wyjątkami są mega przyjemne, niestety po zrobieniu ich wszystkich wieje trochę nudą. Sam singleplayer 7.5/10. Skąd więc nie polecam tej gry? Ponieważ mamy 2020 rok i w większości przypadków jest ona kupowana ze względu na tryb online. I co jest z tym trybem nie tak? WIELE. GTA online nie przypomina tak naprawdę GTA a bardziej saint’s row. Początkujący gracz jest bezsilny w porównaniu do latających mioteł które strzelają rakietami. Sesje nawiedzają tony grieferów i hackerów pragnących zepsuć ci dzień. Zarabianie na początku to jeden wielki żart więc będziesz zapierdalał za najniższą krajową by zarobić na mieszkanie czy inną posiadłość pozwalającą zarobić więcej pieniędzy.
Nie chcesz by ktoś rozwalił twój ładunek więc będziesz używał glitchy na wyczyszczenie sesji. Apropos błędów to jest ich ogrom od takich które sprawiają zablokowanie postaci w miejscu gdzie jedynym wyjściem jest restart gry do takich który usuwają dorobek graczy.
Warto też wspomnieć o długawych loadingach (ok. 10 min), toksycznej społeczności i masie paywalli. Więc czy GTAO ma jakieś plusy? Fun grania z przyjaciółmi (chociaż też nie zawsze) Jeżeli masz zamiar kupić GTA V ze względu na tryb online a jesteś bardziej solo typem gracza to stanowczo odradzam.

This game is intense from start to finish.  For fans of the fallout series, this game definitely takes it to the next level and introduces a perspective from pre-war that kind of opens up a new idea.  There are multiple faction paths that you can take, which also give it a new edge in completing the game in a way that fallout has missed for some time.  The DLC here is significantly lacking, with the exception of Far Harbor (kind of like that swamps DLC from fallout 3, but much more forgiving instead of unloading 3 clips of bullets into each enemy just to have 3 more back them up) but overall it's great.

Replayability is questionable; how much time do you really want to spend building up communities only to think to yourself "i want to start a fresh game", and then you realize that your 140 hours of community building has to be restarted (or possibly ignored; let them die!).

This is an incredible game, with a large amount of depth. You play as a miner trying to escape a barren, randomly generated planet that has a strong age of empires 2 vibe visually. At first, you will build small coal powered machines to harvest your raw materials, then you will progress through a tech tree that allows you to build more interesting electrically powered machines, fresh weapons, multiple combat vehicles, trains, artillery, upgrades, and cool new gadgets to slap on your modular space miner suit (once researched and fabricated). The game will even help you to consider your choices morally. You can pollute the atmosphere as much as you would like but the result is angering the locals, who happen to be giant bug creatures that nurture only each other and hatred. Towards you. Perhaps you can find a way to placate the native fauna and still create a few thousand circuit boards an hour with a little luck and enough time on your hands. Whether you like resource management, or rpg like tree progression, whether you enjoy shooting nukes at alien insects from train car mounted artillery or seeing if you can use the in-game components to create an alarm to let you know when that one assembler in the corner runs out of plastic (again), be it making a bunch of weapons to tote like a mad man or simply seeing how many pairs of mechanical exo legs you can fit on your suit to become space sonic, this game will not leave you without options, nor will it force you to make any specific choice. Factorio also sports an excellent modding community, so you can add content or tweak game-play elements at your desire. Enjoy this game and its limitless potential, there are few like it and once you realize that you are the factory, you will expand without limit and most likely surprise yourself when you see what you are capable of.

This is my favourite metroidvania and probably one of my favourite games of all time. The art style is amazing and soundtrack is superb. I enjoyed meeting each in game character because they are all interesting and entertaining. All levels are really well thought out and connect really well. Most areas have more than one way to enter them, each utilising different abilities. The abilities are fun and well thought out. It's always clear where each power can be used. The movement feels great and the combat is challlenging and fun. Badges allow a ton of customisation options and they actually feel like they make a difference. I have played through it many times and it took me about 30 hours to beat the game, almost 60 hours to 100% it. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who loves platforming and a challenge.

这部游戏非常出色。因为我太喜欢这款游戏，所以评测难免过于主观。
    GTA5是一款电影味道十足的游戏，我在玩的时候总是不知不觉地融入游戏中，仿佛自己不是玩家，而是其中的角色。个人觉得主角的对话是一大亮点，使得主角的性格十分鲜明。过场动画不长，但是可以营造出很适合的气氛。从电影的角度来说，GTA5很好看。
    当然，归根结底这是一款游戏。作为游戏，GTA5很好玩。交通工具和武器非常丰富，给予我很强烈的新鲜感。在做任务时我总是十分投入，有点紧张，心跳加速，完成任务后很有成就感。
    游戏中塑造了一座富有生机，真实感十足的城市，留给玩家很大的探索空间。我觉得在这座城市里闲逛也是一件很有意思的事情。R星十分用心地加入许多细节、彩蛋。
    不过，个人对GTAOL兴趣不大，原因有二：一、经常断线。二、我觉得其中的任务不太动人。
    如果要评分的话，9.5/10.

The best game 2017

DOOM 2016 - Reviewed By Gooby

After the slow-paced survival horror experience known as Doom 3, ID Software grants us the much anticipated return of the fast-paced style of gameplay Doom has always been known for. Due to the technological advancement of graphics and gameplay, this title is by far the most violent and goriest Doom title the fans have ever seen.

[i]They are rage, brutal, without mercy. But you, you will be worse. Rip and tear, until it is done.[i]

PROS
- Very nice and detailed graphics
- Smooth performance due to good optimization
- Brutally gory and bloody
- Efficient weapons (unlike in Doom 3)
- The soundtrack
- Snapmap

CONS
- Corpses disappear
- Modding capacity next to non-existent (What the fuck, id?)
- Somewhat uninteresting story, but story's not the focus of Doom anyway

I don't recomend this game.

This is probably the easiest review I've ever given.  I will say right now that there are immersion breaking moments, I find myself irritated at the fact that stamina is used out of combat while sprinting, making on foot movement irritating and broken up when you just want to get to a location.  I found one NPC with an unfinished character model in a way where I could see through the area between her shoulders and her neck.  And even playing on the second highest difficulty, the game was laughably easy, I took several quests on 10 levels higher than my own and still only died a couple times, it just took more time.  Essentially the AI is kinda dumb and repeats itself frequently, but I will tell you now, THESE ARE NOT AT ALL TAKING AWAY FROM THE EXPERIENCE.

This is a masterfully crafted story with different choices for you to make.  It isn't the greatest freedom you've ever had in a video game, that is true, but there is surprisingly a lot.  I can see myself putting over 300 hours into this game and enjoying just about every bit of it.  So I'll start out with explaining what makes this game excellent.

The combat system is excellent.  I find myself using oils and potions and bombs and food quite frequently to stay alive and manage many fights as effectively as possible.  The only thing I don't get is why the crossbow is even a thing, it is incredibly useless.  It does so little damage that there is practically no reason to have it when a well timed sword blow and backstep will accomplish 10 times as much in a shorter time period.  There are two types of sword attacks, fast and heavy, and two types of dodges, a stamina using roll over a large distance and a free to use small hop in whatever direction you choose.  All of these I find useful.  Use of signs is also incredibly powerful, and different monsters are weak to different signs, I've found it useful to learn to use all of them effectively.

The story is in depth and powerful.  Characters are relatable.  The sex scenes are mature and well done (I'm looking at YOU Ride to Hell: Retribution with your completely shit and pointless sex scenes, nobody wants that kind of garbage).  You can choose to be tough guy Geralt, money focused Geralt, pious and kind hearted Geralt, or trading card game enthusiast Geralt.  There are different controlling factions in different areas that you can choose to help or hinder, and it makes variations in the story later on.

There is no character editor, but this is really not an issue.  You roleplay as Geralt of Rivia, and you help shape his personality with your choices.  I found myself helping people I randomly come across who needed help for free simply because I was there and could help, while witcher contracts I negotiated to earn me the most possible amount of money since I was going out of my way to help people who requested it.  So essentially a kind hearted money grabbing prick.  Also, fuck the eternal fire, those guys are assholes.

I've found so much fun and entertainment in this game, everything I've done so far I've had a hard time complaining about.  Choices line up with what I want and only once or twice I've found myself saying, "That isn't what I wanted at all!"  It is so easy to get immersed in this game to the point where you don't want to put it down despite having work in 6 hours and you need to get to bed.  I give this game an easy 8/8 r8 m8 no h8.

Just buy the damn game, it's worth every cent and more.

I had to change my review after playing further into this game. SE must have got some help from Ubisoft with making this game because the open world aspect of this game is exactly like a Ubisoft game. Empty, repetitive side missions, and nothing to do. It is so hard to enjoy open world games after playing RDR2 and Witcher 3. Those games show you what open world games should truly be. Open, massive worlds that feel alive. You will find none of that in this game. There are no armor pieces or upgrades you just change outfits. Speaking of outfits I go into my inventory and find absolutely ridiculous outfits. There's an Assassin's Creed outfit, why? That has no business in this game! Then another outfit that makes you look like some kind of alien it doesn't go with the theme of the game at all I don't know who decided that would be a good idea! I had a sword in my inventory automatically that was way better than any of the other weapons I had. Speaking of weapons there are very few. In chapter 3 the vendor had two weapons to buy, TWO! I didn't find any weapons by exploring just random potions and crap. There's no reason to explore. 

Monster hunts lol you go from witcher 3 monster hunts to this wow I feel like I'm playing a free mobile game. There's no story,nothing interesting at all, just go here kill this come back. That's all it is you run to a location where the monsters will be and hold LMB in and you're done. It feels exactly like an mmorpg. The combat is a joke I would take turn based combat back over this mess. Just hold LMB and hack away. 

I hope the story gets better I'm going to push through and beat that at least. I remember FFX and that had one of the best storylines ever. I was attached to the characters and loved progressing in the story I just had to finish it to see the ending. I do not get that same feeling here. The characters are so bland and not interesting at all. Why are they all hanging out anyways? Even FFXIII had a better story. The soundtrack in FFX was also incredible, very memorable from the very start of the game I was hooked. This game? Nothing so far worth mentioning.

10 years to develop this game and the final product is an empty world with copy and paste fetch quests all over the map. At least when Ubisoft does it they pump out a new copy and paste game every year or two. This game should have had way more content and depth for 10 years in development. Like what was the dev team doing for 10 years? Don't even get me started on that stupid car in this game my god. Anyways, glad I only paid 15 bucks. I don't feel completely cheated the devs have brought shame to the Final Fantasy series.

I have long been a fan of the RPG genre, but in recent years there haven't really been many games that have captivated me in the same manner as before. Divinity: Original Sin 2 on the other hand gave me a world I became lost in, and I loved it. 

The game feels a bit overwhelming at the start, since there are so many characters, combat abilities, attributes etc. The complexity of the game is one of it's greatest strengths though. It's a game that keeps on giving in every single aspects, and it does not disappoint. The developers have put so much care and effort into this game and it really shows. 

I you want an RPG with challenging & tactical combat, deep and complex character building, phenomenal world and characters, then this is the game for you.

*terá uns errinhos de portugues, num vou corrigir nao u.u

[h1] história [/h1]

pra começar essa analise irei começar falando sobre a história (sem dar spiler). A história é muito boa, quando tu começa a entender ela, isso pode demorar um tempo, depende muito da atenção que voce tem aos detlhes que o jogo te da, para entender completamente provavelmente voce tera de rejogar o jogo mais de 1 vez, mas quando voce enteder vai valer muito a pena. Muitas pessoas veem como um ponto negativo isso, porque voce acaba perdendo tempo com isso, mas eu acho que isso da mais valor replay ao jogo.

[h1] jogabilidade [/h1]

a jogabilidade é bem fluida, mas voce tem de morrer varias vezes em determinados pontos do jogo pra pegar o jeito de como passar do determinado local, mesma coisa com os bosses, geralmente voce tera de morrer vairias vezes para o mesmo boss até entender os ataques dele.

[h1] bosses [/h1]

o jogo tem uma variedade bem alta de bosses, contendo ao todo 47(segundo a fandom) bosses (isso se voce contar os gurreiros dos sonhos e os bosses do mundo dos sonhos), cada um com ataques unicos, o que torna a batalha ainda melhor. Como eu havia dito no ultimo topico, é necessario morrer varias vezes para entender como o boss funciona, mas quando voce consegue derrotalo é muito gratificante.

[h1] mapa [/h1]

como todo bom metroid vania, o jogo tem um mapa bem grande, com 17 areas (se contar o palacio branco e o abismo), cada area é unica com inimigos "tematicos" da area.

[h1] inimigos [/h1] 

o jogo conta com 151 inimigos no total, contando com bosses, os inimigos nao sao tao unicos quanto os bosses, mas sao inimigos comuns, né, da um desconto ai.

[h1] veredito [/h1]

o jogo com certeza vale a pena, voce consegue pegar 100 horas nele facilmente, nota final é um 9.8/10, mesmo que seja meu jogo favorito e eu veja ele como uma obra prima dos jogos, nao posso deixar passar os defeitos, como o excesso de paredes escondidas, ou alguns bugs que ele tinha a um tempo atras, mas foram corrigidos com as atts, enfim, compra o jogo ai meu consagrado

O jogo é muito bom e divertido e seu foco principal é jogar com os amigos (apesar de ser possível jogar sozinho). Há vários personagens que você pode desbloquear e minigames (como a arena e o back of barbarian) em que da pra gastar um bom tempinho jogando (principalmente se estiver com amigos). Não há uma história extremamente complexa por traz do jogo, mas analisando os cenários em que passamos enquanto jogamos, é possível ver que os ciadores tentaram colocar alguns mistérios, 
O jogo tem um modo insano (que deveria se chamar infernal porque é MUITO difícil) que é desbloqueado com os personagens em que você já zerou normalmente. É realmente um desafio tanto sozinho quanto com os amigos, já que a dificuldade aumenta em níveis extremos.
A pesar de todos pontos positivos, acredito que mais coisas poderiam ser adicionadas ao jogo, novos minigames, personagens, chefes e dlcs, fora isso, não tenho nenhuma crítica.

DOOM Eternal is in almost every way a dramatic improvement over its 2016 predecessor. The gunplay has been intensified to levels beyond anything I have ever seen in a single player FPS, and on nightmare difficulty this game will demand a lot of the player. The gameplay loop of 2016 has been distilled and refined, while simultaneously made more complex, with the additions of armor granting fire, demon weak points, and drastically increased mobility. In terms of pure gameplay nothing in this world plays like it, and I can't give it enough praise. The star of the game are definitely slayer gates, optional challenges within the campaign that will drop the player in an arena and subsequently spawn wave after wave of vicious demons that pushes the player to their limit and results in an adrenaline pumping challenge. 
The presentation is also top-notch, with absolutely beautiful graphics and varied environments that trade some of the aesthetic cohesion of the first game for draw dropping backdrops and arenas. Animations are beautiful, in a grotesque way, with the player able to watch the life drain from the eyes of a mancubus as they shove a large blade through their cerebral cortex.
The story is rather weak, admittedly, and there are some things that either aren't explained or resolved to the detriment of the game. From what I have seen the multiplayer is also a tad underwhelming, and from what I've seen no pair of demons can even come close to taking down a competent slayer. Overall however, this is a joyfully brutal and intense single player experience that is totally unique and exciting, and I would highly recommend.

I can't stand microtransactions! They're nothing more than greedy cash grabs and I WILL NOT buy any game that employs them. Unfortunately, I already bought Fallout 4 months ago. I'm currently stuck with the Fallout 4 Script Extender (F4SE) breaking every time Fallout4.exe updates to a new version, making the game UNstartable until F4SE is updated to match.

Also, ALL Creation Club content (except for the actual plugins) is PRE-downloaded, already having caused my hard drive usage to grow by 681Mb of unwanted files I'll never use. And that's just the initial 13 ridiculously overpriced bare-bones TINY Creation Club mods. Goodness knows how many Gb of unwanted files I'll have if Creation Club expands to host HUNDREDS of mods, including the "promised" large DLC-sized mods.

It's no use setting Steam to "Don't automatically update this game" because that option no longer exists. The nearest equivalent is "Update this game only when it's started", in conjunction with starting the game via the F4SE launcher ONLY (which apparently doesn't trigger Steam to update the game on startup). This should prevent any further unwanted Creation Club files being installed, and also prevent Fallout4.exe being updated frequently and breaking F4SE. I don't think Bethesda are actually fixing game bugs now, just installing the unwanted microtransaction content. In any case, the game is pretty well stable with the Unofficial Fallout 4 Patch mod installed, so I'm happy to play without "official" game updates.

However, I can't recommend the game as I strongly object to Bethesda *stealing* my hard drive space, and this method of PUSHING unwanted content delivery is entirely unacceptable. If it continues, I'll be uninstalling the game as it will have become nothing more than a hard drive space eating trojan. There are plenty of other games I can play while waiting for this debacle to blow over.

Ein Traum für Abenteurer! 
Denn schon nach einer kleinen Anfangsmission (die ihr nicht mal erfüllen müsst) in eurer Anfangsstadt entlässt man euch in eine fast grenzenlose Welt voller Burgen, Städte und Dörfern. 
Dazu: Das Spiel ist abhängig von eurem Charakter, das heißt, je nachdem ob euer Charakter z.B. männlich oder weiblich ist, welche Kindheit er hatte etc. Das alles entscheidet schon zu Beginn über euer Schicksal, denn zum Beispiel sind kämpfende Frauen nicht sehr beliebt bei den das Land dominierenden Fürsten.
Hinzu kommt die individuell anpassbare Grafik, Schwierigkeit und Kämpferanzahl auf dem Schlachtfeld. Denn zu beachten ist, dass selbst auf einfachstem Niveau die Gegner im Nahkampf ziemlich gut sind oder die gegnerischen Bogenschützen dennoch ihr Ziel treffen. Daher nicht einfach draufhauen, sonst habt ihr ein Problem, denn soltet ihr fallen, seid ihr zwar nicht tot, aber die Schlacht wird unterbrochen und ihr seid eventuell nicht stark genug in einer neuen Runde mitzukämpfen, was ziemlich sicher zu einem anderen Schlachtausgang führen wird als ihr gehofft habt.

Daher darf ich das Spiel nur empfehlen, denn selbst ich habe mehrere hundert Stunden damit zugebracht mir eigene Königreiche aufzubauen und andere Fürsten zu bekämpfen. Somit Daumen nach oben!

Превосходно проработанная игра. Ты почти сразу погружаешься в атмосферу средневекового мира. За основу игровой карты была взята реальная локация. Некоторые города и селения, которые представлены в игре, можно найти на настоящей карте Чехии.
 
Видно, что разработчики хорошо потрудились над игрой. Модели оружия, доспехов, одежда холопов/панов/рыцарей и тд. сделана просто восхитительно, что добавляет атмосферы игре. 

Так же мне понравилось, как ИНС реагируют на твой внешний вид (если ты грязный, вонючий, в драной одежде, то диалог будет начинаться примерно с таких фраз: иди помойся, иди купи новые вещи, не хочу говорить с тобой, бомжара и так далее). Если ты одет в латы, то будешь чаще слышать "Здравствуй, славный рыцарь". 

В каждом городе/селе у тебя своя репутация. Если она у тебя плохая, то купить/поговорить с кем-либо не получится, тебя пошлют. Но, можно дать денег, чтобы тебя простили. 

Во время передвижения по карте ты можешь наткнуться на засады разбойников. Естественно, они будут тебя грабить. На начальных стадиях игры лучше отдать все деньги, иначе убьют. Убежать будет не легко. 

Про еду и алкоголь. Если ты переел(показатель еды выше, чем 100), то станешь более медленным и неуклюжим. Выпил алкашки - готовься лицезреть веселуху на своём экране. Кстати о алкашке, бухая, ты можешь прокачивать умения "пьянство" и временно повышать уровень красноречия. 

Воровство сделано очень даже неплохо, как и стелс. Путём воровства в этой игре можно добыть если не все, то большую часть хороших вещей и денег. Взламывая замки на дверях/сундуках ты постепенно прокачиваешь навык воровства, и со временем ты можешь открывать более сложные замки, где лежит соответствующий лут. Если попался - либо платишь штраф, либо в тюрячку. 

Пару слов о боёвке. Она мне показалась весьма интересной, хоть и нуждается в доработке. Есть 6 направлений, куда ты можешь ударить. 
В игре несколько видов оружия ближнего боя: длинный меч, короткий меч, булава/боевой молот, топор, сабля. У каждого оружия свои особенности и стили боя. Из оружия для дальнего боя есть лук, к которому идёт куча различных стрел. Так же в игре есть множество щитов. 
К слову, если в Ведьмаке на тебя нападает 3+ врага, то ты их с лёгкостью уничтожаешь. Тут же, 3 противника может равняться смерти. 

Прошу не кидаться камнями, если что-то упустил, т.к. в игре очень и очень много различных механик/исключений/приколюх и тд. 

Из минусов я хочу выделить лишь одно: ГРЁБАНЫЕ КУСТЫ. Они слишком борзые. Растёт такой по середине дороги, я гоню на лошади и думаю, что сейчас пройду сквозь куст, но нет, он тебя останавливает, и это порой бесит. В остальном же, игра мне неимоверно понравилась, буду очень ждать вторую часть, но рекомендовать всем я её не стану. Это не та игра, где нужно спешить, она подразумевает медлительный и спокойный геймплей.

I was extremely hyped for this game. The trailers made it seem like it was going to make the previous games suck. 

Did it? No. Is it objectively better? I wouldn't say so. But I'm going to try to start with the good parts. This game is really fun, and really cool. It also brings up a lot of fond memories from the previous games and some parts are so full of feels. The starting classes also seem very well balanced and executed. The main bosses are really cool, especially the first Lord of Cinder. There are also a lot of amusing parts of the game, with every area being memorable, for better or worse. Don't buy the guide, because the only appropriate way to play this game for the first time is to go in blind. And I found a preference in going through most of the game solo.

But with the good, also comes some bad. For instance, I feel that this game's difficulty scales horribly. Its difficulty and engagement don't even have a curve, and more like jagged spikes. Also, the character creator is hit and miss, and generally overly serious. Because for one thing, you couldn't make your character fat, or give him silly proportions like in the previous games. And also, it's hard to make a good looking character. Character shading is also really bad, and I was only able to make a good looking white character because other skin tones just look unnatural. The hair also sucks, and the beards look horridly patchy. But, there are also some neat gimmicks, like some improvements to the character body type, and some cool tattoos, for example. Not going to go too much into detail here, so you'llp have to find out for yourself.

The world building & atmosphere in this game is fantastic. All the more so given it was essentially created by a single developer. 
Great use of lighting, animation & sound design throughout. (some minor bugs with each, but nothing game breaking in anyway)

The real hook of this game for me though is the level design. It's right up there with Dark Souls & Bloodborne when it comes to exploring & navigating that 3D metroidvania style world layout. The amount of times you open a new passageway & realize you've come full circle to a place you've been before is staggering!

I've played a lot of games this year, new & old - & this is up there as one of my favorites thus far! 
Looking forward to whatever comes next!

Игра определенно стоит своих денег. Для любителей создавать и разрушать миры - это ОНО! 
Да, игра сложная в освоении, ведь разработчики придумали свой мир. Каким он будет - решать тебе!  В игре нет ничего лишнего: религия, дипломатия, культура, наука и войны.  Можно играть по-разному. Масса преднастроек позволяет начинать так, как хочется: в нужную эпоху, с союзниками и без, на островах или столкнуться лбами на одном гиганском материке!
Жизнь с цивилизацией летит незаметно. Вроде только зашел и построил первый город поселенцами, а тут уже и час прошел. Причем , все игровое время проходит с интересом. Ты можешь: настраивать расстановку горожан в городе, улучшать здания, планировать постройки, следить за шпионами и дипломатами, вести переговоры об исследованиях, плести интриги против других держав и т.д. 
Анимация, музыка, механика игры - все на достойном уровне! 
10 поселенцев из 10 этой игре!

Yes

Points positifs: Jeu très immersif et très prenant. On se sent perdu face à toutes ces galaxies et système solaire à visiter. Le jeu nous laisse le choix de ce qui nous voulons faire : Explorer le plus de planètes possible ; faire du commerce de ressources ; devenir un pirate intergalactique en essayer de piller les autres vaisseaux. Les planètes sont très diversifiées. Il y a 4 races extraterrestres si je ne me trompe pas: cela apporte de nouvelles langues à apprendre et des nouvelles affinités à créer. Beaucoup de matériaux sont à notre disposition pour pouvoir crafter une large étendue de choses. 

Points négatifs: Les réglages initiaux ont été pour ma part très mal optimisés: on est obligé de redémarrer le jeu plusieurs fois pour bidouiller les réglages qui au passage ne changent pas grand chose, pour après nous rendre compte que nous n'avions pas sauvegardé le jeu. Tout ceci ma un peu gaché l'immersion er l'expérience de jeu. Au bout d'une dizaine d'heures vous commencerez à vous ennuyer fortement : les système solaires qui se ressemblent tous fortement ; les points d'intêret que le scan repère sur les planètes sont presque les mêmes et pour ma part certain sont complètement inutiles (ex: Plateforme commerciale). L'inventaire qui au début est difficle à gérer. Les micros freezes qui apparaissent lors de la découverte d'une nouvelle planète.

À noter: Le jeu est à eviter si vous avez une configuration modeste car il n'est pas très bien optimisé. Si vous aimez les jeux où vous avez des objectifs biens précis et où on vous dit précisément quoi faire et où aller ce jeu n'est pas fait pour vous car il vous laisse livré à vous même.

Bilan: Le jeu à beaucoup de points positifs comme négatifs mais pour ma part ses points négatifs sont moins importants car le jeu va beaucoup évoluer dans les mois avenir et qu'ils ne seront ou du moins je l'éspere plus d'actualité. 首先先说这款游戏的优点，这款游戏，可玩性其实是挺高的，朋友组队开黑吵吵闹闹我个人挺喜欢的。更新之后的新版本画质有所提高，所以就入了这款游戏（其实是借不到号白嫖），总结一下这是一款自由度很高，适合朋友开黑，或者是对生存竞技有兴趣的人的一款好游戏。接着咱们在说说这款游戏的缺点，①，服务器堪比土豆，甚至可以说比土豆还烂。玩个游戏买来98每个月还要交个30月供。②因为是小公司开发代码写的很随意外挂到处飞（挂做的比游戏还好）③其他游戏，都是吃显卡，或者是cpu什么的，这款游戏吃硬盘，没有个好硬盘加载地图都能加个1分钟④即使是更新之后优化还是一样的烂。⑤新地图BUG很多不少地方都能卡进去出不来。⑥意义不明的死亡白标，不知道死在这上面多少次了。总而言之这是一款有优点和缺点的游戏，但是如果非要让我在推荐和不推荐中选一个的话我选择不推荐，因为[spoiler]CNM小小一盘100人的游戏里，各路神仙，有能自由控制自己手臂长度的，有能一拳打爆飞机的，甚至还有能隔着半个地图，精准爆你头的。CNM我98买个游戏是为了看你们神仙打架吗？	[/spoiler]

This is genuinely my favorite game of all time and one I can sink hundreds of hours more in, but to do that I have to sink hundreds of dollars in to keep up. The DLC policy is abysmal. I picked up this game years ago whenever it was relatively new so it was much easier for me to keep up with the DLCs, but thinking of this as a new-comer, I can't imagine being expected to pay hundreds of dollars for a game I may not even like. Don't get me wrong the game is fantastic, but it is a leech on your wallet.

Update :
     They have altered the DLC policy or are planning to, I'm not quite sure because I haven't looked into it heavily, but from my understanding it allows people to more easily access the game. They have updated it to where there is a subscription service to access all DLC, which in my eyes allows newer players to test the waters before committing heavily into the game. I'm glad they have produced options for their players and I appreciate that. I would still warn that unless you absolutely love the game and are willing to sink time and money into understanding it, I would say this isn't for you, but if you are willing, this is a fantastic choice.

Este sem dúvidas foi o melhor jogo que comprei este ano. A soundtrack é absurdamente incrível, os gráficos são impecáveis, a jogabilidade não tem comparação. A história do jogo é muito boa e conhecê-lá é essencial para um melhor compreendimento a história completa do Bioshock, eu recomendo esse jogo a qualquer pessoa, mesmo sendo um jogo ''generalizado'' de FPS, ele atraí jogadores de outros estilos, assim como o meu. O mapa possui uma diversidade de itens que você pode coletar, upgrades e etc acho uma coisa bem legal que acrescenta um pouco mais no gameplay. Existem coisas que você só encontra no jogo se você realmente explorar o cenário, Um título incrível para os jogos de hoje em dia.

It's fun in that the RTS/RPG hybrid style is fresh, and the world is pretty and detailed enough, and all that. But gameplay wise, it's like the "critical mass" you need to escape micromanagement is always out of your range. Hire 10 more guys, get 10 more monsters attacking your base. And the adventure side of it is kind of fun, until RNG sends wave after wave of random patrols into you, and the attrition just keeps up. So you go back to trying to prepare for the next adventure, but the base attacks keep coming, keep scaling up as you get more prepared, so really you only net more micromanagement. As a kick in the ass bonus, battles generate corpses that lure predators, so you're still licking your wounds when OP spiders/raptors come for you. This game has alot of potential... and the first hours of gameplay are fun. Later in the game, the tedium keeps growing, the exploration is slowing, and it's really just a drag.

IN SHORT, AYA IS A BI*CH. 

游戏是个好游戏，但是后期操作的女主角艾雅令人不适。
巴耶克对你来说是什么呢？是爱你的丈夫，还是只是一把好用的刀子呢？
整个起源故事、整个巴耶克的血腥之旅，都是艾雅挑起来的。本来杀死真凶之后，巴耶克就可以回归家园的。
那个老男人从来不想参与什么政治，他想的就是和家人一起回归平静。

但是你，艾雅，才不甘心于平静。

你利用了巴耶克，艾雅。你知道他有多关心你，为了你的野望做任何事，而你对他从不曾拥有他对你那样炽烈的爱。
“我觉得我们最近太久没见面了，艾雅。”
“会吗？我感觉才分开没多久。”
是啊。
巴耶克东奔西走，双手染上鲜血。但你，艾雅，你在享受着野心一点点实现的过程。你怎么会感到痛苦呢？

平心而论，艾雅的操作手感还是不错的，双手菜刀快速连击颇爽快，轻弓四连也还凑合，没有鹰视野、没有技能，这些都还好。
但是我真的很讨厌这个角色。
我讨厌你们，育碧，把她强赛给我做主线剧情，不能切换。

高光时刻全部交给艾雅，留下真正做了一切的巴耶克默默在一旁守护，不打搅她的光彩。
只有我们知道八爷的事迹，他一路走来的传奇故事。

只有我们知道，在被艾雅巧妙地掩盖之前，是巴耶克提出了刺客的初始纲领，是他解决了上古维序者的威胁。
做的真棒阿，艾雅。

最后的分道扬镳，你好像没有什么不舍。
甚至，你都懒得给出理由。为什么？就是想离婚了，如此而已。

我看不懂政治，巴耶克看不懂政治。八爷也不想懂，他只想和心爱的妻子回到小村庄，继续过平静的生活。
可惜，见识过高层权势的女人，怎么会甘心回到柴米油盐的平淡生活呢？
分开了，也好。

至少还有巴耶克记住你们的儿子，卡慕。
一个我从来没有在艾雅口中听到的，他们被杀死的儿子的，名字。大概是她忘记了吧。
反正和篡权夺势比起来，这也不重要，对不对？

八爷，辛苦了。去锡瓦，回家吧。
愿诸神，保佑你内心的宁静。

Stellaris, from the day it was released, is the game that has finally replaced Masters of Orion 2 in my heart.

You can create your own species and civilization.  You can choose your ethics and civics.  You can have a fully populated galaxy, or play a lonely spacefaring race.  The other civilizations can come from a list of pre-made species, or you can create your own, or let them generate randomly.

Did I make a galaxy full of Orcs, Elves, Ents, Hobbits, Men, and Wizards?  Yes.  Yes I did.  No reason not to have a war for the Ring World in space.

If anything isnt quite right, you are sure to find something in the workshop to modify the game in whatever way you like.

Each update and expansion has only made the game more stable, more balanced, and more interesting.

I am honestly excited for every new story pack and expansion that Paradox puts out for this title.  They are well thought out and add so much content to the game.

This game is one that I will play for the next 25 years, just like I have continued to play Masters of Orion 2 for the Last 25.  Thanks Paradox!  You did it!

入手就怒玩了3天3夜，游戏性很强，不建议以下玩家入手。
1.深海恐惧症玩家，别听扯犊子什么美丽水世界，那是玩家一厢情愿起的名字，这游戏叫《深海迷航》。浅水区还有一番风景看，深海区尼玛要吓死爹了，各种怪东西，头一次见到利维坦当场就损失一条裤子。
2.密集恐惧症玩家，反正我作为密恐玩家，无法直视海底的珊瑚植物啥的。
3.方向感巨差的路痴，这游戏别说没地图，就是给我个地图我也找不到地方。海面长得都一样，去哪都要先找一下极光号残骸才能对照。你说下潜？下潜是不可能下潜的，这辈子都不会下潜，深海恐惧症只能海面漂一漂这样度日。

总体来讲可玩性还是很强，但体验性真的是我这种沙盒建造狂魔玩过最糟糕的。辛辛苦苦二十年，下潜回到解放前，永远都是被猎食者，为什么凝滞枪这种黑科技都有，就不能给我来把鱼叉呢。大型猎食者基本看到就得跑，就凭我那区区海蛾号，不够这些犊子挠一下的。别给我提独眼巨人号，这东西才是这游戏最大的坑，费半天劲造出来，发现是瞎眼废人号。跑得慢，眼睛瞎，没有攻击力，不开声呐鸡毛都看不见，开着声呐电池根本不够用，造出来就扔基地边上镇场子。
唯一一个感觉甚是威猛的海虾号，开始以为是环太平洋里面那种战斗力爆炸的机甲，造出来开开心心的跑去怒锤利维坦，然后...你死了。神魔列！多捞哦！简直是巨呆，我还是安心在海面种地为生吧。

Al principio tenia mis dudas de si comprarlo o no, y ahora básicamente se esta convirtiendo en uno de mis juegos favoritos, la verdad fue uno de los mejores juegos que pude haber pagado, llevo 60 horas jugandolo y no me canso, la historia me super atrapo. Es un juego con un millón de cosas para hacer, desde misiones secundarias hasta contratos para cazar diferentes tipos de bestias, espíritus y todo tipo de cosas sobrenaturales, vale la pena comprarlo, no se van a arrepentir, es una locura de juego.

Ich konnte das Spiel jetzt über das Wochenende (Gratiswochenende) anspielen und es hat mich von der ersten Sekunde an begeistert, weil wenn es mich nach einer halben Stunde anfängt zu langweilen und/oder schwer von der Steuerung oder spielbar ist, schmeiß ich sowas weg.
Das Spiel erinnert mich ein bisschen an SimCity, bloß auf dem Mars und mit anderen Bedingungen, aber trotzdem ist das Spiel mit dem nicht zu vergleichen, weil (man kann es nicht beschreiben) es dennoch in der Form anders aufgebaut ist.
Jedenfalls, wer das Bau von Städten mag, egal ob friedlich oder katastrophal (Herausforderung) oder was auch immer, kommt dort auf seine Kosten und ist auch für mich der Anreiz es demnächst zu kaufen.
Zwar hatte ich in einem Tutorium-Kapitel ein Mini-Bug (nach setzen des Stromspeichers stürzte das komplette Menü ab, somit das ganze Spiel), aber das war nicht schlimm, denn im Hauptspiel konnte ich mir das verlorende Wissen zum größten Teil ansammeln, was auch positiv ist.
Im Allgemeinen kann ich sagen, dass das Spiel eine Empfehlung wert ist ;)

This is a game for those who wants to have fun with friends, enjoy playing in coorperation with others, plan and design urban area's, run effiecently resource gathers and dont have the urge to show their own elite skills in favor of others.

I consider this game comparable too Kerbal Space Programm and Stationeers, where its more educative and coorperative instead of compettative gameplay, players who have mostly selfish goals in mind prolly will burn out fast in this game.
There is no instant grativication, certain actions can take a while to show effect, and the server community has to work as whole, with no much room for lone wolfs. Although the game is pretty well playable Solo, its stenghts and fun is in a small community that is working towards a shared goal.

This goal can be archieved ofcourse in several ways, do you go for a cutt-throat kapitalistic model, or a more communistic shared approach, Will you go green, or full out pollution destroying the world anyways.
Do you work together, or will you try to outsmart otherplayers by cornering the market, undercut the economy.

Its a small scale citybuilder, in where you are for once not the God who places houses out of the sky like most citybuilders, but you are now part as a citizen of this world, and have roles and jobs like any other citizen of this little world, and you'r actions do make impact on you're surroundings and fellow citizens.

Certainly its not the game thats for people who like action and fast pased gameplay, nor seeking a unlimited building game like Minecraft, everthing is slow in this game, you can play it on a snails pase, have long chats while sipping on a cold beer after a days hard work on your virtual town, making plans on how to continue, while admiring you days work

2とプリシークエルをみっちりやりこみ、2bro.さんの動画で前知識がある状態で
全ての実績やチャレンジなどを達成しつつMAPを全て埋めてDLC2のクリアまで
こなして大体150時間といった感じの内容でした。
進行条件にならない限りできるだけ敵を無視してもDLC除く本編全てのメイン・サイドミッションを
こなすとレベルキャップマックスになるのでレベル上げは意識しなくても良いかと思います。
(クルーチャレンジも大きな経験点になるのでそれもこなすのが良いでしょう)

FPSではありますがエイムの精密さはとくに求められるものではなく、
イベントでばら撒かれているレジェンダリー武器など活用しつつ色々探索するのが良いでしょう。
2までと比べてMAPが非常に大きいのでビークルは活用したほうが良いです。
MAP探索をする場合はその時点で受けられるミッションを全て受けておくと良いでしょう。
キャラ個性や台詞、頭が悪すぎる(誉め言葉)サイドミッションを楽しむことが
本当に面白いのでぜひ楽しんでください。
あと何気に音楽がとてつもなく良いです。
(とくにキラヴォルト、カタガワボール、オーレリア辺り)

ストリーム放送をネタとして扱っていて、元言語の声優さんも、
各国の吹き替えも配信者さんを採用しています。

難しい場合は攻略wikiの人気ビルドを手本にすれば良いかと思います。
敵と戦闘するのが面倒で辞めるのには惜しい作品です。

難点はやはりどこでも言われてるのですがエヴァの言動。
あとカリプソ姉弟の煽りに悪意がありすぎて遊びが無く面白味が無いところ。
よく言われる武器の性能がコロコロ変わるのは武器掘りを極めたい人以外は
ほぼ影響がなく、その時強いとされる武器を適当に使えばいい感じにはなっています。
