As a massive fan of the first TR trilogy, every time i see the TR or lara croft name come up in a new title, memories of those countless hours holding a PS1 controller rationing my flares and bullets come flooding back. Whislt never expecting the newer titles to be anything like those dark atmospheric days of actual tomb raiding, nearly all including the anniversary have been pretty dissapointing imo. Fortunately this TR 'Origins' of sorts is actually a really fun game. Sure its essentially a glorified corridor that you run down and around, and at times you get that God Of War-esq grossly simple, repetative button timing sequence that makes you question why they didnt just make it a cut scene... but those moments are rare enough that the overwhelming memory is of slick combat/hunting, awesome action sequences, and a weapon/skill upgrade path that keeps you motivated to keep searching and pumping the 'instincts' button to make sure you don't miss that essential crate.

Essentially you are playing an action movie, and as far as action movies go its a pretty good one- graphically gorgeous, brilliant environments to explore, exciting sequences and shootouts etc. Like many action movies though, it is plauged by absolutely woeful dialogue and exceedingly predictable plot, without taking that next step to make it an ironic commentary or reflexive bit of comedy. Her accent doesn't help one bit either - I cringed and shouted out more than a few WTF's during the course of the game. I think this was made all the more annoying, because as foundations for stories go, the exploration of the horrors which Lara went through to become THE Lara Croft, could not have been more promising. It could have been such an amazing, dark exploration/revelation of the human condition, and what someone is willing to do to survive. Sure it gets dark, and the first hours do reveal a sort of naive, sensative Lara unfamiliar with violence... but those dark bits were  just a bit too.... fluffy? I don't know, theres something of the cold, hard, engaging vibe that is just completely missing, but that is just my opinion.... 

That i guess is the defining point that will most influence your love or tolerance of this game- all these people in the reviews saying 'the best TR ever', surely must have been too young to have played the originals, and if so I can understand why you think it is the least @#$% of the new TR titles. This opportunity to play out the gritty origins of the tomb raider series excited me greatly, but failed to live up to my expectations of what that origins story could have been. If that is of no concern to you its a smooth action/adventure game, and either way is fun and worth a run through.
One of the best  games I have ever played! Great  voice acting and an immersive world.

Autant le dire tout de suite, ce jeu n'est pas pour tout le monde !
Si vous n'aimez pas de refaire en boucle les mêmes objectifs. Si vous n'aimez pas devoir refaire les même niveaux jusqu'à plus soif pour apprendre comment il fonctionne. Si vous n'aimez pas collecter des armes, de l'argent ou des cosmétiques ou même attendre quelques minutes des vagues d'ennemis. Ne jouez pas au jeu, il ne vous apportera rien. Après, si vous avez une copie peu cher et ou vous pensez rester dessus un minimum de temps, le jeu comporte énormément de qualité. 

Mais, parlons des défauts.
Le jeu n'est plus optimisé depuis longtemps, certaines cartes demande de piocher allègrement dans les entrailles de votre ordinateur toute la puissance disponible et si votre ordinateur est pas très vieux, vous deverez jouer avec une vingtaine d'image par seconde. Pour avoir jouer avec le maximum (60 i/s) et oscillant entre 8 et 24, je vous déconseille réellement d'aller dans les difficulté les plus compliqué si votre ordinateur n'est pas robuste. J'ai connu le jeu quand il était encore très stable. Après le jeu est loin d'être moche mais loin d'être transcendant. Les modélisation sont malheureusement quelconque de même que la direction général n'a rien de particulier. Les environnements sont gris, désaturés, ce qui renforce ce côté banal. Certains environnements extérieurs sont aussi extrêmement mal fait ; la végétation est très mal rendu. 

Le jeu s'avère extrêmement redondant. Comme dit en introduction, vous referez généralement les mêmes cartes plusieurs fois. Avec peu de changement entre deux missions, malgré leur communication vantant les mérites d'un changement dans les niveaux. Très souvent, il suffit d'attendre à un endroit spécifique pendant quelques poignés de minutes (de 30 secondes à 4 minutes). De plus, le jeu possède une myriade de bugs, allant des plus communes (certaines têtes restent bloqué dans les portes, c'est drôle mais ne change rien) au plus dérangeant (des fois certains niveaux qui sont infaisable, voir certains gardes qui passe par le mur par exemple). Mais un relancement de la carte permet de corriger une bonne partie des problèmes pour la majorité des gens (sur les 4 ordinateur testé, le jeu est démarrable).

L'interface est une plaie à suivre, elle n'est pas pratique et il y a trop d'options. Après quelques heures d'apprentissage, on a toujours du mal à choisir ses missions dans la liste. Je trouve cela dommage car j'ai connu le jeu il y a longtemps et je trouvais l'interface bien moins complexe. Mais l'ajout d'options à malheureusement rendu l'interface beaucoup moins clair.

Le multijoueur coopération peut autant être une perte de temps qu'un réel avantage. Il suffit de ne pas avoir les bonnes personnes pour subir une partie bien mauvaise. Il m'est déjà arrivé de voir l'hôte kicker quelques membres avant de finir la mission car ils étaient mauvais et de même certains joueurs ne font pas les choses les plus simple pourtant rappeler gentiment. De plus, il me semble qu'à certain moment, trouver des parties intéressante relève de l'incertitude. Mais je n'ai jamais eu de problème avec ça. Le jeu seul peut-être interéssant, mais seulement en tant que challenge. L'ia malgré les ajouts peut se révelé bien plus utiles que certains joueurs mais n'est pas exampt de nombreux défaut (bien qu'une partie à été corrigé depuis). Les cheaters y sont assez omniprésent, donc faite attention si vous voulez jouer legit. Actuellement à 900h, je n'en ai pas trouver énormément (mais je joue beaucoup moins depuis).

Beaucoup parlent de problème avec les dlc. Malgré le prix, ils ne sont pas obligatoires. Rajouter le groupe de Payday sur Steam ajoute une bonne partie des armes de la catégorie des dlc. Les stats y sont équivalent.

Et maintenant des nombreuses qualités !

Le jeu est extrêmement fun. Le plaisir des armes est intense. Les animations y sont très bien, le rendu excellent et défourailler des tonnes de policiers y s'avère extrêmment plaisant. Un côté des anciens fps qui revient. Pas de reflexion, il suffit de tuer. Et si cela ne vous amuse plus, deux armes identiques avec des modifications différentes peut même changer le plaisir. Sur mes premières partie j'avais pris l'habitude d'ajouter toute les modifications à mes armes, les rendant moche et peu marrante. En les allégeant quelques peu, j'y est retrouvé un plaisir de rejouer avec. Sachant qu'il possède énormément d'arme (et que le dlc est vendu en gros), recommencer les missions c'est aussi varié son équipement. Et c'est bien le gros point fort du jeu.

Beaucoup de personnalisation ! Que ce soit avec les armes ou les compétence, il y a moyen de tester pleins de possibilités différentes, surtout si vous aimez jouer à des jeux comme Diablo. Ici, deux armes possèdes des animations différentes ce qui permet étrangement de croire qu'on possède réellement deux armes avec des statistiques différente. Alors qu'il n'en est rien. De même, des nouveaux modes de jeux ont été ajoutés dans des patchs, classique mais toujours sympa ajoutant de la difficulté pour certaines. Beaucoup de niveau propose aussi la nouveauté de cet épisode :

L'infiltration ! Un jeu d'infiltration horripilant mais variant du bourrinage. Dans ces verisons alternatives des niveaux, très souvent se faire repérer signifie que le jeu passe en bourrinage. L'apprentissage de ces niveaux s'avèrent fastidieuse mais après avoir les avoir bien appris, on joue avec les gardes et ont s'amuse à faire des choses encore plus débile. Pour faire simple, au début du jeu on essaie de mettre le maximum de chance à notre côté en costard avec des armes sillencieuse. Puis vint la 99ème fois où on s'amuse à porter un gilet pare-balle et des lances roquettes qui nous rendent que peu discret. J'omet volontairement les bugs lié à ce mode de jeu, car j'en ai parlé dans ma partie négative). Ces niveaux sont généralement réalisé à haute difficulté par de petites équipes ou par des débutants, car le jeu propose plusieurs difficultés :

La difficulté justement, est un des points positif. Il y en a pour tout les goûts. Certaines cartes sont plus faciles que d'autre, mais les developpeur, en ajoutant de nouvelles possibilités à nos personnages ont aussi augmenter la difficulté, jusqu'au summun : Le One Down. En gros, vous pourrez ne vous relevez qu'une fois et les ennemis sont beaucoup plus violent. Le problème de cette difficulté réside dans les archétypes. A ce niveau, très souvent les arbres de compétences et armes se ressemblent, ce qui contraint certaines armes aux oubliettes. De plus, la difficulté étant élevé, il est réservé pour les joueurs acharnés, ce qui empêche de faire une partie correcte avec quatre personnes intéressante, sans avoir d'équipe au préalable, ce qui permet d'enchaîné avec les joueurs.

Une personnalisation de masque, d'arme, et vous voilà avec quatre inconnu marrant qui enchaîne des partie. Autant j'ai croisé des abrutis, autant j'ai croisé énormément de personne sympathique. Mais le jeu se révèle extrêmement plaisant avec des amis. Que ce soit par discord ou en message, jouer avec des gens que l'on connait de manière régulière est toujours appréciable. Surtout la découverte où ne on connait pas les niveaux et qu'on échoue à trouver comment faire, raté et déclencher pleins d'alarmes. Ce sont des souvenirs drôle et vraiment sympathique, que je conseil à tout le monde de faire. Jouer entre amis pour découvrir le jeu, et vous apprécierez peut-être ce qui ne vous faisait pas forcément envie à la base.

L'univers, retranscrit dans les dialogues, dans les personnages et dans les courts-métrage deamande de s'y intéresser. Mais les grosses ficelles narratives pastichant les films d'action Hollywoodien est une franche réussite, d'autant que la bande son s'avère extrêmement bien adapté. Certains niveaux sont même des relectures en jeu vidéo de certains films, comme John Wick ou Scarface. 

[Trop long, conclusion dans les commentaires]

М&B - превосходит все ожидания. Сложно найти что-то действительно похожее. Разработчики искуссно совместили в одной игре ролевые элементы, стратегию и слэшер. Проходя стандартную кампанию я действительно почувствовал себя средневековым лордом, борющимся за власть в королевстве. Интриги, подставы, торговля, набеги на караваны, грабеж, массовые сражения плечом к плечу со своими воинами, захват и оборона замков и городов. Все соткано в M&B на высшем уровне. Надеюсь Caribbean! сможет затянуть меня так же как и Warband.

(updated in 2/1/2019) While the idea of this game is amazing: it's chilling when you have to survive starting form nothing into the top of the food chain. However, there are many number or reasons and issues that I cannot recommend the game because of it's performance issues and bugs. Especially since WildCard Studios has mentioned that they are not going to continue fixing ARK after the release of Atlas::

1. You will have more negative than positive memories from this game. The giant amount of users play to destroy for fun, troll and hack is more than 60% of the community. Hours of progress only to be wiped in seconds.


2. The current problems will most likely never to be fixed. After Atlas comes out, which is pretty much build 80% from ARK's assets (because it was supposed to be another ARK DLC) there is no longer a reason to fix the destruction that Extinction DLC brought to us. If anything its a reason for developer to destroy their old game in order to get players to move to the next.


3. The time requirements for servers and taming (gameplay) have an effect on the whole player base. If you cannot afford to be online long periods of times you should not pick this game as your first choice in Steam. This is only considered only for Youtubers who get money from their gaming content and can afford to be long persiods of time online in a server.


4. Due to the toxic community this is not recommended game to anyone. Especially for young audience or players could suffer from serious harrasment and bullying by other players. Even grown adults appear to have gone back 7 years old on certain areas.


5. Developers do not care for their players. The customer service and helpdesk does not provide proper feedback on how to fix issues in your game. Most of the time you can only hope for another player to knows the problem and bothers to come and help you with the issue.


6. The mod makers are far better than the actual developers. All of WildCard Studios' games are mod supported so other creators can bring new content into the game, which may or may not have an effect on game price.


[h1]Further details about problems:[/h1]

[b]Performance Issues:[/b]
The developers have not bothered about giving the best experience to everyone. Even the bestest computers barely run ARK above 100 fps even with a high quality graphic card. The average world downloading time is 30 - 50 minutes on average gaming computers (without expensive graphic card). Not to mention that after the release of Extinction DLC dropped the performance far worse than it has ever been before.

[b]Bugs & Glitches:[/b]
There main problem is that there is no "safe logging out" in this game. If you log out from your game in your base there is a chance that you will glitch into a wall and die loosing all your items. There are also bugs like creatures being able to kill you trough solid walls, rag doll issues, dispawning tames, etc. which most of these problems come from the very core game, with half of the existing bugs that never were fixed from Alpha phase of the development. The possibility of these bugs appearing is the optimization/performance issues, which already is poor.

[b]Creatures & Lore:[/b]
The amount of creatures in this games is huge and WildCard Studios tries to trade the broken game quality with the amount of content, which is somehow supposed to be worth of 60$ (+40$ Seasonal Pass). What goes to the lore there are small bits and pieces that most of the players will ignore on their first play trough. The lore quality is similar to FNAF where you have to find bits and pieces but when you ask from another player about it you will get shouted for magically not knowing about the lore. The easiest way to fully understand the entire lore is by watching a video from Youtube. Shortly the entire point of the lore can be skipped by a player who isn't interested from the dossiers that they find.

[b]Server Population[/b]
The most fun way and especially for younger players is to play games with your friends, however when it comes to ARK you must choose wisely between what server you pick: PVE server where other members cannot destroy each other's buildings, or PVP where everything can be destroyed and killed. If you are a user who cannot spent much time in the game or just want to play it for your enjoyment you must pick PVE. If you know that you cannot be minimum of 18 hours per day playing in a PVP server your progress is completely wasted as mega tribes clear entire servers multiple times in one month. Even then after logging back in you will return into the restart screen after someone has destroyed your base, hours of taming and grinding put to waste in matter of seconds.

[b]Community & Players[/b]
This community is not welcome to new or older players! Wherever you are to go regarding this game you will be called names, bad language and even as far as bullying. If someone so happens to disagree with you on discussion forums in Steam they can as well follow and kill you in-game because of your opinion. You do not need to go far than to negative previews section and look into the comments to see how "welcome" this game and it's community truly is. This community is certainly not welcome!

[b]Developers[/b]
Wild Card Studios has not kept it promises of the past development of the game. In fact, the official servers run more poorly than player run private servers. You had imagine that the official servers that present the game developers themselves would be high quality and give a reason for players to stay, but no. They rather bring in new content and expect it somehow justify their high price for the broken game. The only reason why any of their games can be modded is the reason that they ride on the (better) developer's backs and hope the game to stay popular so they can milk more money out of them while not having to fix their own game themselves. ARK Survival Evolved is not worth of 100$ price tag.

WARNING
THIS GAME CAN BE MORE ADDICTIVE THEN CIVILIZATION

You have been warned so on to the review.
The concept is simple. You spawn on a randomised map resources around you. Your task is to build a giant automated factory/system in order to eventually build a space ship and get of the planet. How you do it depends on your planing skills and smarts. First you have coal powered drills and "inserters". Then you move on to steam powered mashiney. Then electricity(from solar panels to nuclear reactors).  You are not alone on the map though! Almost every building produces polution and local fauna will try to destroy source of polution. This forces tech upgrades and setting up assembly lines of conveyors .

Thankfouly the game has "campaign" which serves as a medium long tutorial. This is the type of game that is easy to learn but difficult to master. Eventually i during my break-time at school i began to wander alloud "Wait, did steamturbines have enough water?" or "i'm gonna have to make a new microprocesor factory". When my friend heard me speaking and asked? Wut U doing bro he got a bit puzled. If you are a person that likes excersizing your brain. This is a mandatory game to check out. 
Especially since there is a free demo.
Hard yes

I played well over hundred hours of this because I was assured that this would get better by the end. 

It didn't.

I started playing the series with Fallout 2 back when it came out and got the first game soon after. Fallout 3 was a slight dissapointment, but I loved New Vegas. I entered this game knowing it would be more action-oriented than the previous games in the series (discounting Tactics) and was prepared for it. The first twenty or so hours were rather enjoyable just walking through the wilderness and doing the odd quests. 

The problems really started when (NO BIG SPOILERS!)  I went back to the main quest and met the leader of the Institute and got to ask about the central question of the game: why was my baby taken from the Vault? Where is he now? The answers were unsatisfying and felt like lies, with no opportunity to ask for clarifications. This was big minus when the whole game turned around this one encounter. 

This was few weeks ago and I'm still angry. The most important conversation in the whole game, done in haste to get back to shooting enemies. This is the big problem of the game: the game is so focused on looking pretty and giving you lot to shoot at, that you are never given any reasons why you should shoot or why are these people shooting you. 

Traditional part of the Fallout-games is an end-scene where the repecussions of your actions are revealed. This game didn't have that scene. Which is natural, as the world in the game was never one that was going anywhere: it was always just a place where to shoot and kill.

Supergiant Games has taken everything good about roguelites and combined it all. This game is a premier example of hard work and good taste. 

The setting and the characters are well embodied with the excellent voice acting. The visuals are smooth and crisp. The animations are quick and fluid. The gameplay is fast and engaging with awesome enemies and enemy character/behavior design. There are six weapons, but each has four Aspects, so it feels actually like 24 weapons. The back end progress and systems stuff are all good. Every resource you can collect is valuable, or at least exchangeable for another. This game feels very polished. It does a very good job of giving more reasons to come back. I have over 100 hours in the game, at around 52 escape attempts and I'm still getting new character interactions and it still has a feeling of progress. I'd recommend this game to anyone who likes fast and "actiony" skill-based gameplay, even if they aren't really a fan of roguelites. I got it on the release sale for $20, but I already bought it digitally on my Switch and I happily paid full $25 there. 

DO RECOMMEND

BEST GAME EVER!

An incredible remake of one of my favorite games! The game looks gorgeous, and it's so much fun seeing the updated areas from the original game and going "Hey, I remember this part!" The best part is that it's not just a half-baked reskin of the original, so you get a fresh experience regardless of if you've played the original half-Life. Xen is breathtakingly beautiful, and I had a ton of fun playing through that section along with the updated Gonarch boss fight. 

However, there are a couple of issues I had with the game. The biggest of these is the god awful performance in some areas. The biggest offenders appear to be 'Surface Tension' and 'Interloper' where the framerate dips a considerable amount with a good bit of stuttering. I don't have the beefiest PC, but my specs are above the recommended requirements, and these frame issues happened whether I was playing on the lowest graphical settings or the highest. Oddly enough, a lot of the framerate issues I encountered fixed themselves when I unplugged my xbox controller from my PC. Not sure what the correlation is there. I'm going to assume the framerate issues are due to the fact that this game is running on a very old engine that is likely being pushed to its limits. Another issue I had was the difficulty scaling. I felt the standard difficult was too easy (until Interloper) and the hard difficulty was too difficult. It's like a Halo 2 situation, but not quite as extreme. Lastly, I felt the Interloper chapter dragged on for way too long, and I found myself just wanting to be done with it towards the end.

All in all, this is a fantastic remake and well worth the money! I will likely be replaying this in the future.

Beautiful, that is the first thing I would love to state about this game. The graphics are just amazing. For being in alpha, it has way more potential then it has already presented. So being in alpha of course there will be bugs awaiting your arrival, but regardless of the fact they are working them out as promised, at least as far that I have seen. The building could use some work but yet it works pretty damn well for as far as it has gotten at the moment. A.I is getting pretty intense in a way compared to the first time I have played it. I mean hell, they used to be just ridiculously dumb. I just got on recently and found out, "OH SHIT" they can climb trees now. That tripped me out in a great way. No more hiding in tree forts and shooting arrows, throwing molotovs... oh no, shit has just gotten real. Crafting system is getting a great improvement and can only wait for what is next to come. Overall, I would say keep playing alpha, help these developers fix all the bugs they can. I truly believe this game will be the next best surivial game if not already. Hope this helps your decision, if not that's life.

TRIEHARTS

[b]At the end of the day, this is a case of 'too little too late'.[/b]

[i]Farming Simulator 19[/i] offers a good bit of fun and content - but it still suffers from some fundamental design problems that are painful to see still persisting in the latest edition. These issues could certainly be overlooked a decade ago, but now after six or so versions of the game - a lot of it becomes unexcusable. For instance, how can any self-proclaimed farming simulator not have seasons this far into the franchise? Seasons are so critical to farming that I can't begin to understand why they are not in the base game at this point. Also, the core mechanic is interacting with fields, so why don't we have a more dynamic tire and soil interaction? This is basic stuff. I could go on. This simulator still largely boils down to 'painting' fields.

[b]While some will have you think [i]Giants Software[/i] has the market cornered - mark my words - all it will take is a small indie team with a few bucks and an open mind to topple this series.[/b] It's not that difficult of a game to get right, and it's only a matter of time. Let me explain why I say this. For those that aren't familiar with the community, what you need to know is that it has a strong [i]'old guard'[/i] attitude. While the community is mostly nice, long standing members (including the developers) are largely unwilling to accept or consider new ideas. This is the core problem. This series may be the best you can get right now in the farming simulation genre, but it leaves a lot to be desired (compared to, say, [i]American Truck Simulator[/i] which feels darned near perfect for that genre). 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+It's a remarkably fun time sink.
+There is a lot of content, and mods are icing on the cake.
+The multiplayer aspect adds a lot.
+For the most part, it's all quite beautiful.

[b]Meh:[/b]
=I'm the last person to talk about graphics, but these are a bit of a letdown. It still feels a bit dated or something (particularly the 2D soil).
=The character creator is sort of a tease. Yes, thank you for adding it in, but it is the absolute bare-minimum it could be. What would it take to simply expand on it?
=The world feels more alive (finally), but still could use more in this department.

[b]Cons:[/b]
-The series as a whole needs to evolve at a much faster rate.
-There are details in the game that really need to be explained. I had this complaint about other installments in this series, and it still persists here. Yes, there is a good bit explained in some areas, and yet none in others. This should have been brought up with early playtesters who are fairly new to the series or farming in general.
-No seasons in the base game.
-No Steam Workshop support, and on a long enough timeline you will want mods. Many want them day one. I may be fine with no Steam Workshop if I found [i]Giants Software[/i] mod website to be fanastic, but unfortunately I don't.
-Mouse sensitivity is horribly low even at the maximum of 200%. Who could playtest this for more than 20 minutes and not realize this?
-Why does the American map look so trashy? This is a big complaint from me, because it was clearly a deliberate design choice. Sure, I've witnessed American farmland that looks like this - but I've also seen plenty of much less rundown farmland in America. Why not make it a bit more pleasant. Very curious design that I almost take offense to.
-For being a 'simulator', there actually isn't all that much content that reflects this. For example, you can 'tab' teleport between vehicles, break signs in the town with impunity (how about a small monetary fine?), and 'paint' fields haphazardly with no penalty, among other things. 

[b]If you haven't played any of the [i]Farming Simulator[/i] titles and are interested - go for it.[/b] WIth that being said, I am not hopeful that this series is going to ever innovate beyond what we essentially already have in front of us.

Тупо великая РПГ на все времена. Даже не охота распыляться о плюсах, все и так всё знают про Скайрим. Кто в конце концов в него не играл. Бескрайняя игра, в которой можно провести не одну сотню часов. Делай что хочешь, будь кем хочешь. Если у игрока хватает фантазии, в игре можно просто напросто жить. 
Минусы отмечу, ибо игра хоть и великая, но копипасты, и моментов, которые разрушают погружение предостаточно. Квестов подай-принеси, зачистки данжей полно, и конечно отсутствия нелинейности в квестах и диалогах. 
Главное что должен понять Тод Говард, что нельзя и после 2020 делать основным геймплейным элементом зачистку бесконечных данжей. Жду ТЕС 6, и надеюсь что он будет революционным, таким каким стал Скайрим в свое время.

A stunning remake of an eternal classic.

I should start by saying that while I recommend Black Mesa to anyone, people should start by playing the original Half-Life before Black Mesa in order to appreciate the changes and differences that are present in Black Mesa. The game is a complete remake of Half-Life graphically, audibly, and gameplay wise. They have taken areas of the game that were flawed in the past, such as On a Rail and the whole of Xen, and given them complete overhauls, making them much more enjoyable. Many of the issues with Black Mesa have little to do with the game itself and more so with residual issues from Half-Life. Would recommend to anyone.

Broforce is the kind of game you launch once in a while for all the fun it brings with it. a cast of famous movie characters, going from Conan to Ellen Replay with a lot of other characters to play. 

the game is a side scrolling shoot them all where you have to complete missions (reaching the end of the level and touching the US flag or kill the boss). you start as one of those heroes. during the course of the game there are hostages to free, every few freed hostages, you'll gain a new hero to come along with you. and every freed hostage randomly change the character you play by another among those you've unlocked. 

when you die, you're replaced by another character selected randomly by the game. if you have no life left, you're good to restart the level from the start. 

every character has their own weapon and specific power. Some are weapons of mass-destruction, some are more discreet, but the whole purpose of the game is to kill all those terrorists in pixels. But take care when you provoke mass murders (and it will happen a lot starting from the middle of the game) to not be taken in the blood bath and die in your own explosion....

So it's a fun little game I'm glad to launch every now and then, I try to play through every level with the character I'm given at the start of it and not dying while going through it. But it can be sometimes tedious (but I'am not a hardcore player).

of course some characters are a chore to play and don't work well or are too "weak" or too weirdly designed to be easily taken in hands.

Nevertheless, the game is good, not expansive and the OST is very good (special mention for the "boss" and mission "accomplished" themes).

The best strategy game ever made. If you've never played a Civ game this is the one to get, with its greatly streamlined interface and controls, you can easily spend the whole day away with this game.

idk why everybody is shitting on this game because of the glitches. the glitches are honestly pretty funny besides the game-breaking ones.
the map design is flawless, everywhere you go has cover, ways to get around, and can be tackled in either stealth or loud. the prepper stashes reward you for looking around and finding paths, and there is almost always action happening. there are hostages on the streets, cult outposts, a few convoys, etc. etc. so there's a lot of stuff to do.
hunting is also very rewarding, and you can amass thousands of dollars if you dedicate at least an hour to it. character customisation is always nice, giving players who have other ubisoft games bobbleheads in their cars, outfits, etc. etc. i cannot get enough of this game right now.
ok, i'll admit, the weapons don't sound as punchy as i'd like but that's overshadowed entirely by the m133 and m60. the weapons always have some level of customisation, being skins, scopes, silencers, and magazine upgrades to name the standards.
weapon variety is strong in this game, giving you a range of weapons from m1911s to flamethrowers, p226s to double-barrel shotguns, the list goes on and on.
i love the continuation of the far cry 5 story into far cry new dawn too, definitely refreshing to see all the color in this new world that has been touched by human life for way less than 100 years but this is besides the point.
far cry 5 is by far one of the best games in the far cry series in my opinion. thank you for taking the time to read this. :)

I love this game, there are things i do want changed though the main thing being: there should be a searchbar for the workshop so i can find good mods more easily, also, there is no direct way to make mods you have to find a  mod that allows you to do that, but overall i love playing.

If it weren't for early access, I think this would've been my game of the year for 2020

Pros:
+a game that challenges your critical thinking
+tutorial is decent, making you learn the game in a way that forces you to innovate and improve your own setups
+Lots of "real" world minor annoyances stand in the way of your goal, only heavy optimization and expansion can stop them
+The time pressure aspect of the game can be turned off if you just want to relax

Cons:
-Tutorial is ok, it takes things slow and shows you enough to get going in the regular game, but the fun doesn't start till stage 2
-some of the hotbar controls aren't taught to you and may feel very clunky when you start out
-enemies only serve as a massive resource sink

Я не играл в Resident Evil 2 который 1998 года так что приступы ностальгии при прохождении её ремейка у меня не было, по этому наверное объективнее всего могу указать на тот факт что игра очень даже удалась, это прям не пугающая до дрожи в коленках игра, где страшно играть, нет, тут всего пара, ну может чуть больше страшных моментов и оно понятно, в нынешнее время уже как то банально и не интересно пугать игрока всякими скримерами или другими приёмами, но вот держать в постоянном напряжении, игра определённо умеет и это её огромный плюс.
- Вся фишка игры в том что игра как написано выше постоянно держит в напряжении, от этого совершаешь ошибки иногда, добавьте к этому ещё и высокую живучесть зомби и остальных врагов и вы получите наверное современных хоррор, не в том представлении что вы имеете когда называют этот жанр, а именно современных хоррор, который не пугает, а держит в напряжении, своей атмосферой, звуками, музыкой и механикой, здесь встреча с одним зомби порой может принести много хлопот, а вдруг у вас ещё и на хвосте Тиран? Ну тут положение ещё более незавидное, вы не пугаетесь, но определённо испытываете те же острые чувства как будто посмотрели реально что то криповое;
- Собственно геймплей игры в основном это беготня в поисках предметов, решение головоломок, собирательство ресурсов и сражения с зомби и другими врагами, а как часто будете с ними сражаться зависит от вас, но увлекаться не стоит, патронов не скажешь что много, а улетают они на раз и в основном лучше стараться пробегать врагов, чем убивать их, а это ещё один плюс, попробуйте не понервничать когда вы проходите в пол метре от Ликера. Ну и в давесок что бы не скучно было, в полицейский участок пускают ещё и Тирана, который гонится за игроком, убить его нельзя, остановиться он всего на секунд 30, так что нужно только бежать, его довольно жутковатый вид, большой рост и звуки шагов тоже заставляют нервничать, а если ещё в комнату зайдёт где сидишь и ждёшь когда он уйдёт, ну тут будет очень весело, Тирану. Вроде бы звучит просто и банально, но даже в совокупности всё это увлекает и не отрывает до самого конца, а заниматься поисками интересно даже когда уже раза 2 игру прошёл, не это ли говорит о том что игра хороша?
- Со звуком в игре всё в порядке, скрежет, стоны, шаги, всё это создаёт очень криповую атмосферу, а когда в безопасной комнате ещё слушаешь шаги Тирана, становится не по себе;
- Проходится игра где то в среднем за 6-8 часов наверное, одна кампания. В зависимости от того как вы долго будете всё искать, ну и вообще будете ли этим заниматься, так то её вообще можно пробежать быстро, но тогда будет не интересно. Локаций в игре три: Полицейский участок, Канализация и Лаборатория, первые две локации очень насыщены разными интересными вещами (хотя Канализация похуже), а вот лаборатория довольно бедна в этом плане, да и лежит там в основном всё на видном месте, это конечно не много огорчает, что игра сбавляет обороты под конец;
- Графика в игре красивая, конечно чутка не хватает чёткости текстур, но это мелочи, в целом картинка приятная, оптимизация, ну наверное неплохая, я особо не знаю, ибо мощный компьютер слишком что бы о оптимизации говорить, но если идёт в 120-170 FPS на Ультра в Full HD, думаю с оптимизацией всё в порядке;

Что по поводу того что можно было бы улучшить в игре как в ремейке:
- При повторном прохождении сюжета, но за другого персонажа (тип те же события, но глазами другого персонажа), неплохо было бы убрать некоторые казусы, ибо во второй кампании в большинстве своём очень много игнорирует события первой кампании, одна битва с Биркиным чего стоит только, проходит в том же месте что и в первой кампании. Это пожалуй один из самых неприятных минусов игры как ремейка.
- Больше внимания деталям, например стоило бы сделать одно только двуручное оружие носимое, а то как то странно видеть как Леон достаёт дробовик, а на спине материализуется тут же Огнемёт. Во вторых вторую кобуру сделать для пистолета, а то как то странно что персонаж достаёт оба пистолета с одной и той же кобуры, куда другой то девается? И почему то гранаты, нож или пистолеты уменьшаются когда персонаж убирает их на пояс и кобуру.
- Нет отсылок к Resident Evil 3, хотя события параллельно происходят, хотя бы что нибудь бы показали, я ещё понимаю в оригинале не было их, ибо RE3 только наверное в планах была, но почему события 3-ей части не учли при разработке ремейка 2-ой?
- Враги в основном имеют привязку к своей комнате и дальше неё не уходят, за исключением зомби и те возвращаются если потеряли игрока из виду, а Тиран не заходит в безопасные зоны, это как по мне минус.
- Стоило бы также перебалансировать арсенал персонажей, ибо у Клэр есть ПП у которого куча патронов и оружие в целом лучше чем у Леона, а у Леона патронов ещё чаще не хватает и в целом им играть сложнее по моему. Дробовик знаете ли не ровня Гранатомёту.
- Леон и Клэр могли бы пересекаться чаще, а не в начале и в конце игры.
Итог: Как ремейк игра хороша, но хотелось бы большего. Как самостоятельный проект, игра замечательна и я определённо рекомендую её купить, в целом я думаю эмоции и 20 с лишним часов игры с лихвой окупили 2000 рублей потраченные на игру, во всяком случае я точно не жалею что потратил на неё деньги. Короч берите, не пожалеете.

This game has been in development for over FIVE YEARS and I have been following them since early 2014. Throughout the half decade this game was under construction, ludeon never abandoned their vision of a colony sim which focused more on the people than on anything else; not to say there aren't dozens of other beautifully crafted features.

This is one of the only games I have ever played which has been able to keep my full attention for days on end yet I never even think about winning or losing. Pawns crashland, they join, they're recruited, but sooner or later pawns will starve, freeze, or die in a raid. It's always sad to see your favorite colonist die, but it is more beautiful to watch your favorite psychopath have bionic parts welded onto him only to go insane and ignite your armory then die in a glorious inferno than any story written by a AAA dev could ever be.

This game deserves just about every damn award this year.

I no longer game hardcore as i did in younger days.
But back then i often got a feeling of excitement and adventure when starting a new game. Becoming immersed in the story, learning the games mechanics and various layouts or systems. 
To me half the fun of these games were the 'unknown' or sense of variety and adventure. Few games ever continued to deliver on that after playing for more than an hour or so!
My library is now stacked with games i barely and never play because they were not games that could deliver that 'wow this game is incredible' feeling.
For years I had lost that feeling, even after trying a myriad of games over multiple genres. 
...i just thought it was something i would never encounter again. 


Until the Witcher 3. 
Over 170 hours i have now put into this and still think it is one of the best games ever created. It was fun, intelligent, challenging (sometimes very), beautiful, immersive and sometimes just plain awe-inspiring. I often would think 'holy shit... they thought of that too!'... the developers have created a masterpiece, and im sure anyone who has played it would agree.

It tops my list with the original civilization, gta, half-life, c&c back when they all were first released and playing them for the first time. Could put Fallout vegas in the same league as well ;)

Now i must get back to real life and my family.
Thanks for the great times Geralt & co... i will be back.

O Wallpaper Engine é um software de wallpapers animados, podendo você escolher desde wallpapers da oficina steam até criar seu próprio wallpaper.
Esse software é otimo para quem faz tutoriais e quer deixar seus videos com um visual mais bonito.

Prós: O software é simples e fácil de usar, tendo uma interface totalmente em português e bem minimalista.

Contra: Ele não é um software tão pesado, podendo em algumas maquinas causar travamentos e lags contantes.

Fim: Recomendo o uso do software para você que quer sua área de trabalho mais bonita e animada.

游戏是很个人化的东西，如果这个游戏能戳中你的点，就是神作，毕竟好评率这么高。但我实在没get到点。不说游戏表达的内容，毕竟这和看小说一样，不同的人感受不同。游戏中的bug，我跳桥的时候直接卡住导致不得不强制退出游戏、鼠标点击感觉有些延迟（可能不是延迟，点到了无法到达的地方吧）总之操作很难受。要说游戏多好，那也仅仅是在讲故事方面（虽然我并不觉得故事多好），这是小说的特长，不应该成为游戏的特长。游戏性方面无任何优点。

This was the first game, out of the many that I have owned and played, that has compelled me to write a review. This being one of my first actual reviews, I apoligize for any, uh, [i] roughness? [/i] I guess?

Anyway.

I Adore everything about this game. The catchy, original music; the relatable characters with hilarious and sometimes very emotional dialogue; the [i]gorgeous[/i] artsyle; the spooky mystery; the vast replayability; everything. Night in the Woods has easily become one of my favorites, if not my all time favorite. I cannot wait for more from these developers. I have such high hopes for their future projects. If you enjoy games with lots of exploration, lots of incredibly well written dialogue, and lots of things to go back and rediscover, I very much reccomend this game.

Thank you, Infinite Fall, and thank you, Finji.

-Find Dead Rising 4 or DeadRisng4.exe (Forgot how its called now)
-Right click on it look down where you see set priority 
-then drag you mouse and set it to high or above normal. I don't know which one is better but i usually press high and it 
works perfectly

讚

Well, it's been over a year and played the game for over 100 hours. Here's my experience with this game:
- The game is very simple. You as car need to kick the ball to the goal. It's very difficult to master different techniques such as Aerials. Once you master them you'll be good to the Grand Champion Rank.
- When I bought this game I was so addicted to this game until I realized that there was a sale few days later. I instantly went to Steam Support to refund the game so I can rebuy again and get some monies back until I realized it was too late. I actually played for over 10 hours. Too many hours to refund it.
- The game has specific community. Once you team up with nice guys and then you team up with people that will spit on you for ramming at least once by accident.
- The game is gonna get XP overhaul, crossplay parties and Rocket Pass (totally not stolen from Fortnite).
- The developers are continuously supporting the game and I appreciate that.
- I really enjoy different types of matches. Especially Dropshot. It's so underrated.
- Competitive matches are so fun. Especially when opponents are forfeiting because we're destroying them.
- Very amazing Competitive rewards!
Great game, 9/10. Would be 10 if not the community as I stated above.

This is the definition of do not judge a book by its cover. It might look like a big booty BDSM Lolita chick with her beta boi and her side hoe but it ain't. It's one of my favorite games of all time.


[u] The Gooch Shet [/u]
- Rich and mind boggling story/lore (even more so if you do a bit more research)
- Absolutely phenomenal sound track
- Impressive well polished combat system
- Astounding voice acting both English and Japanese (Questionable at times)
- Amazing character development
- The world is absolutely breathtaking
- A satisfying amount of replayability 
- Butts ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)


[u] The Bad Shet [/u] 
- Rendering problems
- Some gameplay elements left to be desired
- Some invisible walls
- No meaningful DLC
- Bad PC port
   - Full screen is blurry (get a third party borderless window application to fix problem) 
     - (Download dis https://westechsolutions.net/sites/WindowedBorderlessGaming/ )
   - There's still no update for the PC Port (probably never)
And a personal note. One particular fight is disapointing (you'll know when you get there)


[u] Extra tid bits [/u]
- The side quests are well worth your time please do check them out.
- The game has an "auto mode' that will play the game fro you...IF YOU A BITCH
- DO NOT STOP ON ENDING A. CONTINUE PLAYING. DON'T BE A DUMBASS LIKE THAT ONE REVIEWER. 


Thank you for reading all the way to the end. This game has made a huge impact on my life allowing me to truly appreciate the beauty of video games. If you are willing to look past all the negatives all I have to say is bless Yoko Taro and his crew for making this wonderful work of art and I hope you enjoy this game just as much or even more than I have. It might not be your cup of tea but hey, at least stay for the butts ;)


                                                                                                                                                                      Glory to Mankind <3 


P.S 
If I didn't convince you to purchase this game here's a video that just might. Please don't watch it if you want to go in the game blind. (Video is 30 min long)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-NiyfG8Ctbo

Okay thank you bye:)

app_name: Getting Over It with Bennett Foddy
review:
i was extremely excited for this game more so than i had been for any game in years. i couldnt wait to train my mouse accruacy and test my perseverence as im an extremely competetive person and i always strive for excellence no matter the circustances.


what i was actually met with is a steaming pile of trash. i try to be nice but not everything has a nice way to be said and sugar coating wouldnt be lieing and wouldnt help anyone. lets go over a few of the issues



---the mouse and hammer dont move at the same speed no matter how fast you move you mouse.

in my experience the hammer always moved slower than cursor no matter the speed i'ed say about 50% slower at any given speed. this completely unacceptable if you played a first person shooter and where you shot only moved half as fast as the aiming reticle no one would play that pile of trash. lets say just for example you normally move your cursor at 100 pixels per second (just intented to be an easy to work with number not an accurate one) and the hammer moves at 50 then ok maybe the hammer can only go 50 and thats part of the game so you move the cursor at 200 pixels per second to check and the hammer then goes 100.  what the hell? we know the hammer CAN go 100 so why cant it match my cursor when my cursor goes 100? unbelievable. you might be thinking that this is soley an issue because of my mouse sensitivity or something and well if i have to set my mouse sensitivity  to some exact mysterious magical number just for the game to work as intended then that would be unacceptable as well.





cursor turns into an inconsistent mess when keeping it near the character. worse than shinjy from neon genesis evangelion. if you dont move the cursor far enough through your character it just slowly goes back to where the hammer is. if you do move it far enough you will likely still have alot of the movement input lost making it so you simply cant use your muscle memory if your cursor moves through your character.



in game mouse sensitivity does almost nothing. had to open my mouse setting and set it too over double the normally. i cant even see a differrence with the in game mouse sesitivity slider.


alot of desighn choices with friction and general physics are questionable at best esspecially given the demands from it given by the terrain. i wouldnt mind this at all if the most basic function of the game (cursor movement tranfered to hammer movement) wasnt such a dumpster fire.


i wouldnt even recomend this as a joke. 

if i made this game and found out how bad it was i'ed make the creator anonymous so i wouldnt be assosiated with this level of game desighn quality. 


edit: opinion has not changed in the slightest in fact i feel even more strongly about it after watching others play it slowly and frame by frame. but im gonna play this steaming pile of trash because i value training my perseverence and patient. pray for me
i like this game its like fortnite but good

I cannot recommend this game enough. I was put off from buying this game for so long simply because of the basic looking graphics, but once you get into it you can tell a lot of love was put into the development of this game, from the level design to the characters to just about everything. It's a collectathon game where collecting all of the time pieces to complete the game isn't tediously long, due to short but sweet levels. The character you play as, Hat Girl, is super fun to control, and the controls feel super tight, making it really enjoyable to explore the levels rather than a chore. Also, the soundtrack is great, with the main hub theme composed by Grant Kirkhope of Banjo Kazooie fame. If you're on the fence, please don't let the graphics put you off buying this!
This game has become my new addiction. I can't stop playing it. Its scarily addicting beware. If you buy this game prepare to see yourself making excuses to not do things you normally do to play it.

快通关了，快不行了，这游戏真的不行。总结一下，第一点，战斗死亡之后会强制回城，所有东西都要重新加载一遍，包括刚刷过的敌人，如果正在过剧情死了，恭喜你，所有的剧情都要重新加载一遍。因为我一直没玩枪剑近战，游戏突然出一个桐人模式强制要用近战，打BOSS之前有大概8段动画，我BOSS估计打了10次，这8段动画也反复加载了10次，感觉我的生命就这样白白被浪费了。第二点，神一样的敌人，猪一样的队友。最坑就是打到一个叫蜂巢的强敌，四周没有掩体，蜂巢就疯狂激光扫射，根本就不能闪避，三个猪队友基本都是瞬间被秒，我一点办法也没有，这游戏根本就不应该有简单难度以上的难度，平衡？不存在的，简单难度过剧情吧。撇开题材，这个动作射击游戏我找不到任何做得好的地方，技能很多基本没用就算了，熟练度还涨的特别的慢，谁有时间去刷这个鬼熟练度啊。狙击枪瞄准还真实的抖来抖去，我就想爽爽快快的玩下狙击也不行？？？玩这游戏获得的快乐比憋气少太多了

Nach ein paar Spielstunden hab ich mich dafür entschieden, ein Review zu schreiben.
Kurz gesagt, dass Spiel ist die Krone der Soft-Body-Physiksimulation. 

Pro:
-Schöne, detaillierte, realistische, rechenhungrige Crashes und Grafik
-Realistisches Handling
-Detaillierte Fahrzeugsteuerung mit der Möglichkeit für manuelles Gangschalten, Blinker,
 Licht,...
-Fleißige Community (leider keine Steam Workshop-Integration)
-Viele Fahrzeuge mit vielen Tuningmöglichkeiten (besserer Motor, Automatikgetriebe...)
-Apps für AI-Steuerung, Airspeed, Drehmoment, Wärmesimulation, Wind, Navi...)
-In-Game Mapeditor

Cons:
-Kein Steam-Workshop
-In Optionen aktivierbare Maussteuerung (Mouse-as-Joystick) fehlt meiner Meinung nach noch
-Part Selector ist noch uneinheitlich, eingeschränkte Upgrademöglichkeiten
-Ein paar störende Kleinigkeiten/Bugs: Seltsames Verhalten der Hinterradfederung bei Gavril 
 Barstov  (zittern von Heavy-Duty-Suspension beim Gasgeben) und Vorderradfederung bei D-Series (vibrieren 
 bei Independent-Suspension und 100% Front Ride Height)

Шедевр игровой индустрии!

Хотите знать, как должны разработчики относится к своему произведению? Вот вам пример!
И это именно произведение, а не продукт. В отличии от других early access проектов, этот действительно цепляет. 
Потрясающая атмосфера, интересная система перков, захватывающее пве и пвп.
У этой игры есть только два минуса, отсутствие баланса рейдерства и оптимизации. Первая решается хорошим онлайном, вторая хорошим железом. Игра очень достойная и играть в неё интересно, еженедельные обновления и оперативные фиксы лишь добавляют положительных эмоций. 
При хорошем железе, однозначно к покупке!

OYUNDA GELİŞTİRİLMESİ GEREKENLER:
*Avcılık

*Hayvan çeşitleri (Çoğaltılabilir)
*Silah ve Savunma (Çoğaltılabilir)
*Ev çeşitleri (Çoğaltılabilir)

*Bilgisiyarım bu oyunu en yüksek ayarlarda açmasına ve hiç kasmamasına rağmen, ben en düşük ayarlarda oynuyorum, çünkü bu oyun nedense bilgisiyarların üstünde yemek yapılacak kadar ısıtıyor.(Kesinlikle düzeltilmeli)

记者：克罗夫特公爵，你觉得永生的力量吼不吼啊？

理查德：吼啊！

记者：家人也滋词你吗？

理查德：当然啦！

记者：圣三一呢，最近发表了一个报告说呢，永生的力量和传世中的基特城都是不存在的，你对这个看法有什么回应呢？

理查德：没听到过。

记者：是先知说的。

理查德：你们媒体千万要记着，不要“见得风，是得雨”。接到这个消息，你们媒体本身也要判断，明白意思吗？假使这些完全无中生有的东西，你再帮他说一遍，你等于……你也有责任吧。

记者：现在那么早你们就是说滋词，会不会给人一种感觉就是内定啊、硬点基特城呢？

理查德：没任何意思，还是按照基本法，按照考古的法，去产生……[左手向前平伸]。刚才你问我啊，我可以回答你一句“无可奉告”，你们也不高兴，那怎么办？我讲的意思不是我钦点说有基特城，我女儿也是研究过的[转身指劳拉]。你问我滋词不滋词，我是滋词的，我就明确地告诉你这一点。你们啊，我感觉你们新闻界还要学习一个。你们非常熟悉西方考古的这一套理论，你们毕竟还too young，明白我的意思吧？我告诉你们，我是身经百战了，见得多啦！全世界的哪一个古墓我没去过？你们要知道，中国的吴邪和张起灵，那比你们不知要高到哪里去了[双手竖大拇指]！我跟他谈笑风生。所以说媒体呀还是要提高自己的知识水平，识得唔识得啊？唉，我也替你们捉急啊，真的。你们有一个好，全世界跑到什么地方，你们比其他的西方记者跑得还快。但是呢问来问的问题呀，都too simple，sometimes naive。懂了没有？

记者：克罗夫特公爵，能不能说一下为什么这么肯定基特城和永生力量呢？

理查德：我很抱歉，我今天是作为一个长者跟你们讲。我不是新闻工作者，但是我见得太多了，尤其是死人。我有这个必要好告诉你们一点人生的经验。

理查德：刚才我很想啊，我每次碰到你们，我就讲英国有一句话叫“闷声发大财”。我什么话也不说，这是坠吼的。但是我想我见到你们这样热情啊，一句话不说也不好。所以刚才你一定要这样说，在宣传上，将来如果你们报道有偏差，你们要负责。我没有说要钦定，没有任何这个意思。但是你一定要鼓捣着要问我，对基特城的存在滋词不滋词，我们不滋词？这个虽然是传说，但已经有很多证据证实了，我们怎么能不滋词？对不对？

记者：但是如果说永生呢？

理查德：永生也要按照英国的法律啊，对不对？要按照英国的……当然我们的决定权也是很重要的。基特城的所在地现在还不方便公布，到那时候我们会表态的。明白这意思吧？你们啊，不要想喜欢啊，弄个大新闻，[挥手]说基特城不存在了，永生不可能，就把我批判一番[指着自己]，你们啊naive！I am angry！你们这样子是不行的，我今天是得罪了你们一下！

"cucking your future wife." What? You know how to structure sentences in English right? Let's break this down, it's Cuckolding, not cucking. Cuckolding is something more than just humans do sometimes, it originates from Cuckoo, a bird that looks like another bird when it's a baby, lays it's eggs in the best of another bird, and when the chick hatches, it pushes the other eggs out of the nest to get there most attention from the parent birds. In the time of Shakespeare calling someone a Cuckold was saying you're taking care of another man's bastard. There is the sexual fetish of a man watching another guy have sex with his SO. Sometimes while dressed as superman. Cool, then there is the modern meaning which if someone who gives up their backbone politically to be "on the safe side" of society. Edgy. So using any of those descriptions how does one "cuck" a future wife? Is that in reference to his girlfriend? Do they have kids? My assumption is it refers to a woman he hasn't met yet because he's busy stacking coins rather than meeting a woman. I know of a story that might clear things up for you "According to all known laws of aviation, there is no way a bee should be able to fly. Its wings are too small to get its fat little body off the ground. The bee, of course, flies anyway because bees don't care what humans think is impossible. Yellow, black. Yellow, black. Hello? - Barry? - Adam? - Oan you believe this is happening? - I can't. I'll pick you up. Looking sharp. Use the stairs. Your father paid good money for those. Sorry. I'm excited. Here's the graduate. We're very proud of you, son. A perfect report card, all B's. Very proud. Ma! I got a thing going here. - You got lint on your fuzz. - Ow! That's me! - Wave to us! We'll be in row 118,000. - Bye! Barry, I told you, stop flying in the house! - Hey, Adam. - Hey, Barry. - Is that fuzz gel? - A little. Special day, graduation. Never thought I'd make it. Three days grade school, three days high school. Those were awkward. Three days college. I'm glad I took a day and hitchhiked around the hive. You did come back different. - Hi, Barry. - Artie, growing a mustache? Looks good. - Hear about Frankie? - Yeah. - You going to the funeral? - No, I'm not going. Everybody knows, sting someone, you die. Don't waste it on a squirrel. Such a hothead. I guess he could have just gotten out of the way. I love this incorporating an amusement park into our day. That's why we don't need vacations. Boy, quite a bit of pomp... under the circumstances. - Well, Adam, today we are men. - We are! - Bee-men. - Amen! Hallelujah! Students, faculty, distinguished bees, please welcome Dean Buzzwell. Welcome, New Hive Oity graduating class of... ...9:15. That concludes our ceremonies. And begins your career at Honex Industries! Will we pick ourjob today? I heard it's just orientation. Heads up! Here we go. Keep your hands and antennas inside the tram at all times. - Wonder what it'll be like? - A little scary. Welcome to Honex, a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee, have worked your whole life to get to the point where you can work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant Pollen Jocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected, scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctive golden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot. - She's my cousin! - She is? - Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right. - At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspect of bee existence. These bees are stress-testing a new helmet technology. - What do you think he makes? - Not enough. Here we have our latest advancement, the Krelman. - What does that do? - Oatches that little strand of honey that hangs after you pour it. Saves us millions. Oan anyone work on the Krelman? Of course. Most bee jobs are small ones. But bees know that every small job, if it's done well, means a lot. But choose carefully because you'll stay in the job you pick for the rest of your life. The same job the rest of your life? I didn't know that. What's the difference? You'll be happy to know that bees, as a species, haven't had one day off in 27 million years. So you'll just work us to death? We'll sure try. Wow! That blew my mind! "What's the difference?" How can you say that? One job forever? That's an insane choice to have to make. I'm relieved. Now we only have to make one decision in life. But, Adam, how could they never have told us that? Why would you question anything? We're bees. We're the most perfectly functioning society on Earth. You ever think maybe things work a little too well here? Like what? Give me one example. I don't know. But you know what I'm talking about. Please clear the gate. Royal Nectar Force on approach. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks! - Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's like outside the hive. Yeah, but some don't come back. - Hey, Jocks! - Hi, Jocks! You guys did great! You're monsters! You're sky freaks! I love it! I love it! - I wonder where they were. - I don't know. Their day's not planned. Outside the hive, flying who knows where, doing who knows what. You can'tjust decide to be a Pollen Jock. You have to be bred for that. Right. Look. That's more pollen than you and I will see in a lifetime. It's just a status symbol. Bees make too much of it. Perhaps. Unless you're wearing it and the ladies see you wearing it. Those ladies? Aren't they our cousins too? Distant. Distant. Look at these two. - Oouple of Hive Harrys. - Let's have fun with them. It must be dangerous being a Pollen Jock. Yeah. Once a bear pinned me against a mushroom! He had a paw on my throat, and with the other, he was slapping me! - Oh, my! - I never thought I'd knock him out. What were you doing during this? Trying to alert the authorities. I can autograph that. A little gusty out there today, wasn't it, comrades? Yeah. Gusty. We're hitting a sunflower patch six miles from here tomorrow. - Six miles, huh? - Barry! A puddle jump for us, but maybe you're not up for it. - Maybe I am. - You are not! We're going 0900 at J-Gate. What do you think, buzzy-boy? Are you bee enough? I might be. It all depends on what 0900 means. Hey, Honex! Dad, you surprised me. Let's open some honey and celebrate! Maybe I'll pierce my thorax. Shave my antennae. Shack up with a grasshopper. Get a gold tooth and call everybody "dawg"! Step to the side. - What'd you get? - Picking crud out. Stellar! Wow! Oouple of newbies? Yes, sir! Our first day! We are ready! Make your choice. - You want to go first? - No, you go. Oh, my. [12/22/2018]
I'd love to recommend this game, since the gameplay is fun and the story seems very interesting...

BUT, there are bugs, lots of bugs, specially if you try to play this with a controller (which should be more fun than keyboard). Main one is, if your controller ever disconnects or the game thinks your controller disconnected, it will freeze, and you have to reopen the game. Big no from me. 
Also, NPCs seem to always be knocking themselves against stuff and getting a "sprite collision" bug where they will just stop moving or move to the speed of light and give you epilepsy.

If you don't plan on using controller, go for it, but before it gets a fix for controller issues, I cannot recommend it.
3/10 for controller players, 7/10 or 8/10 for anyone else.

Great game and a better (/beardier) community.
It's a surprisingly fun casual game as well. I would suggest watching some of LionheartX's videos on YouTube to learn the basics of the game though. Total War has a real tutorial problem.
(Also checkout Turin's multiplayer channel.)

As a critic of Total War I would say that the Warhammer series is where to start with Total War and are a fantastic choice for anyone who likes Heroes of Might and Magic or Civilization and also Starcraft.
I say Starcraft because you can both enjoy a casual romp through the campaign and double down on mechanics and micro.

Fair warning, the mechanical details of the game are only available on forums and through testing yourself in custom battles (which are very easy to setup).
Creative assembly has many issues as a developer but you have to remind yourself that there might be a reason that they're the only name in the genre and that they *have* given the community the tools to fill the gaps.

The modding community is great but I'd suggest exercising caution with AI and overhaul mods as there are a lot of hacks in the way Creative Assembly balances the progression in the campaign and it's very difficult for modders to rebalance in a timely fashion in respsonse to new DLCs. I suspect there will be a golden age of modding after the game is complete, similar to how Skyrim mods stabilised after the game stopped being patched.

The ability to become attached to characters you only ever know by name, species, and ship role is remarkable, and the degree of difficulty scales in a way that is frustrating, but fittingly so for a game in this genre.  10/10, would recommend.

Fun game, very cute. I like the addition of environmental catastrophes and the spawning of random monsters. I do think the military is underpowered (except towers ... too strong!) and the victory conditions are a little unbalanced.

This game reminds me a lot of Super Metroid, which I played through when I was younger. It has a good feel to the platforming and interesting scenery. I haven't finished yet but the story is interesting and there are some really cool weapons to unlock.

I have played this game for 52 hours, and i would totally recommend this to anyone who enjoys games with amazing graphics, great storytelling (Have not beat the story myself so i cant say much on plot twists or anything like that), extraordinary combat mechanics, and a massive open world. As someone who has been playing the series since the start i will say it is definitely much different than some of the older titles, but it still has some elements of the first through revelations. Only complaint is the nonexistence of the hidden blade, but that is understandable considering the time difference. Other than that, this is a game i think has a little something for everyone. 10/10.

Ein kurzes Review zum Spiel nach 2-3 Jahren Wartezeit auf ein funktionierendes und weitesgehend bugfreies Spiel.

Leider ist es eben jenes selbst nach dieser langen zusätzlichen Wartezeit nicht ganz geworden.



Dafür gibt es zunächst einen entscheidenden Grund:

DIe Wegfindung der Schiffe ist eine einzige Katastrophe!
Sobald ein Großkampfschiff oder generell ein Schiff welches über die größe "M" hinaus geht in ein Asteroidengrütel fliegt, kommt es von alleine nicht aus diesen Gürtel. Die Schiffe manövrieren lieber gegen Asteroiden ohne auch nur ansatzweise den Kurs zu korrigieren. Selbst wenn man als Spieler versucht die Schiffe manuell weg von den Asteroiden zu lotsen und es trotz grausiger Bedienung auch schafft ausreichend Distanz zwischen den Schiffen und den Asteriodenfeld herzustellen, so bringt dieses Vorhaben leider nichts. Die Schiffe fliegen sobald man ihnen ein Kommando gibt wieder direkt in das Massivgestein. Das ist zunächst natürlich sehr frustrierend weil man ein Savegame neuladen muss, ein weiterkommen ist schlicht nicht möglich. 

Was aber deutlich schwerwiegender ist, das ganze Spielbereiche und Gebiete entfallen. Mining funktioniert so größtenteils garnicht, neue Erkundungsgebiete aus dem DLC Home of Light müssen ebenfalls gemieden werden da sich die Schiffe den versteckten Basen nicht nähern können ohne sich wieder in den Asteroiden zu verfangen.

X-Rebirth funktioniert also weiterhin in einen entscheidenen Punkt nicht.

Nebst dessen gibt es weiterhin zahlreiche Bugs die man aber durchaus verschmerzen kann. (Fehlende Textinformationen etc.)

Hinsichtlich Gameplay gab es zwar durchaus Fortschritte, gerade mit den neuen DLC Home of Light, aber im Grunde genommen ist das Spiel weiterhin auf einen mittelmäßigen Niveau. 

Gründe hierfür sind weiterhin:

- Wenige Aufrüstmöglichkeiten
- grauenhaftes Interface
- Mittelmäßiges Flugverhalten
- Kämpfe gegen Großkampfschiffe noch immer im Alleingang möglich
- Schlechtes Balancing, teils als "sehr schwer" markierte Missionen sind entweder zu leicht zu meistern, oder Bringen im Verhältnis zu "leichten" Missionen kaum größere Credits

Ich könnte eine Liste sicherlich noch um einige Punkte fortführen, aber um zu einen kurzen Fazit zu kommen.

X-Rebirth hat sich sicherlich deutlich seit Release verbessert!
Aber es ist leider noch immer ein schlechtes bis mittelmäßiges Spiel mit Fehlern und haarsträubenden Designentscheidungen.

Ich würde von einen Kauf abraten!

This is a great game, would recommend for players who are into Roleplaying and Tabletop-esque experiences. Here are a few of the points about the game off the top of my head:
Pros:
- Very flexible skills system, allowing you to build pretty much any character you want
- Great main campaign story so far (I haven't finished it yet)
- Plenty of hours of content
- Great multiplayer
- Good modding community
Cons:
- The custom campaign builder is a bit more limited than I had thought when first buying this game. You are given a few maps you can build the campaign out of, but they aren't especially large and the terrain can't be edited. You have to string together several maps to build a sizable campaign. With the NPC's it is fairly flexible though, so that's good.
- A few quality of life changes would be much appreciated, such as an equipment upgrading process or just making it so that you don't need to upgrade your equipment all the time.

Excellent execution of a PVP and PVE squad based realistic tactical fps.  Though there are many micro and macro transactions available in game (most of them being purely cosmetic), those that effect gameplay directly are not locked behind real money, but instead behind gameplay/xp only unlock systems.  Though this does limit overal class and weapon selection at first, it is within the first few hours of learning the game that you will unlock the classes and weapons most suited to your playstyle, roles, and preferences.  Map choice is now varied enough to stay fresh for hours of play at a time, however the maps have extremely difficult learning curves given that basic things like a map/blueprint/sitrep are not included, leaving most new players disoriented at best.  This does however mix with excellent sound design, lighting effects. map destruction, and other mechanics to allow even novice players situational and contextual awareness through-out the round.  

After a year, and with the heavy (technical and network) burden of being a Ubisoft game, R6 Siege still manages to rise above and become the pre-emminent tactical fps of this generation, and a worthwhile investment even at a $50 price point.

a very great short indie puzzle game with a bit of VN element

i dont have any negative comment on this game, this is really a great game. it satisfy me so much. i always smile thinking about this game today.

What's so good about this game?
everything. the first thing that took my attention is the demon girls harem concept with an interesting and unique art style. im a lazy person so at first i want to play this later but my friend said its 50mb only so i immediately download this and play it. my first impression when i open the menu was, the music. the music was very amazing through the whole game. im so hyped while im starting the game. then i see myself in the game and that is the mc that has the same taste with demon girls.
the first lvl was hard at first try bcs its been a long time since i play this kind of puzzle game. but i finished it anyway and encounter the first demon girl waifu. it makes me so happy. after several levels and demon waifus, i encounter lvl 6 and lvl 7 where its hard for me. but, behind those hardwork solving the puzzle, i got a beautiful prize and that is the demon waifus. i dont care how hard the puzzle is, i just want the demon waifus. i could easily just skip the level but as a demon girls lover, i must do it purely. and then i encounter the final demon waifu. i didnt  expect it would be a boss battle and its amazing despite the previous lvls were all puzzle. i thought the game has just finished there then my friend said that theres more in the game and i explore it more. thus i completed it all and get the artbook. i didnt expect you just gave the artbook like that, i really appreciate it. i will not get the artbook if my friend didnt told me you gave a free artbook. but i still want to support you by buying the dlc. ill buy it someday when i have some money.

TL;DR :
+good UI
+great art (i really really love the artstyle)
+great music
+simple mechanic yet interesting
+BEAUTIFUL DEMON WAIFUS
+great sound
+very very satisfying
-no steam card
-no steam profile wallpaper ( i really really want this for my profile )

Купил игру, думал поборю свой страх перед подводными засранцами.
Поудивлялся красоте мира, всё здорово. Графоний на уровне, оптимизация есть, немного огорчает средняя дальность прорисовки.
В дальнейшем мой окончательный 3х часовой геймплей выглядел так:
1) Нашёл маленькую пещеру под спасательной капсулой, мирно собирал ресурсы. 
2) Камикадзе кричит над ухом.
3) Обосрался.

1) Плаваю по дну у леса водорослей, собираю серебро-золото.
2) Рык над головой. 4 сталкера и 1 песчаная акула.
3) Обосрался.

1) Уплыл подальше от всего этого дерьма .
2) Заплыл на 500 метров от капсулы, рык. Думал обосрусь, но увидел, что существо не нападает - коралловый скат или вроде того. Пообжимал его сосцы, собрал что было.
3) Опустился пониже, опять обосрался.

В общем спасибо, было вкусно, интересно и красиво. Но я не готов столько раз менять трусы, жаль игру не вернуть, но она того стоит, если ваш анус твёрд.

app_name: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition
review: Ну это Skyrim что тут сказать)

Первая часть игры была, откровенно, слабая. Но, у меня еще теплилась надежда, что во второй части Obsidian исправятся и избавяться от всех её недостатков. Но, чуда не случилось. Это все та же скудная на сюжет и персонажей поделка, приправленная графоманией. Но, им показалось этого мало и они «усилили» сюжет «культурными ценностями» народов, населяющих Архипелаг. Также, ссылаясь на «нежных» игроков, которым первая часть показалась слишком сложной, они полностью оказуалили её. Теперь, чтобы получить все достижения, не обязательно убивать всех легендарных чудовищ в соло на «Пути проклятых».  Почему же они продвигают свою игру, как «хардкорную ролевую игру для олдскульных игроков»?! Единственное, что в этой игре хорошего, по сравнению с первой частью - «подтянутая» графика и графические эффекты.

Kleines aber feines Rätselspiel. :) Der Schwierigkeitsgrad der Rätsel reicht von "leicht" bis "mittel", meiner Meinung nach. Wer aber Schwierigkeiten hat, kann vom Spiel Tipps annehmen. :D Mich persönlich hat es ziemlich gefesselt, finde es schon schade, dass es so kurz ist. :( Für 1-2 Stunden ist man auf alle Fälle am Bildschirm gefesselt. Graue Zellen und Probierfreudigkeit sollte man für das Spiel auf alle Fälle mitbringen. Die Achievements gibt es allesamt beim Durchspielen. 

Das einzig negative, dass mir auffiel, war ein Bug, der ein Rätsel unschaffbar machte, da half nur ein Neustart des Kapitels.

Zum Salepreis definitive Kaufempfehlung, auch für Leute, die Rätselspiele nicht sonderlich oft spielen. Zum Normalpreis muss es jeder für sich entscheiden.

Its fucking good

So nu mein zweites Review, da ich der Meinung bin das dieses Spiel eins verdient.
Ich bin ein großer Fan von Spielen wie My Time at Portia, Stardew Valley, Harvest Moon und viele mehr und ich muss persönlich sagen das dies mit zu meinen absoluten Lieblingsspielen gehört.

Es gibt einem alles was man für ein Farmspiel braucht, auch wenn man sich am Anfang erstmal durchfuchsen muss.
Die Möglichkeit auch das gleiche Geschlecht heiraten zu können macht es sympatischer, weil es in einigen Farmspielen verwehrt bleibt, obwohl das mittlerweile in unserer Kultur normal ist.

Man sorgt in My Time at Portia für Veränderungen und das macht es so unglaublich Spaß die Stadt bei einigen Stellen selber aufzubauen und dafür zu sorgen das jeder glücklich ist.

Herauszufinden was die Personen mögen kommt man auch schnell drauf wenn man sich ihre Art genau ansieht und man schaltet neue Quest frei wenn man sich mehr mit ihnen anfreundet.
Ich mag es auch die Wahl zu haben mit denen auf ein Date zu gehen und somit die Punkte schneller steigern zu lassen.
Das jede Person ein Bonus gibt je mehr man sich mit ihnen anfreundet motiviert einen noch mehr sie mit Geschenken zu bewerfen wenn ich das mal so sagen darf.

Dieses Spiel hat mich auf sehr vielen Ebenen gefesselt und ich kriege immer noch nicht genug, weswegen ich noch ein Charakter erstellt habe um es nochmal durchzuspielen und die Fähigkeitspunkte mal anders zu skillen. (gibt es natürlich auch die haben an einiges so gedacht^^)

Eine Negative Sache gibt es trotzdem noch...das Kampfsystem ist nicht besonders herausragend auch wenn ich das von einem Farmspiel nicht erwarte, aber das Gegner durch eine Waffe stucken oder gar aufhören mich anzugreifen ist nicht besonders fair, da ich dadurch einige Kämpfe gewonnen habe ohne das ich es hätte dürfen.
Naja und das es ab und zu von Deutsch auf Englisch wechselt, aber das wird sicher noch gefixt. Hoffe ich. ^^

Trotz dieses kleines Markels bringt My Time at Portia unglaublich viel Spaß und ich kann es jedem nur empfehlen der genauso süchtig nach Farmspielen wie ich ist.
Immerhin hat das Spiel mein Lieblingsspiel Stardew Valley überholt.

Ich wünsche allen die es noch spielen werden genauso viel Spaß wie ich den hatte/habe.
Für den Preis lohnt es sich. =3

Одна из любимых моих игр вообще и уникальный, как по мне, продукт. До этой игры относился к такому жанру как инди с полным равнодушием, ошибочно считая, что инди-игры "неполноценные" да и вообще неинтересные и некачественные, как же я ошибался..

В этой игре есть абсолютно все, чтобы вам понравиться:
Во-первых это уникальный геймплей, хардкорный, но к нему быстро привыкаешь, и он начинает тебе нравится свой сложностью. Уровни отлично прорисованы, как для 2D игры. Противники хоть и бывают иногда туповаты, но тоже сделаны на достойном уровне.
Во-вторых это саундтрек. Он поистине идеален. Во время сложных миссий это будет напряжённая, быстрая музыка. Во время перерывов она будет вас успокаивать. Вообщем подбор композиций отличный.
В-третьих графика, это вообще отдельная тема. Сначала привыкаешь к слишком ярким цветам, но спустя полчаса геймплея понимаешь, что это и создаёт эту игру, делает её запоминающейся и безумной.
И наконец сама атмосфера этой игры, вы точно не забудете о ней, пройдя её хотя бы один раз.

Безусловно в неё стоит поиграть всем, неважно любите вы 2D или нет, любите вы инди или нет, любите ли вы хардкор или же нет, эта игра обязана вам понравится!

Nihilistic robots with existentialism problems in a bullet hell /rpg sci -fi  hack and slash open world game, that's the summary of the whole game sounds crazy right it is. Nier Automata manages to blend perfectly a plethora of game genres in a way that's never been done before. Combat is really solid and exciting making every fight an enjoyable moment. The story is also really strong with many twists but in order to really appreciate it you need to know what happened in the previous games of the series. Game is also packed with an amazing soundtrack which adds on the already amazing environment and graphics. Memorable battles like the Beauvoir encounter combined with the amazing soundtrack make you feel like you are a part of this masterpiece. Along with all these stuff the game also deals with Nietzsche ideologies + the influence religion has on people and discussing the meaning of life  or what defines to be alive or even to be happy and the whole process different individuals partake in order to achieve that. Game also breaks the fourth wall plenty of times while introducing plenty of subjects about philosophy and ideology questioning your actions or what is right or wrong. The fun part is that all these heavy suggestive themes  are introduced while  your protagonist is a half naked anime girl and while the atmosphere in some aspects of the game is really heavy or gloomy in other its like you are watching an episode of one piece. This is clearly a creation of a mad man yoko taro but does it work? Of course it does and in my opinion this the best most unique fresh game that came out in 2017 by far
