[h1] Cтоит ли играть в RUSt? [/h1] 
Зависит от того на сколько крепка ваша психика, и на сколько вы Не казуальный игрок. 
[h1]Кому не стоит играть в RUST?[/h1] 
[list] 
[*]Соло игрокам интровертам 
[*]Людям у кого нет часа по 3 ежедневно только на RUST 
[*]Тем кому нужно часто отлучаться куда либо от компьютера по любым причинам 
[*]Тем кто очень трудно воспринимает потерю ВСЕГО и РАЗОМ в один прекрасный день 
[*]Нытикам которые думают что если они только появились то они "в домике" и их нельзя убивать. 
[/list] 

А теперь когда мя дала понять кому не стоит играть сразу и если первый "барьер" вы преодолели вот вам ещё. 

Да мя поставлю "рекомендую" всё же игра слишком уникальна в своей реализации. 
[h1]Как ты можешь охарактеризовать жанр игры ?[/h1] 
Симулятор анархичного общества с элементами выживания. 
Заметьте элементами выживания, раст это не D0nt Starve да тут надо есть пить и согреваться ночью и в холодном биоме, но все эти мелочи кажутся значительными только поначалу дальше всё это быстро отходит на второй план PVE контент в игре крайне скудно развит не ждите тут глубинности оного это PvP направленная игра практически полностью окружение лишь инструменты для местных "войнушек" между игроками хотя некоторые мобы всё же заставят вас помучатся вас легко в ночи забадает кабан догонит и загрызёт медведь а развитых игроков с огнестрелом может подстрелить вертолёт (скоро выйдет ещё и танк и учёные в туннелях) но это мелочи и они не играют ключевую роль. 
Основной упор в игре на выживание среди людей где каждая ваша ошибка повод наказать в ас другим игроками в итоге путь становления в игре это путь целиком вымощенный нервами слёзами обидами и потраченным временем вы либо учитесь и становитесь умнее хитрее изобретательнее и параноиком либо умираете раз за разом крайне тупо и теряете всё вплоть до вашего RQ и удаления игры. 

[h1]Каке проблемы у игры ?[/h1] 
Оооо их много поверьте но выделю главные 
[list] 
[*]Поиск сервера, крайне трудно найти не модифицированный сервер без казуальных плагинов с приемлемым пингом и без засилья читеров как на ОФ серверах, а главное RU офф сервера постоянно падают разом и могут быть оффлайн по несколько часов. 
[*]Разные люди с разным железом жалуются на лаги, у меня на компе 2013ого не лагает на Simpl у кого то и на топ компе будет лагать. Оптимизация всё же в игре слабая. 
[*]Нынешняя система исследования чертежей, вас вынуждает фармить металлолом в промышленных масштабах в ходе фарма вас постоянно будут убивать те у кого уже есть огнестрел а для того что бы собрать и скрафтить верстак 3его уровня вам нужно 1800 металлолома(с бочки 2 в коробках по 5 максимум) ну и вас будут убивать убивать и убивать и вы ничего не поделаете с этим ибо у них уже есть огнестрел а у вас нет. 
[*] Игра крайне не дружелюбна к соло игрокам, так устроен баланс что одному играть анриал, только играть по очень очень ОЧЕНЬ много часов каждый день, что сами понимаете не самое приятное удовольствие. 
[*] RU комьюнити, да мя знаю что на него жалуются во всех наверно играх, но попав в это анархичное общество и встретив тут наших "Орков" поверьте даже Дотеры покажутся ещё более менее людьми. Крайне отвратительное отношение, заметьте речь только про поведение в виде хамства и т.д. а не в целенаправленном выслеживании убийствах и рейде вашего дома. 
[*] У игры по сути есть определённый потолок когда вы попробуете всё то не смотря на PvP составляющую игры вы скорее всего почувствуете скуку, это не весёлый спортивный шутан аля CS 1.6 нет тут реиграбельнось слишком субъективна и многим может показаться что потратили время зря ибо контента не так много как кажется, останется только рейдить всех подряд убивать всех подряд и т.д. 
[/list] 

[h1]Всё так плохо ? Но зачем тогда играть в RUST?[/h1] 
Ну мя начала играть ещё в самом начале на LEgacy (нет не корчу олдфака) отыграла ещё там 100 часов и поверьте легаси была ужасна всем (кроме системы ресёрч китов вот они были лучше чем металлолом) и играть снова начала незадолго до релиза когда игру довели до ума. 
Главное это эмоции поверьте ни одна другая игра не даст вам ТАКИЕ яркие как включённый ночью экран смартфона эмоции: ненависть, злость, психи, RQ, разочарование в себе, предательство людей, и т.д. и т.п. на фоне этого будут контрастом ощущение некой безопасности когда вы построите свой первый дом что очень сильно будет цениться вами, это вам не в майнкампфе из земли дом на ночь от зомбей построить! 
А потом вас ломанут за то что вы забыли повесить замок на дверь или допустили ещё какую ошибку и снова ненависть ко всем людям и приступы обострения Мизантропии. 
А потом вы всё же сумев построить свой нормальный дом где то нашли ценные ресурсы и с ними в темноте ночи, добежали домой поверьте радости будет море. 
Или выигранное PvP с другим игроком особенно если он вас превосходил навыком и снарягой и при этом убив его вы заберёте всё что было на нём себе. 
Эмоции от первого удачного (или нет) рейда и т.д. и т.п. 
торговля местная локальная дипломатия, разведка территории в поисках своей "святой обители" есть ещё уйма того что вы сможете пережить. 
Мя конечно никак не доберусь до того что бы поиграть в ОПЛОТ ХАРДКОРА современного гейминга в лице Тёмных душ так всеми расхвалеваемых за сложность. 
Но поверьте когда кто то горделиво говорит о том какой он мастер игры в Dark Souls и говорит о том какая ведь она сложная, где то там тихо мирно и снисходительно улыбаясь смотрит на это RUSTаман понимая на сколько же это чёрт побери истинное HARDC0Rное испытание в современном гейминге. 

Только желание испытать настоящие эмоции почувствовать все горести и радости прочуять что такое адреналин от игры, пожалуй только это перевешивает все минусы игры.
Это одна большая социальная песочница в условиях анархичного постапокалиптического мира и именно взаимодействия с игроками предоставляет простор для действий.
Вы можете мстить кому то за рейд вашего дома, можете даже построить галерею своих картин для игроков сервера. Вообщем для тех кто умеет развлекать себя игра зайдёт больше чем для тех кто хочет просто пострелять.

En revanche cela fait plus de 2ans il me semble que ce jeu est en Béta, c'est un peu comme si le jeu nous disais :"Ah mais si il y a des bugs c'est parceque le jeu n'est pas fini...". Enfin bref sinon un jeu "pas fini" (c'est une béta) bien fini :')  .
Ah si oui derniere chose que je voulais dire lorsque on est dans un serveur et qu'on veut en partir on fait escape normal et la, mon premier reflexe est de cliquer sur le bouton du haut qui est une fleche qui veut dire partir... sauf qui c'est pour quitter le jeu et pas le serveur x)...

Portal 2 is an excellent sequel to the Portal franchise!
If you are looking for a great puzzle game I would say this game is for you!
So anyways here are my thoughts and opinions of this game's qualities:
==================================================================

Story is very awesome! (10/10)
>> I don't want to spoil the story but I would add that the story is a great
sequel that doesn't disappoint!
>> I really felt like I wanted to know what would happen next all the time!
>> I could just say I couldn't ask for more than this!

Level design is a masterpiece! (10/10)
>> The levels present challenging and interesting puzzles.
>> It is definitely an improvement over the first game!
>> I haven't felt too stuck in the levels but it did take time to complete them.
>> Every test chamber felt so satisfying to complete!
>> There is a huge variety of level designs that all feel and work very well!
>> The environment is very carefully designed to work on a whole other level!
>> Over all very well done to the developers!

Graphics are Amazing! (10/10)
>> The graphics are so good even now a days it still holds very well!
>> This game's graphics are a huge improvement from the last game!
>> The graphics definitely compliment this game's atmosphere astonishingly!
>> I especially liked the broken glass and laser effects/particles!
>> Nothing really felt out of place.

Game setting/atmosphere is excellent (10/10)
>> Portal 2 improves on the already very cool and good atmosphere!
>> Portal 2 brings new locations that create the perfect atmosphere.
>> In this game you could really tell how big is the Aperture Science lab!
>> I never felt like the developers did a lazy job, they worked very hard on every
corner and it shows!

Puzzles are very well designed (10/10)
>> The puzzles as I already said are challenging and fun.
>> I am very impressed with how they handled them and made them so good!
>> The puzzles them selves aren't frustrating which is a very good thing!

The "tools" are very fun (10/10)
>> The 'Portal-Gun' itself is very fun and a cool idea, but in this game
they decided to add a few more things that would help make the portal
gun and the environment even more fun and enjoyable!

Combat is still very fun (10/10)
>> This is a portal game so there isn't too much to say about combat.
>> I really liked the ways that you fight the enemies, and the final boss
is designed perfectly.
>> I really enjoyed engaging in combat!

Sounds are amazing (9/10)
>> Sounds fit the game and its atmosphere in a beneficial way!
>> I believe that the sounds still hold up to this day very well!
>> The voice acting also feels perfect and immersive!

Movement is well done (9/10)
>> It really sucks that you can't crouch jump in this game,
or bunny-hop like in Portal 1, but I feel that made the game feel
more serious and less buggy!
>> And everything else is pretty much still there.
>> Nothing more to add here, I really like the movement of source games.

Achievement are  fun (8/10)
>> I haven't completed all of them, but the once that I did I enjoyed
very much!
>> You will complete around 40%-50% of them just by playing through the
campaign!

Soundtracks are good (7/10)
>> There aren't too many soundtracks which is a shame because,
the tracks that do exist are so good and well made!
>> The OSTs fit the game atmosphere so well and don't feel out of place!
>> I especially liked the little songs that play when you jump from a "jump 
pad?"(or however those things called) or fly through the level!

Other:
Cons:
- I would wish for more variety in the enemy types.
- I also wish that Valve would've made the puzzles' solutions a bit more
obvious, because for me at least I felt sometimes that I didn't know what
to do next, and it sucked, but luckily it wasn't for very long!

Side comments/notes:
- I played through the campaign about 2-3 times and still enjoy it!
- I also played a bit co-op and it was very fun! but I feel like I haven't
played the co-op enough so I won't be reviewing it.
==================================================================
So after all of that, finally, I would give Portal 2 a very solid (9/10),

Not having known the world of DC Comics' Fables, I was a bit sceptic about the whole setting. My expectations were quite high after having finished the two seasons of The Walking Dead by Telltale and I didn't think I can get the same emotional-roller-coaster type of experience from talking frogs anda wolf sheriff as from Lee and Celementine.
I am glad to say that Telltale has proven me wrong. Yes, the setting is strange but the dark story and the film-noir ambiance of The Wolf Among Us manages create something unique that is anything but childish. 
Bigby Wolf proved to be a great playable character -- sour, violent, outcast, extremely strong but still, guided by good intentions (a bit like Geralt of Rivia, The Witcher). Your choices have real consequences. The ending is pretty much still the same, but how you get there can affect certain points. (Plus, there is no Paragon-Renegade, of course, the game doesn't try to influence your actions.) Sure, some of the characters could be better but we are talking about fable characters, so their one-sidedness in certain cases actually supports the storyline.
Without any spoilers, let me add that the ending paves the way for a second season, which, if gets realised, can certainly consider me among those who'll pre-order.

I've tried it for 12 hours, not sure what is wrong with it, but...

I'm not having fun.

I mean, it should be similar to factorio or rimworld or lobotomy corporation... or heck, even dwarf fortress. The mechanics seem to be there, the graphics are cutesy/humorous, but ...

I'm not having fun. Not sure what the problems is. Right off the bat the game devolves into tedium and is uneventful. Getting somewhere takes forever, and while interesting mechanics unlock over time, they unlocks slowly and do not present a dramatic change like factorio. The game also is not addictive like factorio was. In 12 hours I haven't lost a single base or a single character with it, so it ended up not being entertaining, perhaps due to slow unlock of technologies, lack of ridiculous events and so on.

So it is a weak negative. 

Some people seem to love it, though.

Oyun orta çağ savaş simulatörü. Yanılmıyorsam eğer 16 - 18 karakter var. Tavsiyem bunlardan birini seçin size en uygun olanını sonra sadece o karaktere kasın ve yalnız üstün reputationlar da kasa açın yoksa paranız çöp olur. İlk başlar da seçtiğiniz karakterle zorlanacaksınız ama o karakterin haraketlerini öğrendikten sonra iş biraz kolaylaşıyor. Özellikle bazı avellere karşı dikkatli olun çünkü spamlamaktan başka bir şey bilmiyorlar esas da Orochi adlanan karakter ile. Artı oyunun bir senaryosu var ama sarmıyor training gibi düşüne bilirsiniz. Oyun da pek bug görmedim ama serverlar iğrenç kötü her zaman olmasa da çoğu zaman oyundan atıyor. Bu ara da iyi bir setupınızın olması gerek. Oyunu yine de ücretsiz alın zaten Uplay ve ya Steam ayda ya da yılda bir kez free yapıyorlar ve oyunun spamcı kanser kitlesi oyunu berbat hale sokuyor. Pek tavsiye etmiyorum.

I'm pretty new to traditional fighting games, and my friends told me that if I wanted to get into 2D fighters, this game would be a good start.  So I decided to pick up the game and here is what I think of it.
          
           Overall, the game is pretty good but highly overpriced for what it is.  The graphics are nice and the gameplay is pretty solid, but it's nothing to get excited about.  The story mode is to simply put it,  terrible, and unlocking the three secret characters is a long and painful process.  One of them you can only unlock by completing the previously mentioned horrible story mode, and for the other two you're probably better off just buying them as DLC.  On the topic of DLC, the devs announced that there will be not one, or two, but eight total DLC characters that were going to be released in the future.  Now I would be okay with this but they made this announcement BEFORE THE GAME'S INITIAL RELEASE!  This makes me feel that the game is being treated more like some sort of cash cow rather than a proper flagship title.  Summing it up, only buy this game if it's on sale. I cannot reccomend buying it for full price as I can't think of a reason to validate the sixty dollar price tag.

UPDATE:  So the first DLC characters came out fairly recently and for what they are, they are extremely overpriced just like the rest of this game.  The hefty price tag on the DLC Characters pretty much confirms my thoughts on this game being nothing more than a money pit  of sorts for the devs, which makes me sad because the game itself isn't bad and has potential to be really good.  Needless to say, I will not buy the DLC.

Positives:
The superpowers are great and the stealth is wonderful.
Movment feels very fluid and comfortable.
Each level is different and has a great atmosphere that leaves a memory of good times with it.
The story is interesting and the unique art style matches the gloomy European setting perfectly.
Multible endings and achivements to encourage more playthroughs.
Cool upgrades for weapons and hidden ones that pushes exploration.
DLC is great as well and can explain things for the game.
The God of the game is the perfect amount of mysterious and explained withing the game, with the hidden scrolls and books in the game.

(Opinion) The sword is cool, thats it, it just is.

Negatives:
The stealth can sometimes be too easy (enemies take to long to spot you) even in harder dificulties. But can be easily fixed with changing the difficulty or mods.
Some cutscenes are unskippible and take time to finish (mostly boatrides)
The "good ending" is a little harder to complete due to there only being 2 ways to not kill an enemy (besides skipping the enemies)


Overall, if you are a stealth/superpower fan, get this game. it is my favorite game of all time and has not been overdone by any other game yet.

Os itens dos personagens são customizáveis, mas não afetam muito o andamento do jogo, que por sinal é bastante travado, assim como os sons.

If you are looking for a ww2 shooter with focus on close quarter combat, teamplay and realistic handling+damage this is it.
 
If you want to shoot while jumping around you are going to have a bad time in this game. Normally one well placed bullet is enough to get a kill, but you might hit nothing while you're running. 
It's basically the same as in insurgency, made by the same developers. 
But compared to Insurgency this game has a better balanced class system and it feels a bit more polished. 

As in Insurgency every class loadout is the same at the beginning of a match, but you can earn points to change and upgrade your equipment so everyone basically has the same chances. 
The maps are well done, also the voice acting is way better than in other ww2 shooters. 
And don't forget the gore and dismemberment, it's awesome. 

There are also no perks, lootboxes and useless/unrealistic attachments, so you won't see anybody running around with a fancy coloured mp40 with a holosight on it. 

If you are looking for realistic large scale combat in WW2 i'd recommend Red Orchestra 2 btw.

The FitnessGram™ Pacer Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues. The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds. Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly, but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal. [beep] A single lap should be completed each time you hear this sound. [ding] Remember to run in a straight line, and run as long as possible. The second time you fail to complete a lap before the sound, your test is over. The test will begin on the word start. On your mark, get ready, start.

Absolut Top!
Das Spiel hat mich bisher am längsten von allen Singleplayern, die ich je hatte, beschäftigt.
Ich hatte mich sehr auf Fallout4 im Vorfeld gerfreut und hatte bis jetzt so lange wie noch nie Spaß an einem Spiel.

Story:
Hauptstory ist eher durchschnittlich, aber vorhanden. xD
naja gut, ich bin da nicht so unheimlich anspruchsvoll, aber dem ein oder anderen ist sie vielleicht zu mau.
Nebenquests sind allerdings oftmals richtig lustig oder interessant gestrickt. 
Ist man geduldig genug im Ödland auch mal nach information zu suchen, die nicht auf den ersten Blick erkennbar ist (Terminals, Briefe, Gespräche), bekommt man Vieles mit, das die Fallout- Welt ergänzt^^

Gameplay:
Super.
Es macht richtig Spaß im Ödland mit einer direkteren Steuerung als in den Vorgängern herumzulaufen, zu kämpfen und zu bauen. Selbst das überarbeitet V.A.T.S.  ist immer noch gelungen und passt bestens ins Spielgeschehen.
Dass das Bauen mir gefällt (und der ganze Siedlungskram drumherum) hat mich übrigens selbst überrascht.
Aber ich kann damit Stunden verbringen zwischen den ganzen Quests.
Siedlungen ausbauen, voll funktionsfähig zu machen und Geld zu erwirtschaften sowie erfolgreich zu verteigen kosteten mich jetzt schon dutzende Stunden und macht immer noch Laune :)

Grafik:
Ist mir schon wichtig. Und ich finde sie für dieses große OpenWorld Spiel extrem gut gelungen, sehr hübsch und extrem stimmig. Geniales Artdesign (wie immer) und eine lebendige Welt.
Nur die Optimierung finde ich daneben. Mit diesem sinnlosen Gameworks (ich habe das Spiel sowohl mit einer nvidia GTX780Ti als auch mit einer AMD radeon Fury gespielt) hat sich Bethesda bei mir einen dicken Minuspunkt eingehandelt.
In Boston habe ich massive FPS Drops, das ist nicht mehr schön.
Bitte das nächste Mal schlecht programmierten Proprietärmüll draußen lassen :/
Außer in Boston und manchen Stellen außerhalb läuft das Spiel auf Extrem fluffig.

Also alles in Allem eines der besten Spiele ever für mich!

EDIT: I originally said had this game as 'not recommended' (reasosns stated below). Since recent updates, I am changing my review to ' recommended'. This has become my favorte action / shooter. 


Still Early Access, so, maybe things will change, although my complaints lies with something inherent to the game's rules rather than any technical shortcomings...although, it could use some optimization. 

I've played the game long enough to master the basics as well as some of the more intermediary concepts and strategies.

So thegame starts like this: you jump out of plane, decide where you want to land. From high risk/high reward areas that see alot of action quickly, to low risk/low reward areas where you can take your time. Identifying these locations is fairly simple from the airplane as small isolated towns away from the aircraft's flight path are likely to have few if any nearby players whereas big urban centers along the flight path will start ringing with gunfire almost imediatley. The twist is, you're more likely to find equipment to help you survive in those spots while landing in the backwoods can be a tedious shack-to-shack search for basic equipment. Generaly, I prefer to find level 2 gear and a rifle before actually starting the hunt, however, many players play far more aggresively, which gets to the heart of my issue with the game. 

I try to mix up the playstyles, doing backwoods crawls for gear, hunting the other players who had similar ideas, or jumping right into the firefight, but either way I find myself spending a lot of time anticipating players only to be quickly destroyed by an unseen player. It is frustrating to spend 10-15min preparing and looking for a fight only to be constantly ambushed along the way. I'm no fool, I stick to cover when moving, use topography to coneal flanks, even bait traps by placing desirbale loot in places where I should be able to ambush succesfully. Yet, more often than not, once an engagement starts, I find myself disadvnataged. Some players, what appears to be most players to me, are excellent with their aim. I'm not saying it's cheating, I've watched streams of very talented players who just are that good. So my issue is that I am not good enough to engage in CQC, I always lose. Which leaves me to prefer a more long-distance approach with a rifle. Yet, the constantly shriking play field means I'm constantly having to choose between bad and worse positions, bad and worse times to move. I just played a round, manged to make it to #8 without killing anyone. I shot a few, but they ran off. Towards the end, I was moving between rocks and trees to make it to the play field. When suddenly, despite level 3 armor and helmet, I'm gunned down instantly by an unseen assailaint; none of his shots missed. 

Essentially, each playthrough leads to more frustrations than enjoyment. It's seldom I play a PC game and find myself muttering, "I hate this game" while simulteanously quickly clicking the "Play" button because I don't want to let it get the better of me. But I've had enough, I spend so much time in the game trying to give myself as many advanatges as possible, only to have it all wiped away in an instant. I understand the appeal, its an addiciting loop, espeically if you're competative or have good twitch reflexes. But if you prefer a more slow, deliberate game like the original Arma mod this is based off, you'll be disappointed, this game rewards reflexes and aggression more than planning and preparing. 

Now, did I get my money's worth? Yes. Am I not recommending the game unconditionaly? No. Will I keep playing? Probably. So why am I not recommending it? Because it's too single minded, there's really only one succesful strategy (be twitchy and aggressive), it's and addicting loop, but I wish it reward different playstyles more consitently. 

If any of what you read sounded like a good game to you, then by all means, get it, you'll love it! It is a good game, I don't deny it that, just not a game for me....although I'm sure my masochism will lead me back to trying to qonquer it again at some point.

I've played through the whole story and can say this game is absolutely worth it. However, make sure you enjoy story/text heavy games, there is always a lot of information to take in. I can't recommend this game highly enough. The characters are all easy to love and you feel genuine pain when a character you like is found dead or guilty. The soundtrack is also awesome, and will stick in your head. In summary: Buy this game, you won't regret it.

I was trying to savour this game but I couldn't stop playing it whenever possible. Well it's over now(going back for collectables missed a few) and I gotta say I think this is even better than Doom 2016. Early game ammo was a problem and It took me awhile to get used to the new flow of combat, but once I hit the mid game I was having a blast. There isn't as much liberty in dispatching enemies as some might like, you need to play how the devs intended, but I prefer this because otherwise I'd prob had been lazy and just spam super shotgun like I did in the previous game. Rotating through weapons constantly was def an issue early game but once I upgrade my ammo cap I was able to use the weapons I enjoyed most more often but still there are just "the right tools for the job" on many enemies which is good and bad. I see alot of peeps hate the marauder but I actually really enjoyed the dodge and waiting for him to attack mechanic it's more intense than most enemies and requires patience. The level design was pretty linear for the most part but a huge open world doom game wouldn't be very good imo this is how it should be it's a good balance. The game looks and runs amazing no surprise there but always nice playing a game and just being fully immersed and not getting distracted by lost frames. I did encounter a few bugs I got stuck a few times and I lost 10 extra lives when escaping the base after the heart puzzle thing which was really annoying. I just kept respawning and was trapped in the lightning and couldnt move. Ultra Violence was the perfect difficulty for me not too easy and not super hard I felt very satisfied when I finished a tough battle/boss. This game will give you hours upon hours of playtime and with mods even more. If you ever wanted to play as a empire or faction, both fictional and non-fictional, then you can play as them often with a little work. and some mods. Mods really expand the game allowing to play as specific empires, both original and non original. What I mean is that you can make empires using the games assets or you can recreate a fictional such as a Star Wars,Halo,Mass Effect, or Star Trek to name a few, or non fictional one like Earth in the future or a space version of a historical nation. Mods and DLC add al ot to the game for all of the listed reasons before.Oh and one last thing to quote a Youtuber (Lathland or Aspec) you can pick a color and see it grow on the map.

Pros:
-Better than SE
-Great storyline
-No achievements disabled while using mods
-No TAA
-Great optimisation
-Free High Textures DLC pack

Cons:
-Some physics issues when going beyond 60FPS
-Mods can sometime be the cause of Skyrim crashing
-32 Bit (TBH, it's not really a big thing)

Summary:
Now this is a *BETTER* version of Skyrim but without some of those enhancements but you have modders who may have done it via creation tool, this game's really addicting, once you play it, it'll be stuck with you forever with you playing 24/7. It's almost like DOTA 2 & CSGO!

Overall Score: 9.5/10

horas y horas de vicio

Let's "Civilize" 
You start the game having migrated to a place with a set of ressources, livestocks and people; but winter is coming, and this is something like the medieval times. 

Like many other great civilization games, you'll harvest ressources, build your town and manage your ressources, including F***ing to raise the population.     This game is R-rated!
There's no goal except the achievements and trying to expand your town as much as possible. 

However in banished you'll get sucked dry of ressources, your population will starve and die, and your hard work will crumble faster than Frieza could destroy the town. 
You'll restart town number over 9000! and only a wish from Shenron can earn you all of the achievements.  
Trust me, it would be faster gathering the DragonBalls. 

If you want a challenge, go watch your town starve in hardcore mode, mountain map and harsh weather! I dare you, super Saiyan!

[h1] Thumbs Up [/h1]
This game poses a real challenge! 
But at least you don't get attacked by enemies - Mother Nature is your worst enemy here.

With endless randomly generated maps, and many game settings, this game has a lot of replay-value. 

Supports a lot of mods which makes the game more fun to your liking, however it disables achievements for that particular playthrough. - Cheating proof!

You can send your whole population to the mines and quarries where they belong!! 

[h1] Thumbs Down [/h1]
More frustrating and time consuming than baking a cake outside only using sunlight, on a spot not located anywhere near Australia.
Because baking a cake only using sunlight in Australia would be.. yeah.. a piece of cake.

[h1] Closing Comments	[/h1]
You're a god and you can destroy the world or make it flourish! Command thy weak humans.

This game has little to none to do with minecraft!

So after paying full price and 10 hours of play i feel i can give a rather simple review..

its a simulator that functions well enough to do the job that you're asking it to do. 
i wont deny there is alittle bit of jank when it comes to the camera and just figuring out how the games engine operates, most of which can be worked around and figured out by simply playing through the very short tutorial.

the only other problems come with some of the workshop content being alittle hit and miss due to missing assets but its nothing that alittle bit of trial and error cant fix when subscribing to different workshop content.

to sum up...

is the game fun?  
yes once you find the games you want to play

do i need firends? 
they help but there is an active community of players which the game allows you to play with and find through the chat system in game.

does the game function?
yes there is some jank but once you get used to it its all part of the games charm

is it worth $20?
more of a subjective question but if you have friends that are already playing and you enjoy yourself a good board game from time to time then i would say yes

if not then wait till it goes on sale and pick it up hell buy the 4 pack and hand out a copy to a couple of friends and once you all get used to it i'm sure you will more than get your moneys worth.

Civilization VI is about the map. Everything in the game ties back to the map. Strategic acquisitions? The information is encoded in the map. Troop deployments? See the map. Wonder and district placement? Requires the map. The primary mechanic is to control the map, and that is a good mechanic for a 4X. I spend less time staring at spreadsheets than I do in other games.

Civilization VI is a well-defined game whose rules don't change (that much). It doesn't rely much on unpredictable randomness or random events. It doesn't have a structure-free or non-linear tech tree. It doesn't incorporate fantasy or science fiction units. It's not too hard to understand the basic mechanics in Civ VI. You take your civilization from the Ancient Era through to the near future, and hold onto your empire the whole way. You can replay the same setup over and over again, like chess; but it will still be engaging and new.

Civ VI is great for single player and multi player.

Multiplayer is fun. Unfortunately once you get 9 people, things get a little iffy. It seems like the game was designed for 8 humans, and that anyone after that suffers the likely consequence of getting kicked out. Playing with 4 on a dedicated router was smooth as butter (once we disabled adapters), but a larger number was difficult.

For LAN, you have to disable all your PC's network adapters, except the one in use, in order to enable LAN discovery. If one person chronically can't see anyone's hosted game, they likely need to disable network adapters. This can be a pain, because your friends might not believe the requirement, and believe that their adapters are disabled when they are not.

Civ VI provides two multiplayer turn modes: dynamic and simultaneous. The dynamic turn mode is simultaneous, except when two parties are at war. Then those two parties take sequential turns for the duration of the war. I personally detest the other mode, "simultaneous turns", which lets enemies at war take their turns at the same time, because the game is then a matter of who can click the fastest with the slowest lag time. There's a big advantage to attacking first, rather than being attacked. And if four human neighbors simultaneously declare war on you, you have to be four times faster at clicking than your neighbors. Civ VI wasn't optimized for twitch gaming: the hotkeys aren't fully developed (compare Civ V), the "next turn" button takes a while and doesn't let everyone start acting at the same millisecond... Plus, the reason I got into turn-based games was to be able to play on a laptop on the couch. Otherwise I'd play StarCraft.

I also use the Hot Seat multiplayer mode, which lets multiple people play on your computer. I like to use it to play four civilizations at once myself, but it's fun with friends.

Civ VI doesn't have the same touch interface that Civ V has, if that matters to you. Nor are its hotkeys as good. When it released, the multiplayer was unplayable and would crash all the time. Fortunately that has been fixed, although it took a year or so if I remember correctly.

The Civilization franchise is to turn-based 4X gaming what Apple is to the mobile phone world. This is the latest release of the flagship franchise. I've played a lot of innovative games in this genre from other publishers, but in the end, Civilization VI provides the best strategic experience.
its good

Where to start? Everything was so well done...

They story! The story was my favorite part by far. Please, please, please make sure you watch every cut scene. Try to explore & find all of the journals too as they help you piece together the islands history.

There are optional tombs that you can do too. Some were really easy & others were slightly less easy. They didn't prove too difficult but I wish there were more of them, they were fun little distractions from the main objectives. 

I didn't notice the music too much through either playthrough. I definitely heard it when I was in combat & during some cut scenes. What I did hear was well done though. Set the mood or pumped me up for combat.

Combat was easy to get used to & fun. You have a few different weapons & can upgrade them as you want. You crouch behind things automatically in combat, you can lean left & right for better shots around corners & there are plenty of things in the environment that can be set on fire or destroyed to help you take people out. Personally I would have enjoyed a more difficult AI setting on my second playthrough but that never took away from the game (Besides, there's multiplayer maps if you really want a challenge).

The ONLY thing that I had trouble with (& have yet to actually finish) was the DLC Tomb Of The Lost Adventurer. Apparently, on the PC version, you have to do things in a certain order or you won't be able to finish it. I looked it up & tried what people said was the "correct" way 4 times. Never worked. Tried it my way a few times. Never worked. So... that's a waste of $3.00 in my opinion. Honestly, it's only 1 extra tomb.

Overall, extremely well done.
9/10

General Review:

Amazing game, very intuitive and diverse. The graphics are very cool and dark and the sound effects are simply amazing. If you like games where you need to craft things in order to survive you will love Don't Starve. And for those who think don't starving is pretty easy, well think again, there are a lot of things that will try to kill you besides your hunger.

Pros:

-Very Challenging
-Adventure Mode is fun
-Lots of craftables
-Cool "bosses"
-Sandbox mode is infinite

Cons:

-Map is kinda confusing
-You cannot write your signs, just put them on the ground
-The 2Dish graphics along with the 3D camera shift may give you a hard time placing things where you actually want them to be
-Some resources do not respawn and therefore will no longer be avaliable when you harvest them all

What could they do to make it better?

-Provide better ways to locate yourself and your items
-The map should have the option to show a specific item or material according to filters
-Make rocks respawn (the underground provides rocks but it's far too dangerous)
-Develop a better way to turn the camera around

I really enjoy the concept and mainly have been focused on playing to discover the story that is hidden in the game and I hope endnight works on that for their next game because i think it could be incredibly successful. There are some minors things that they could add to the game that would make it a fantastic game to play. It still is a lot of fun and enjoy the co op more than anything.
挺好玩的，適合一群朋友一齊玩

Цивилизация продолжает деградировать. Тупой искуственный интеллект стал еще тупее. Зачем то ввели ограничение для роста города (теперь нет нужной клетки - нет улчшения или нет чуда). В итоге кучу чудес так никто и не строит до конца игры. 
Мало было бреда со счастьем - заменили довольствием (крайне непрозрачная тема частично распределяющаяся между городами автоматически) и добавили еще проблем с жильем. 
Убрали полезные настройки при создании карты (например возможность отключения варваров которые просто заебываю порой больше чем игроки всю игру). Варвары отдельная тема - бегают толпы мотопехоты за которую не дают опыта, охуенная игра. Типа не игрок же, а варвары, зачем опыт за них? А то что ИИ скачет еще на конях наплевать.
Графика улучшилась на незаметную величину по сравнению с 5.
Следующий дебилизм (по числу но не значению) - тупняк с рабочими. ЗАЧЕМ их было переделывать? Просто испортили механику которая и так отлично работала. Раньше это был юнит который можно было захватить получив преимущество на старте, а сейчас быстро сделал улучшение и забыл о нем.
Дороги. Я так понимаю их испортили специально потому что рабы теперь у нас трехразовые. Караван послал и норм, сам дорогу прорубит. Сами дороги стали убогие, по ним медленно передвигаешься и смысл в них не особо велик.
Дерево открытий просто разделили на 2 части без какой либо логичной необходимости. Выбор правительств практически никак не влияет на игру особенно в условиях тупого ИИ.
Районы в городах - просто чтобы было не как в прошлых цивах.

Играю с 1 цивилизации, эта просто провал. Зачем делать по другому то что и так работает? Причем делать хуже чем было.
Единственный плюс который заметил за время игры в эту помойку - возможность построить гавань в городе который не стоит на побережье, и соотв. строить в нем корабли. На этом все.
2 очка из 10, не стоит потраченных денег.

Пубг- это когда в Destiny 2 на высоких в FHD 80 fps; в Овервотч на ультрах в FHD 100 fps; в Ведьмаке на ультра в FHD 50-60 fps; в AC:Odyssey на средне-высоких в FHD 50-60 fps, а тут на ультра-лоу в 900p и без теней выдает скачки от 7 до 50 кадров.

I can honestly say that, from my current experiences playing it, this is by far one of the best civ games ever produced. second only to civ 4, with a VERY tentative maybe. Everything has a comical feel to it, which adds to it. it's almost like a boardgame, yet with all the civ pieces and logic.

 I am currently playing a russia game and while I do admit the AI is a bit odd in that they LOVE to try and get me to trade silver or ivory for their gold, a lot of their things have logic in the grand scheme of things. harald the viking declared war on me in the classical era just to get a nice bit of raiding in, not to take or even really hurt me. joint wars fail miserably though, because each other wants the other one to fight instead of them. I have been involved in two in which nothing really came of them. then there was the weird bug where I declared war on... myself. nothing came of it, I was just really confused.
that aside however, with more additions to AI and content, like more amenities/civics and civilizations (all of which are incredibly unique to me at this point in time) this will easily become one of the best "one more turn" 4x games out there.

Fantastic turn-based strategy game! Having backed the kickstarter and taken part in the beta testing, I'm glad it turned out well. Looking forward to future content updates!

Rating: 8 / 10

Pros:
+ deep strategy and resource management gameplay
+ eclectic interstellar sci-fi setting with feudal-style political intrigue
+ powerful soundtrack and audio assets
+ 3D modeling and 2D concept art looks fantastic
+ great voice acting
+ dedicated service and updates from the developer

Cons:
- still in need of performance optimization
- variety of available tactical scenarios is less than expected
- multiplayer features are barebones

Update:

In light of the recent Flashpoint release, I have to express that given the DLC pricetag, the additional content (or lack thereof) is very disappointing. While I was very excited to heard that HBS was picked up by Paradox, I could not help but feel some trepidation over the possibility of one of my most favourite IPs being vulnerable to the dreaded Paradox DLC curse. As a kickstarter backer of this game, seeing my worst fears confirmed is deeply troubling. At the very least, I would expect the price for Flashpoint to be half of what it is.

I still highly recommend the base game (on sale), but if Flashpoint is the standard to go by then I definitely would not recommend the Season Pass. I'll be putting this game back on the shelf in the meantime...

On start it is very challenging. But once u have 1-2 Wolverines (Brawler) + Black knight and another whatever mech, the game is just a run thrue. 
The Ai is stupid and very predictable. After 4-5 hrs it is very easy to predict the AI movement and actions, the enemy is easy as it is allways focusing on the Heavyst/closest and/or the most damaged mech. But Longrange PPC Boat or the LRM Boat that is ripping them appart is ignored. 
Once the Pilots reach a high skill level its getting even more easy. +20% base damage on every mech with a high level pilot is so OP. 
What i am saying is, i can play tactical or i can play brutal, brutal in this case is effective, time saving, C-Bills and equipment saving. SRM Boats (3 + SRM6 in at least half the lance rips everything appart, on top of it alot of M laser and the game is done.
Don´t get me wrong the game is nice i like it, for 1,30€/h is nothing to complain about it. BUT after 10 -12 hrs its getting very monoton. The great story is covering up for that dowside until the campaign is over, but what than? Having a full assault lance 2 full Heavy lances and a fortress dropship full of light and medium mechs and so much cash that i don´t know where to stack it. WTH i am supposed to do know with the game, keep grinding? for what? There is only hardcodded missions. No wars beetwen great houses, no establishing of my own merchenarie base, NO SOLARIS VII! I want endless decent generated Missions, missions series, showing War progress, sending scouts on a planned before the drop, decent rescue missions, defense missions, own base defense missions, more voice acting, while under contrac for House Steiner, House Liao should send me an offer to drop my contract, the complete galaxy, more different ship events, And for the end, stop building paper cockpits :steamhappy:

Anyway thanks for this awesome Battletech game :steamhappy:


In short the game gives you about 30 hrs of good gameplay if you rush.

Отличная ролевая игра с открытым миром, в которой можно создать и прокачать персонажа в соответствии со своими предпочтениями. В ней множество красивых локаций и большое количество разнообразных квестов, в которых, правда, кому-то может не хватить глубины, но в целом они захватывают и отражают обширную палитру архетипов фэнтези. При этом самобытный мир Elder Scrolls увлекателен сам по себе — в нём немало талантливых находок и симпатичных деталей, и даже внутриигровые книги о них зачастую интересно читать.
Игра раскрывается как легенда, в ходе повествования которой героическому протагонисту Довакину покоряются великие противники и подчиняются фракции, в делах которых ему доводится участвовать. В итоге реальная власть в провинции Скайрим сосредотачивается в руках игрока, что в полной мере позволяет ему удовлетворить свои амбиции.
Skyrim приятно отличает от многих других RPG мнимая реалистичность боя и магии — всё выглядит достаточно серьёзно, без лишних выкрутасов и фейерверков. Вместе с тем заклинаний в игре множество, а боевая система позволяет задействовать руки раздельно, и доступные приёмы слегка отличаются в зависимости от используемого оружия.
За одно прохождение всей игры с дополнениями и побочными квестами с зачисткой локаций вы успеете прокачать своего персонажа приблизительно до шестидесятого уровня, что позволит полностью раскрыть один класс (маг, воин и т.п.) с несколькими лишними навыками. Поэтому спустя пару лет можно разок вернуться к ней и перепройти уже за другого драконорождённого.
Играть легко, поскольку всегда можно сохраниться или выпить зелье в режиме паузы. А чтобы из-за этого не было скучно, доступны разные уровни сложности, и только правильно прокаченный персонаж с лучшими крафтовыми вещами сможет успешно проходить на легендарном.
Русификация выполнена отлично, багов в игре мало, и на любой возникающий вопрос есть ответы в Сети. Об этом позаботилось фанатское сообщество, создавшее подробную Wiki по миру Древних Свитков.
В общем, всем приятного прохождения и FUS RO DAH!

Just didn't click with me. I get that its meant to have an amazing story, and the combat was really enjoyable, but there are a few things that really left a sour taste in my mouth which I will narrow down to two points real quick rather than go into detail:

1. If an RTX 3090 can't run this game fluidly, and an unofficial patch is needed, it means the developers does not care about this game on PC, plain and simple.
2. I looked up where I got to in my play time and it was pretty far into A playthrough (see what I did there), 5 hours is my ball park before decided whether I want to continue a game I'm not fully feeling, and this just didn't do it for me

Whilst there was definitely some good, presentation looked incredible at times, musical score excellent - I found other games like Xeboblade Chronicles 2 etc a bit more appealing to me because of how soon they could lure me into them. There's vast amounts of story here I can tell just from the number of positive reviews that ultimately that's what this game is loved for, but it seems like I have to slog through tons to actually get to the juicy bits, which I'm personally against. 

A massive pay off toward the end is great, but I've got to have a reason to want to get there, and Nier just didn't give me one

这游戏硬核得像黑魂（soullike），我非常喜欢这种拟真又刺激的感觉。经历了近60个小时的游戏，从一个菜鸟萌新，渐渐黑化成为了一个喜欢藏在暗处的老手（阴批），刚开始20小时的时间完全就是鱼肉，供怪物与猎人享用，时常被路边突然杀出的怪物打死或在路上高兴地蹦着突然被爆头，随后队友也应声倒下，体验很糟，可以说糟得一批，kd惊人地低到了0.2多（7/30），但是就凭着喜欢这种包含牛仔、老式步枪，猎人与怪物的要素坚持了下来，随着博弈水平（内心戏）与斗枪术（阴批术）的提高，这款游戏慢慢从恐怖游戏变成了竞技类（娱乐类）游戏，乐趣与体验都得到了很大的改善（版本更新也改善了性能表现，很nice）。最近在打折，萌新也比较多，想入手的现在可以入，大家都是萌新刚好公（mei）平（you）竞（pian）技（ni），我会说明天考试现在还想开一。。。算了不纠结了，开TM的。

I have played the game for around two years by now.
I have mostly played on our own Unofficial Server as I realized quite soon the Developers incapability of hosting proper servers themself - stability- and gameplay-wise.
This review ist heavily funded on my experience as an Unofficial Server Hoster and an player with over 700 play hours put into this game and also the opinions and expierences made by players of said Unofficial Servers. I also have limited knowledge of the utilized Unreal Engine 4.

The game is in a horrible state in absolutely every aspect except creature variety.

[h1]Technical Issues:[/h1]
The utilization of the famous and excellent Unreal Engine 4 is simply devastating. At release the game ran at a horrible performance even on the newest graphics cards and that has not changed mentionable since then.
The amount of video memory (VRAM) needed to run the game with high or epic textures is absurd.
No (known) game released around the same time and with that engine requires that much memory and every graphics card with >= 4 GB of VRAM should have been sufficient.
With other comparable games using the same engine and a graphics card comparable to a Geforce GTX 980, a player can expect to reach around 60 or even more FPS in certainly most cases on high settings while in Ark you will almost never reach even 40 to 45 FPS in High or even Epic.
I do not know what the Developer did to this excellent Engine to bloat it up to make it run in such a devastating performance.

[h1]Developer does horrible decisions:[/h1]
Instead of concentrating their manpower into fixing issues in the game from day 1, they instead regularly come up with another - in my very personal opinion - completely useless game mode or event. I never played Survival of the Fittest myself but watched live streams regarding it. It is nothing that is supposed to exist in this game nor is it wanted by the players who actually bought this game for the "Real Experience".

Another example of their horrible decision is their way to communicate with their players.
Back when the main map "The Island" did not have any biomes yet like the snow biome, they felt it would be a good decision to "announce" the implementation to their change log as all upcoming updates go there. What they did not mention there was a very essential detail, that player structures and tamed dinos will get eliminated at every place on the whole map, that will be changed. They wrote that very important info somewhere in a wall of text in some unimportant upcomming dino dossier, which only got read by a handful of players (aka the "really big dino nerd forum lurkers").
There was no mention of this in the change logs and not even in the game's main menu, where they regularly spam the players screen with their uninteresting news regarding boring Official Server nonsense.
This lack of communication has led some (many?) players with wet eyes in the past by getting their most beloved dinos (aka "friends") rolled over by lawines of ice. My own tribe has lost a good number of them and that would be okay, if they would have had the chance of dying in a proper game-wise fight instead of being killed by the Developers enormous incompetence. (RIP Maggy, Blue, Keko, Ichty, Janina, 4 not named stego's, Taka, Tara, Leyra and Nightwish!)
(That was also the Day I swore the Developers to be Kill-On-Sight and a lifetime ban on all our servers - not that I expect them to ever put a step on our Unofficial Servers anyway. Just know we got incredible hatred for you (game-wise).)

Another example of their evil incompetence is their decision to have many players buy this game and then suddenly getting the idea to implement EasyAntiCheat into it. EasyAntiCheat is a well known Spyware, which will spy on your computer for processes while the game is running, sending [i]potentially[/i] private informations to their Servers.
Also I feel to mention that EasyAntiCheats privacy policy is void, invalid and even illegal for at least some countries the Developers of this game sell it to - like in my case Germany.
The Developers are - of course - allowed to implement such changes to their game, but such a change of their software requires their customers to accept this change (again: in many countries with strict customer protecting laws, especially Germany) or to refund the whole game to those who do not accept it. By not doing so in such countries, the Developer acts clearly in an illegal and even criminal way. Too bad for the customers that steam does not care as steam is a US-Corporation and the USA does not care for user proective laws at all.

For further informations regarding this, please read EasyAntiCheats (most probably void!) Privacy Policy at their website: [url]https://support.easyanticheat.net/kb/privacy/[/url]
I am also willing to answer questions regarding this on PM, but will no further talk about it here as that would go too far for a review.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
In theory many aspects of the gameplay might look fine, but due to bugs and other "wanted" issues they get negated and become a problem to the player. As we're running only PvE-Servers my experience of the PvP-Aspect of the game is incredibly small and I will try to only talk about the PvE-related aspects.
We feel that many changes in the recent time only happened because of PvP.
Nerfing flying creatures that hard as the Developers just did only makes sense PvP-wise.
It also makes not much sense to spent days or weeks to hunt for the very special wyvern egg and breed it, if not even the strongest wyvern will ever be able to protect you against all those incredibly weaker creatures, which just hit on the rider instead the wyvern.
Your wyvern could kill 40 wild wyvern in a single breath? Useless, if the wild wyvern only have to hit you once with their wide-ranging area skills!
It might be less realistic, but gameplay-wise it would be better to go back how it worked in the beginning: survivors can not be attacked while riding.

Another problem is with weak creatures killing you (and your hour-long progress) just because you just got stuck somewhere where it does not make any sense without giving you a chance to get out of it. E.g. between rocks.
You can't expect an server admin to grant all players access to the fly- or ghost-commands to fix issues the Developers keep causing since the release of the game. You also can't expect the server admin to have no freetime anymore by forcing him to teleport around the ark(s), unstucking animals and players all the time.

[Will probably insert here other persistent gameplay issues later]

[h1]Administration:[/h1]
The admin commands.
The Developer has failed to give server admins proper tools to administrate their servers for [b]two years[/b] now!
[list]
[*]Godmode? You [strike]can[/strike] will still die!
[*]Teleport? You'll not appear where you tried to appear anyway.
[*]Fly? No need to put any points to movement speed then. You'll be a flying snail.
[*]Ghost? If you forget to disable it before mounting anything, you gonna have a bad time falling through the world and only a complete server-reconnect will fix it. If you are lucky. (You're mostly out of luck as an server admin.)
[*]EnableSpecator-Mode? Whats so hard to give the user back its inventory when disabling it? No. It all just gets 'destroyed'. Admin needs to check very quickly an issue of a player? Hold my beer. And my clothes. And my weapons, items, skins and food. Seriously. [redfont]John Doe has been killed by a WildCard Bug[/redfont]. Just great. Now give me back my beer please.[/list]

I could add more to this list for quite some time, but I guess you got the point.

Also, whats so hard to add some proper auto-ark-save-mechanics to the game with proper save-game-naming or at least name them with the actual server time. That would be great.

[h1]Summary:[/h1]
(I wanted to write more, but it seems I hit the text limit...)
Just do not buy it. Not in this state.

Update: ---- 

This game is made how every gamer wants to be treated. 

The developers are SOOOO progressive. It seems every thing we complain about in the game seems to get a patch fix every few weeks. There will be little things we wish were there or not there ... and poof ___an update starts ___ bam!! half of our complaints gone ... these guys are listening to thier audience and are doing a great job!!

______________________________________________________
Original Post-----

This game is solid ... most pre access games leave me in terribley buggy situations. This game in general is very stable and very playable! The feel is like DayZ but with a much faster constant combat playstyle. The controls are easy and smooth and combat is very satisfying. 

People are saying framerates are low and unoptimaized --- what people are complaing about I can relate to (mildly) I have a GTX 1060 im running the game 55-70 fps on ultra where as my little brother is running this on a old CPU and gtx 1050 and still gets 55-70 fps on medium to high. Sure its not running 120fps like my other games do --- but this is what you get for a 30$ game made by an unknown company in early access.

Pro's --- Play solo, duo or squads of 4 --- no pay to win mechanics --- fast paced --- strategic --- minor customization!

Con's/ Things that need fixing --- Grenades are clunky and take way too long to utilize in most situations especially for thier low aoe damage --- when playing in duo/squad helping kill other players with your team gives little to no assistance points 

Overall I am very pleased with where the game is at right now. Just a little bit of cleanup and polishing and I think its in a good place!!

review: j'aime
这好像是我第一个静下心来玩的游戏，挺感人的。代入感很强 不论音乐还是画风都给了我很深的触动。在绝望和希望中徘徊，最后找回自我。旅程我一个人在走 所有事物也只能陪伴短短的一程罢了。
확실히  다른게임과는 많이 다르고 그리고 어렵다 당신은 보스까지도 가기 어려울 것이다 나중에는 첫보스보다 훨씬 강한 잡몹도 나온다 하지만 그것을 극복해라 그러면 당신은 즐길수 있고 당신이 이게임을 즐기면 재미를 얻을 수 있다

[h1] НЕ ПОКУПАЙТЕ ЭТУ ИГРУ БЕГИТЕ ГЛУПЦЫ!!!
ЭТО СЛИШКОМ ЗАТЯГИВАЮЩАЯ ИГРА!!! [/h1] 
Ладно шутки шутками но так как это сразу можно понять что будет положительным обзором начну с минусов. Но Перед этим термины.
[h1] Термины: [/h1] 
Prop/Проп - Игровой объект который могут быть установлены игроком.
Entity/Энтити - Особые объекты имеющие функционал.
Ragdoll/Рагдулл - Объект имеющий кости с возможность их передвигать. Этим может быть хоть модель персонажа или-же матрас с возможность его деформировать.
Minge/Минг или-же MingeBag - Игрок чаще всего новичок. Но в большинстве случаев Рофлеры которые мешают игре. Данные игроки мешают игровому процессу чаще всего встречаются на РП серверах где они мешают ролевому процессу. До этого были известны тем что приходили на сервера и СПАМили пропами или другими объектами портя игру остальным. Так что MingeBag это термин обозначающий игрока портящий игру остальным.
[h1] Минусы: [/h1] 
1) Устаревший движок. Да да, движек 2003г из Half-Life.
1.1) Ограничения карты:
Данная проблема чуток изменилась так как в 2019г 1-2 месяца был обновлены в редакторе Hammer ограничения карты но сами размеры никак не увеличены лишь люмит на определенные функции.
Что-бы полностью исправить эту проблему стоит увеличить ограничение данного движка на создания широких карт.
1.2) Плохая оптимизация при множестве аддонов.
2) Не нужный контент на серверах в разделе "Prop". Не убираются вкладки "Аддонов" которые отсутвуют на сервере.
Для всех создателей в будущем серверов прошу найти аддон который оставляет только объекты которые есть на сервере что-бы в списке аддонов или-же просто списке были доступные объекты. Ведь искать среди скаченных аддонов нужные очень долго да и полно конфликтующий контентов которые содержат одинаковые объекты.

[h1] Плюсы: [/h1] 
Первый и единственный плюс это Моды:
Самая главная часть игры это моды. Ты можешь просто в одиночке делать разные сценки или машинуму, или-же перейти на сервера с уникальным игровыми режимами.
Разберем популярные игровые режимы:
SandBox - "Песочница" Стандартный режим. Просто строительство и бои в зависимости от правил сервера.
DarkRP - Сервера направленные на отыгрыш ролей в определенных рамках: Half-Life 2(Отыгрышь сопротивления или-же Комбайнов), средневековья, Другой игровой вселенной(The Elder Scrolls), Современности, Времен Холодной Войны и Второй Мировой, или-же Sci-Fi. На данных серверах действуют серьезные правила чем на других игровых режимах так что всегда читайте так как на каждом сервере есть свои правила а есть общепринятые.
Сервера DarkRP делятся на 4 типа: 1: На простом движке DarkRP; 2: На сворованом или скачаном из интернета; 3: На самодельной модификации DarkRP; 4) Частично самодельный и с частично купленным контентом.
Из всего этого рекомендую брать 3-4 сервера. 
Самый топовый русский DarkRP сервер это http://nxserv.eu/ - Так как он из 3 категории и имеет хорошую администрацию.
Самый не рекомендуемый сервер DarkRP это http://nexusrp.ru/ ввиду того что создатель данного сервера тот еще человек и его сервер построен только на Донате. Данный сервер тоже входит в 3 категорию серверов но имеет очень плохую администрацию. До этого имел проект под названием http://gmodrp.ru/ . После того как закрыл свой первый проект gmodrp многих игроков которые донатили ему напрямую он "послал ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥". Сказав что это другой проект но "Nexusrp" и "Gmodrp" основные DarkRP сервера ничем не отличались. Сейчас "Nexusrp" держится на второсортном S.T.A.L.K.E.R. сервере.
TTT - Среди террористов оказались предатели найдите их и убейте пока они не убил других невиновных.
Даже у этого мода есть моды: Например в одном из закрывшихся серверов была третья сторона называлась "Маньяком" целью которого было убийство всех, но он был одиночкой тем самым ему было сложнее чем "Предателям". Ведь у Предателей если было достаточно игроков на сервере были "Сообщники".
PropHunt - Делятся на две команды "Охотников" и "Пропов". Цель охотников найти и уничтожить "Пропов", а у "Пропов" спрятаться. Так-же есть простые модификации где "Пропы" должны выждать определенного момента и уничтожить "Охотников".
Stranded - Ныне мертвый игровой режим. Ранее был популярен до появления Rust от "Facepunch Studios" которые и создали Garry's Mod. Данный режим был построен на развитии и создания своего лагеря и сражению с другими.
Серьезные Roleplay сервера делятся на 2 движка:
Но никто не отменяет того что на DarkRP будет серьезный сервер.
NutScript - Особый игровой движок для сложных РП серверов. Попроще ClockWork но имеет слабую защиту.
ClockWork - Особый игровой движок для сложных РП серверов. Имеет высокую защиту но платный по сравнению с NutScript и более нагружающие игрока.
На данных серверах действуют более серьезные правила чем на обычных DarkRP так как на этих движках есть возможность создать более одного персонажа(В некоторых серверах доступен лишь 1). Ввиду этого часто требует то что-бы для каждой фракции/расы на данных серверах был отдельный персонаж и нету возможности быстро сменить фракцию а лишь через РП отыгрышь или заявку/квенту на определенном ресурсе.

Apart from the poor optimization of the game (given that I run a GTX 1060 6gb with i5-7500 cpu, 1TB of space and 8gb RAM and still get 30 fps on medium settings) it's already very fun to play. I don't think I even have an hour of recorded game time and I already love it. It is indeed extremely different, though. Sneaking, running, climbing, attacking, animus pulse (kind of a setback for me but I can adapt quickly), everything. You definitely will have a hard time at first. Then again, who likes an easy game? I just hope there will be a graphics update even though I've never paid attention as to whether Ubisoft actually updates Assassin's Creed games once they have been released. All in all, you better have one mean son of a bitch of a computer if you want that game to run smoothly on Very High settings. I definitely recommend it nonetheless.

This is the worst version of one of the best games of all time.
The filters that are forced on are awful, they somehow messed up the title screen, the framerate is ridiculous, and collisions are effected by the texture loading, leading to just a rough product.
This is by far my favourite game of all time, and this is the worst version yet, even compared to the Android version and the PlayStation port from PS1.
Do not buy this until it is clear that they have invested more than nothing into porting this game to PC. Buy the DS version on Amazon, or if you dont mind intense loading buy it on PSN. Steam is not the way to play this game on PC, even a crappy emulator runs this better and more accurately to the original.

I play this game for TTT. TTT is the best mod/gamemode/whateveridontcareaboutclassifications ever and you should buy this game just for that, even if you can only play on...Minecraft Servers. Like me. It's still fun.

Não costumo fazer análise de jogos, porém precisei tirar um tempo para compartilhar sobre esse. Que obra prima!

Tem todos os elementos de um bom roguelike: progressão fantástica (você se sente poderoso à medida que progride), grande variedade de poderes, de inimigos, de armas e de salas, vários sistemas de upgrades, entre outros. Todos esses pontos dão ao jogo uma imensa rejogabilidade. 

O combate é fluido e extremamente divertido, e o jogo, apesar de estar em Early Access, é tão polido que dá gosto de ver. Você tem acesso a várias armas, e depois ainda é possível dar características únicas a cada uma delas, então dá pra ter várias abordagens em relação aos inimigos e bosses para cada arma escolhida.

As falas são simplesmente incríveis, nunca vi um jogo com tanta variedade nesse sentido (consigo contar as vezes em que houve repetição). A ambientação toda do jogo é baseada na mitologia grega, então todos os personagens, mapas e poderes são construídos nessa perspectiva. Porém o jogo distorce (positivamente) esse mundo, dando personalidades únicas e hilárias a cada um dos personagens, e cada um dos diálogos possui um toque de humor que dá um carisma e leveza surpreendentes (também positivamente) a esses personagens e ao clima do jogo no geral.

Os gráficos são bem bonitos e dão uma excelente clareza do que está acontecendo na tela. Os controles são extremamente precisos, de modo que é muito difícil conscientemente culpar o jogo quando você faz besteira. A interface é bem construída e intuitiva e cada habilidade e poder é muito bem explicado.

Se você gosta de jogos como "Binding of Isaac" e "Risk of Rain", pode ter certeza que esse jogo é um "must buy" para você. E mesmo que não curta ou costume jogar esse estilo, ainda assim sugiro que dê uma chance a esse jogo, que foi feito com tanto amor e dedicação por parte da Supergiant que chega a ser um absurdo.

I am a long term Simmer since the original "The Sims" was released back in the day. Sims 3 was and is my absolute favourite iteration because of Create-A-World above all its many other atrractions. I spent more time creating Worlds for my Sims to live in than actually playing the game.

I also loved Roller Coaster Tycoon 3 + Soaked and Wild. I spent HOURS and hours building theme parks and watching the Peeps enjoy my creations.....

PLANET COASTER satisfies both my creative urges AND my desire for a more up to date Roller Coaster Park simulator!
I thought RCTW was going to be the one and bought it in EA..... sadly it wasn't. Hence my reluctance to buy another EA game in the genre....My only regret is that I didn't buy Planet Coaster sooner (if not first)!.

It looks beautiful. Runs smoothly (so far). The creative potential is staggering and I have only scratched the surface so far, created a little Pirate Themed area with Eateries and Loos (restrooms) lol with palms, rocks and water features. Plus a tableau with animatronic Soldiers and Pirates and bubble emitters to entertain the Peeps while they queue for the adjacent ride.... I love the expressions of the Peeps when they encounter the bubbles you can quite clearly see if they like it or not lol.. Spent over an hour this morning just following the Peeps around. Love their expressions!!.

10 out of 10 will happily shower Peeps with bubbles again!

A RECOMMENDATION AND A WARNING:

Hollow Knight is one of the most polished platformers I've had the chance to play. You get smooth gameplay, lots of places to go and people (bugs) to see, all served with nifty graphics and a beautiful soundtrack.

That being said: I just finished with the default ending, and I'm probably only going to play this once.

The game is tough, but fair, right until you notice that there are relatively few checkpoints for saving. This isn't a problem in the first part of the game where life is easy. But unless you're a hardcore gamer, afterwards this often means if you're having trouble with a boss or a difficult area in general, you're going to have to run through the same rooms many times, in the end doing it in your sleep. And If you're looking to get to a specific boss or place which you couldn't get to before, 50% of the time you're in for a long trek, especially if it's far away from a Stag Station. You'll be facing the exact same enemies in the exact same places and hopefully not dying at the end of it all by falling in a pool of acid.
The weird thing is that you can gain the ability to teleport, which is brilliant (see the reasons above). But it is introduced pretty late in the game, and only works one way. Definitely better than nothing, but having this early on in the game and making it a two-way gate would have been great, imo.

Despite the hype, Hollow Knight is a very classic platforming bosskiller. Nothing new under the sun here.

So TLDR: if you don't mind the grind and you're looking for something hard, classic and tuned, this game is for you. 8/10 from me.

I'm just here to leave an upvote for this stunning game. First time in years that I've played a game to completion twice in a row. This is, except for minor flaws regarding the backtracking for the 100% runs (you need to use the wiki at some point, which is kinda sad), a perfect metroidvania. And it has quickly become one of my favorite games of all time. Great combat system, amazing artwork. The music is beyond everything I've heard in a video game before. The story, at times confusing, reveals itself as a genius masterpiece once you put together all the puzzle pieces.

Buy this game.

If you like CoD, you'll love this game.
If you hate CoD, this won't make you love it.

Also ignore all the people saying it runs crappy, I have a 4 core and a basic 970 and it runs smooth 60 fps like butter.

Честно говоря, я малость разочарована. По-моему СУБЪЕКТИВНОМУ мнению - сюжет не очень. Я ждала чего-то большего чем [spoiler] тупая сопливая история барменши лесбиянки [/spoiler]. Кхм. Возможно, звучит грубо - но так оно и есть. Да, присутствует доля мистицизма (совсем малая [spoiler] персонаж Анна [/spoiler], ну и всё. А так, мы действительно живём жизнью бармена, да в киберпанке (что само по-себе вроде бы интересно), но все же довольно обыденно. Все те же проблемы у типичных людей/гибридов/ии, что и у простых смертных сейчас - любовные, семейные, экономические дрязги. В этой игре определенным минусом для меня служит довольно сильное ЛЕСБИЙСКОЕ давление (ага). Да, я видела значок ЛГБТ на странице в магазине, и не имела ничего против, но здесь - это основная сюжетная линия. И именно лесбийская (гетеро и геи парочка есть, и то, такое ощущение, что это считается отстоем, а так 90% акцента на лесбийстве), то бишь игра нацелена на мужскую аудиторию (любители юри вошли в чат), как и в прочем все аниме-новеллы с тянками. Я надеялась, что в этой новелле будет по другому, какой-нибудь супер детективный, мистический сюжет... Но нет, все довольно скудно. Так, сплошная стена хейта, где же плюсы? Плюсы у игры есть и сыграть в нее стоит! Погнали:
- Симулятор Бармена - после игры вы 100% захотите стать барменом, так как игра очень лампово преподносит эту деятельность (что, конечно, идёт в абсолютный разрез с реальностью).
- Геймлей - он тут есть, помимо листания текста, вам нужно угадывать, какие напитки делать и самому их, так сказать, замешивать, что довольно увлекательно (но к концу игры устаешь).
- Пиксельная графика - я очень люблю пиксельную графику, здесь отличный дизайн, интересные персонажи, все яркое и интересное, пиксельная анимация тоже хороша.
- Музыка - она заслуживает отдельного внимания. Много композиций на любой вкус и цвет, отлично передающих атмосферу (и пиксильность :D) игры, которые вы сами в праве выбирать, в каком порядке слушать.

流程不算太长，结合游戏内容来看感觉这个价格还是偏贵。
在战斗系统上，基本上就是等别人出完招再打就行了，难度不是很大，技能盾真是个好东西，开了盾上去A就行了，另外这里面耐力很重要，建议多点一些。
武器系统上比较单调，近战就四类，单手刀，双手刀（格挡/用好之后无敌），棒子（击晕），小刀（吸蓝），这里面的枪械，我个人感觉不是特别鸡肋，满级霰弹枪打boss还是挺痛的，主要是子弹限制的原因，打小怪感觉浪费，打boss又感觉不够。可以试一下全堆弹药，说不定可以把BOSS射死。
地图没有传送，只能自己跑路。顺便一提地图指引有的地方也很迷。
NPC的形象做得还比较丰满，其中有几个故事挺有趣的，我推荐还是少杀NPC，毕竟死一个少一个。另外NPC给的经验炒鸡多，一个不杀确实打起来有点难受，尤其是打BOSS，那个麦卡勒姆三刀我就没了啊。当然多打打小怪还是能打过去的，没多么难。
DLC的话，玩了游戏后感觉不是很需要

I saw that a trial version was available for free, so I thought "What the heck, it can't be as bad as everyone is making it out to be. What have I got to lose?" The answer? My time.

I loaded up the game and watched the intro movie. Awesome, right? Same style of over the top, Zhao Yun-focused intro we're all used to. I actually smiled. I actually thought that this might not be so bad....but then I started playing the game. Story mode to be specific. Where do I begin?

The graphics - Acceptable from afar. Terrible up close. A long-time gripe from DW critics. It's usually not that much of an issue for me, but really guys....with all settings on the highest, this game shouldn't look like something you might have played back in 2005. Okay, maybe that's over exaggerating. Let me rephrase. On the surface, just generally glancing around, this game looks fine, but if you actually stop to look at something, it looks bad.

The voice acting - When I heard people saying things like "The English voice acting is so bad." I thought to myself "Ahhh that's just the old DW style! The "so bad it's good" voice acting! But as my chosen hero, Guan Yu, uttered his first line of dialogue, I almost recoiled in horror. I would have liked to think that, as passionate developers who love their franchise (as they SURELY must be), they would put at least a little effort into employing voice actors that closely resembled those of past games. This was not the case. Zhang Fei opened his mouth, and as he did so, my jaw dropped. "Are they even trying?", I thought. Some time later I heard Zhang Jiao say something. I don't recall what it was, but I do remember VIVIDLY  my thoughts after hearing it. "They're not even trying." The voice acting in this game truly is horrendous. I think back to my first foray into the DW world, at DW3. The voice acting back then, at face (or ear?) value, was bad, sure. But Sun Tsu be damned if it wasn't PASSIONATE (and hilarious)! DW9 hasn't a modicum of that passion. It feels like they just said "Eh, they'll do.", to the first people who showed up for the roles.

Animation - In cutscenes, it's partly alright and partly WTF. When a peasant comes running up to your group of heroes and you all turn to them in unison like you've got poles shoved up your backside and someone behind the scenes is rotating you all into position....that's one of those WTF moments. Sadly it seemed to be pretty freqent. Other times your characters face might be smiling, and then instantly turn into a frown. Did someone just stop time for everyone but that one character, and tell them that they hated their mother and then set time back in action, leaving us, the viewers, wondering what just happened? Who knows. All I know is, that kinda split-second emotional change ain't normal.

Tutorial menus - I decided it was high time to just get down to what DW does best. Hackin' and slashin' some enemies. But wait, a tutorial. And another tutorial. And another. And another......AND an-STOP! I should not have to go through 50 damn tutorials just to go into battle! I get it....they're trying their hand at being an RPG, and with that, comes new mechanics that need to be explained. But let me just say, it's not right for DW. I just want to kill bad guys, not spend 20 minutes reading page after page of tutorial info. Keep it simple. The older games in the series just let you get into battle without too much of a fuss. This game throws 8 different menus at you, each with 5 tutorials on how to use them because they're so convoluted. Like I said, keep it simple!

After finally going through all of those darn tutorials, I was free to enter my first battle.....after about 5 minutes on horse back. People have said, in regards to this game's open world-ness, that it's very empty and with little to do. I absolutely agree. So I turned on the auto-pathing thing they have, thinking at least if it was boring, I could make the game do it for me. Wrong. Smacking into trees was an acceptable annoyance, as it didn't really slow you down. But running into a barracade and being unable to move is not acceptable at all, especially given how much it happend in my short time of playing.

So I finally get into combat, and the combat itself is very different. Not bad different, but I find myself thinking of that saying "If it's not broken, don't fix it." They wanted to try something new, but as with the majority of this game, I personally don't think that it was the right choice.

At this point, I was genuinely upset, because I found myself thinking that I can't wait to stop playing. After about 17 years of playing DW games, from 2-8 (I did skip 6) never had I found myself feeling that way. I LOVE DW. It has been a constant game over the years of my life, and I thoroughly enjoyed them, but not DW9. I felt that it lacked passion. I felt it was not polished. I felt that it was not the DW I grew up loving.

If the devs come away with anything from this game, I hope that they have learned that this experiment was a failed one, and that their tried and true methods in the games of old are what really works for this series. DW is not meant to be an RPG. 

That's my opinion anyway. As an avid fan of Dynasty Warriors, I cannot reccomend this game.
