I have quite a bit of history with truck driving simulators since the days of SCS Software's 18 Wheels of Steel franchise. When I first heard of American Truck Simulator, I just about flipped my lid. I've been lookin forward to a revival of 18 Wheels of Steel for quite some time, and this game is more than likely what SCS wanted their original franchise to be. The game uses the same engine as Euro Truck Simulator 2, but there are minor gameplay differences from this and Euro Truck Simulator 2. Two of the most obvious things this game does differently from ETS2 is it's of course, set in the United States.

Just a side note, I really hope SCS brings back some of the features from 18 Wheels of Steel like being able to drive through Canada and Mexico.

Anyways, the gameplay is different from ETS2. Namely, you see police cars patrolling the highways and city streets, which, I should add as a warning for those who are NOT from the US that play this game: Police cars in the United States have radar built into the vehicles, so just like in real life, they CAN detect if you're speeding even when driving through the oncoming lane. While this is annoying, it does simulate police car radar, and they WILL fine you if you are speeding. Another thing that's different is all 50 US states have laws permitting drivers to make a right turn at a red light, while in Europe, this is either NOT permitted at all, or permitted only in certain areas. However, unlike this game, there are many real life locations in many US cities that have those hated signs that say "NO TURN ON RED" at intersection. Those do not exist in this game, so you will never have to worry about being fined for an illegal turn on red. However, for a right turn on red to be "legal" in the game, you have to have came to a complete stop at the itersection with your turn signal on, be in the rightmost lane on the road you're on, while yielding to traffic before executing the turn, just like in real life.

Another thing that is different in this game than ETS2 is there are weight stations throughout the map. Just like in real world American trucking, the United States Department of Transportation mandates that all freight trucks must be weighed to make sure they are within both federal and state weight regulations, or be faced a fine. If you are overweight, you will be fined (Although I have yet, as of the writing of this review been fined for driving overweight. SCS might not have this as an actual mechanic in the game, but if it is, consider this a friendly heads-up). If you do not stop at the weigh station when it is open you will be fined. That being said, just like in real life, the weigh stations are open from a certain time, and close at a certain time. However, if the stations is not closed, you WILL weight that truck or be fined.

Another side note: If you are driving a truck without a trailer, which is often called "bobtailing" in American truck slang (Not sure if it's also used in Europe), you are NOT required to use a weight station.

Another thing that is taken from real life and put into this game is driver fatigue, just like in ETS2. Just like in ETS2, there is a setting where you can turn it off.

The game's current state only has California, Nevada and Arizona as US states that you can go to, but SCS plan on adding the entire continental US, with my hopes being they will add Canada, Mexico, and some of the US's territories like Puerto Rico. That being said, I highly recommend buying this game, but at the same time, there is a very limited amount of map even with Arizona. I bought this game knowing how much map there is to start, but I honestly recommend buying this after some more US states are released. I really recommend buying this after a minimum of five US states (including California, Arizona and Nevada) are featured within the game.

[h1] Quicky [/h1] 

[b] Saints Row 3 is a solid game, which I seriously recommend to anyone interested in the Open World genre and who are just looking for a fun experience, solo or co-op. [/b] 

[h1] Long Version [/h1] 


[b] Gameplay [/b] 

Controls in SR3 are fluent and responsive. Activities are expansive and genuinely fun. (besides insurance fraud, I can never seem to get a good momentum going for it.). Cars feel kind of "floaty", but it's something you get use to quickly. Large amount of customisation in terms of your character, cars and clothing. (yet I can't find any good clothes or a good look for my male character, might just be me.) 
AI isn't all that amazing, they do take cover and all, but most of the games difficulty comes from either them swarming you down or the specials, like the brutes or cyber ninjas, whom also help keep the game fresh. Your teammates on the other hand are completely retarded- they hardly ever kill enemies, they are completely useless against specials and if you're in a car waiting for your teammate and that teammate is under attack, you're done for. (Especially in an event like Trafficking, where the AI has to drive the car and you can't drive for shit.)
Missions are great fun and well built, with every mission being different. Guns are sluggish and weak at the start (as expected), but after a few upgrades, you'll be mowing down enemies and shredding specials in no time.   

Don't expect anything close to realistic here. 

[b] Atmosphere [/b] 

Atmosphere in SR3 for the most part is pretty good. Graphics are quite nice and cartoony and the games looks grand when it's night-time or when it rains, but don't expect anything Crysis 2 or even GTA IV level here. Cutscenes are pretty rough, especially when they do close-up shots of the characters. NPC's and vehicles pop up noticeably when driving, but at least it isn't SR2 level horrible, where the cars despawn the minute you turn your back. There are some smaller touches that are quite nice though, like how NPC's take out their umbrellas when it rains or how you can sometimes come across police officers arresting people. Voice acting is superb. (Even the zombie voice actor is spot on, he's my favorite.) I especially love hearing the commentary of the two announcers when playing Professor Genki's Super Ethical Reality Climax. 
You also have a wide range of music on the radio, ranging from Classical music to my beloved Metal Rock.  

[b] Story [/b] 

Story is pretty straight forward. You're the notorious leader of the Saints and are on a quest to conquer Steelport and get revenge for those responsible for "killing" Gat ( *wink wink* (; ) and crashing the guys funeral, I mean that's just rude. Don't expect anything huge or worth noting here, the games priority was gameplay first, story second. There are sections in the game where you're given a choice, but these are nothing more than small boosts to certain things, like getting extra respect or extra money. These don't effect the ending at all, besides the very last choice, which is a nice welcome. 

[h1] Final Thoughts [/h1] 

The game is a solid shooter, offering up a lot of hours of great murdering fun. While the story isn't all that interesting, it keeps the game moving and the content in this is impressive considering the price point. If you're here for a good deep story, you should probably look into the Grand Theft Auto series, for everyone else who are just looking for a good time, definitely pick this up. 

[b] It lasted me about 30 hours, with completing all the side activities and taking over the city included. (80% done on my save). Heck, I'm even going for another playthrough. Definitely pick this game up, it's worth it. [/b]

İlk başta oyunu alırken tereddüt ettim. 3 arkadaşım ile beraber aldım en sonunda. Ve parasını sonuna kadar hak eden bir oyun. Daha yeni başladım, keşfedeceğim çok şey var. Bir arkadaşıma daha aldık oyunu benden sonra. Oyunda yaptıklarınızın sınırı yok denecek kadar. Dur bi görev daha, 5 dakika daha diye diye oynar durursunuz. Arkadaşınız yoksa biraz sıkıcı olabiliyor bazen. Onun dışında sesli sohbet ortamında görev yapmak ve çatışmak gerçekten çok keyifli. Grafikler gayet tatmin edici. Özellikle arabalar :) Eviniz, garajınız, şirketiniz var. Daha ne olsun. Oyunu alacaklara en az 3.5m ile almalarını tavsiye ederim. Para o kadar zor kasılmıyor. Hiç almazsanız başlangıçta zorlanırsınız. Arkadaşınız yoksa dahada zor.
Benim puanım 10/9

Amazing game, Built on the same engine as their previous fps Insurgency it provides crisp imagery and wonderful response times to aiming down the sights. the image in image scopes are also a very nice touch i am very interested to see how this game developes further. 
 
PS Developers if you guys read these at all i would be super stoke (and im sure others would be) if you added some more nationalitys to the game. Such as the Japanese and the Russians maybe even Austrailians. it would add some combat situations that actually happened in the war and i beleive that other WWII games havent explored, my examples being combat between the U.K and Japanese Forces in the pacific theatre and Russian vs German forces in the eastern front. it would ad some interesting gameplay aswell as i feel that the IJN and the UK have very balanced weapons torward each other  so the combat wouldnt feel to one sided (such as in Rising Storm when BARS cut you down when your toting a T38 Arisaka frequently). thank you guys again for an amazing game i hope you take my suggestions into consideration i beleive that it would add to an already amazing product

Good game, the mods for this game are wildly fun and really make this game enjoyable. Granted, there is a few days after an update where not many mods will be updated but there are still good mods. To name a few I enjoyed most when playing either by myself or with friends: 
*Coloured Buttons
*Player-Led Peace Conferences
*The Road to 56
*Increased Division Limit
*Old World Blues
*Realistic Production Pack
*Realistic Production Naval
*Realistic Production Aircraft
*Realistic Production Motorized
*Realistic Production Infantry Equipment
*Realistic Tank Production
*Turkey Rework
*TNO Style Map
*Accurate french division voices
*Extended and streamlined production
*Custom rules for all
*Better National Focuses
*(Just about every portrait mod)
This game really is fun but if you must do one thing, I found that the music in the game is too ominous and if you are like me who enjoys music while they play then play that instead. Or you could listen to a Podcast, two that I found that work well are the Official Podcast and the Joe Rogen Podcast. You'll want a podcast where the people don't constantly talk over each other.

Just stop it, and patch out the Creation Club.  It is insulting to real modders and PC gamers in general.  Please keep this out of PC gaming.  Skyrim is not the absolute greatest but it is one one of the most respected games in the PC platform.  I cannot recommend this title until whoever came up with Creation Club stops meddling with such a popular game amongst PC gamers and Creation Club is removed.  Please Bethesda, whoever is in charge of it, just stop it.  It will never work.  Creation Club is buggy and breaks other free mods, the PC gamer community who has been getting good mods for free will never support such a disconnected initiative, please listen to your audience and stop milking Skyrim.  As a united front, we pushed this back before, and yet you try again.  I will change this review once Bethesda removes Creation Club.  This is not a casual mobile game, it is Skyrim.  Remove Creation Club and leave Skyrim, Skyrim SE and Fallout free to be modded by real modders, do not interfere, or try to sell bad, broken mods when  we get good ones for free.

Итак, что можно сказать про эту игру? То, что лично мне она понравилась настолько, что я решил поделиться своим мнением.

Итак, из плюсов.
1 - Ощущение себя "первооткрывателем". Каждая миссия генерирует свою карту. Теперь ты не заучиваешь по 100 раз что и где лежит - ты каждый раз открываешь для себя новые и новые глубины, а так же стараешься озаботится тем, как ты будешь возвращаться обратно. Хотя, если ты играешь с кем-то - то это скорее всего не твой вопрос))
2 - Возможность играть не только в одиночку (в компании с забавным и местами "зубастым" роботом), но и скооперироваться с друзьями или случайными людьми. А так - как оно пойдёт) Где-то каждый строго играет свои роли, кто-то веселиться или же просто бегут всей толпой туда, куда сердце (и миссия) подскажет)
3 - РПГ составляющая и немного "атмосферная" база. Вы можете настраивать своего персонажа, точнее - одного из персонажей, ибо всего 4 роли и у каждой герой выглядит иначе. В процессе настройки Вы можете создать свою, уникальную, внешность. И не забываем о прокачке! Оружие, снаряжение, робота... и даже кирку! Всё это Вы, естественно вкладывая заработанные кредиты и деньги, можете прокачать.

Минусы.
1 - База. Она очень маленькая, очень скучная и... там не хочется оставаться надолго. При желании её можно облазить вдоль и поперёк за 30-40 минут. Да, она вписывается в атмосферу - там есть бар, есть мед отсек, в котором очухиваетесь после очередной проваленной миссии, есть личный отсек и пара мест, которые можно посмотреть-поглядеть... и всё.
2 - Монстры. О да, с ними весело, они иногда подстраивают коварные нападения - чего стоит только внезапно вылезший из-под ног взрывающийся жук... Но к этому быстро привыкаешь, нет какого-то чувства обречённости или ужаса, и вылезший жук вызывает лишь чувство "эк... опять рабооота"
3 - Реиграбельность. Да, миссии интересны, веселы и тд... Но только первые пару десятков раз. Потом становится скучно и возникают вопросы - кто нас сюда послал? Зачем мы постоянно копаем? Куда это всё потом девается? Почему наш арсенал настолько ограничен? И почему мы не можем побродить по какой-нибудь планете, где есть луна и солнце и другие твари, кроме этих опостылевших жуков?

Подводя итог.
Игра - весёлая, местами затягивает. Можно поиграть и поприкалываться пару вечеров самому или с друзьями. Поверьте - друг, падающий в лавовый гейзер из-за Вашей гранаты или случайно сорвавшийся из-за Вашей "помощи" в глотку здоровенному жуку - это бесценно! 
Но для постоянной и монотонной игры она не подходит

Since I've logged more than two thousand hours on this game, I might as well leave a review.

I love the game's wide open atmosphere and spend much of my time billy goating through the landscapes just to look at them. Hearthfire's homes have allowed me to have limitless places to also store my horded item... er... treasures. My many lovely treasures without worrying about losing them... often.

There have been some physics issues, one in particular being when I kill an enemy and rather than falling on the ground where I can happily loot his corpse, he will fly up to the ceiling and cling to it like there is no gravity and everything is madness. Thankfully there hasn't been any boss or important kills that have done this and I've been able to get most items properly. 

That being said... this game has been out for years and most of the basic glitches have never been fixed. Hence, I refused to pay the initial sixty dollars and waited until I could buy this game and it's expansions for twenty. For that twenty dollars, I'm rather happy with the piece and enjoy frolicking through Skyrim. However, if I'd paid sixty? The bugs would piss me off.

Některé úkoly jsou výborné, některé hodně slabé. Klasicky jako u jiných dílů, ale zlepšení tady je. Celkově bych ale Origins doporučil.

官方什么时候能像ori一样出个休闲玩家适用的简单难度...目前版本存档点少，鹿角站少，前期钱少，血量少，攻击威力小，boss血量高各种技能...
好吧总的来说还是自己手残，但如果你还没有购买游戏并且认为画风很可爱像ori一样，你就错了。空洞骑士这个游戏难度绝对比ori高。
如果官方持续更新一定是年度十佳了，游戏内容十分充实，玩了十几小时还在泪之城呢（笑）

Fantastic game. One of the best games I've ever played.  Every single choice you make affects how the game will be played in the future.  It has a great story and characters that are, for the most part, easy to attach yourself to.  Another thing I enjoyed is that this game SHOWS how quickly people would turn on each other in the event of an apocaplypse.

  In terms of gameplay, not much. You walk around rooms, solve issues and talk to people. That being said the story makes that okay.  When you have a game as story driven as the walking dead, gameplay isn't a huge dilemma. Granted then when moments of gameplay come up, decisions are vital.  Parts come up where you must chose who lives and who dies, and though it is a hard choice, you must choose quickly.    

Over all, Fantastic. I highly recommend it. If you really like good storylines and charcters worth loving, this is a game for you.

Dear Crytek,
Hunt Showdown is a excellent game, but needs fixes. To begin with, when I tried the game, (I played 2 matches) I found 0 players in both of them. I doubt wether it was the players who where camping or the servers matching too little players, so that one needs really quick a fix. Secondly, the server delay is huge, i calculated it at roughly 160 ms. I have a bad internet connection, but not so, in other games my max ping is 110. So, please check and try to fix any occuring server problems.
The game is really innovative as a concept, which i really like which means finally we can have a good game without the battle royale trend, which I really appreciate. For those who are asking wether the game is worth bying the answer is absolutely yes. Although it might need some fixes, I think that Crytek will take care of them really soon and pull the game out of early access really soon.

                                                                                                                                                      With regards,
                                                                                                                                                        Deadmeme5
